loans.name: Milton Eliezer

texts.es: EL SEÑOR MILTON ELIEZER A. TIENE 22 AÑOS DE EDAD, ESTA CASADO, AUN NO TIENEN HIJOS.  EL SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE HUEVOS, TIENE UNA PEQUEÑA GRANJA EN DONDE TIENE A SUS GALLINAS DESDE QUE SON PEQUEÑAS HASTA QUE EMPIEZAN A PONER LOS HUEVOS, EL CUENTA QUE LAS CUIDA Y LES DA SUS ALIMENTOS MIENTRAS VAN CRECIENDO Y ASI DESPUES OBTIENE LA RECOMPENSA DE SU ESFUERZO, EL ESTA SOLICITANDO ESTE CREDITO PARA COMPRAR GALLINAS YA GRANDES  QUE ESTEN LISTAS PARA PONER LOS HUEVOS,  ASI VE MUCHO MAS RAPIDO LA RECUPERACION DE SU CAPITAL INVERTIDO YA QUE INMEDIATAMENTE EL VENDE LOS HUEVOS, AHORA TIENE MAS DEMANDA DE HUEVOS YA QUE HAY MUCHAS TIENDAS Y PERSONAS QUE LE COMPRAN LOS CARTONES DE HUEVOS, GRACIAS A DIOS LE HA IDO BIEN, EL ESTA SEGURO QUE ESTE CREDITO LE SERÀ DE MUCHO BENEFICIO  YA QUE TIENE MUCHOS SUEÑOS Y PROYECTOS,  EL CONFIA  QUE SU NEGOCIO VA A PROSPERAR AUN MAS CON ESTE CREDITO Y VA A OBTENER MAS GANANCIA Y ASI CUMPLIR CON SUS METAS.
texts.en: Milton Eliezer A. is 22 years old; he is married, but the couple does not have children. He sells eggs. He has a small farm where he raises hens from the time they are little until they start laying eggs. He says that he cares for them and gives them what they need while they are growing, and then he is rewarded for his work. He is requesting this loan to purchase hens who are already grown, who are ready to start laying eggs. This is so he will recuperate his investment much more quickly since he will immediately sell the eggs. These days there is more demand for eggs since there are many stores and people who buy cartons of eggs. Thanks to God, things have gone well for Milton; he is sure that this loan will help him greatly, since he has so many dreams and projects. He said that his business will prosper even more with this loan and he will have more income so he will be able to achieve his goals.

loans.use: Purchase laying hens

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María es una mujer emprendedora, con mucho deseo de seguir trabajando aunque es de edad muy avanzada. Su negocio que inicio hace varios años la venta de ropa, zapatos, peluches que junto a Afodenic ha logrado prosperar debido a su tenacidad de venta como atreves de los financiamientos que la institución ha otorgado. 
Ya que cuando inicio lo hizo con poco dinero y con ayuda de su esposo, una vez que opto al crédito todo marcho mejor ya que logro vender más, lograr captar sus clientes, y es con lo que ha alimentado a sus hijos.
Hoy en día, casi todos sus hijos trabajan y la ayudan económicamente lo que está contenta.
Con este préstamo invertirá en ropa, zapatos y productos de cosméticos Avon. Ya que parte de sus ventas,  el setenta por ciento son al crédito y por encargos lo que le pagan a la quincena y va moviendo su capital.
texts.en:
Maria is an enterprising woman who really wants to continue working even though her age is so advanced. The business she started several years ago sells clothes, shoes, and stuffed animals, which, along with Kiva partner Afodenic, has prospered thanks to her tenacity in selling and the loans that the organization authorized.

When she started the business, she did it with little money and with the help of her husband. Once she took a loan, everything went better because she was able to sell more and attract more customers. Through this she has supported her children.

Nowadays, almost all of her children work and help her financially, so she is content.

With this loan, she will invest in clothes, shoes, and Avon cosmetics. Seventy percent of her sales are made on credit, which are paid within two weeks, so she has cash flow.

loans.use: She sells cosmetics, clothes and shoes, which she wants to stock up more on so she will have better sales and help herself more, since everything costs so much.

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.en:
Nadezhda is single. She is a market entrepreneur from Pavlograd. Nadezhda sells perfumes, cosmetics, personal care products, etc. in the central marketplace of her home town. Today Nadezhda owns a container-store. Container-stores are large metal shipping containers often used for overseas shipping. They can be used for storage, but make an ideal shelter for market vendors to sell merchandise from. Nadezhda started her enterprise only 2 years ago. However, she has already invested about 26,000 Grivnyas in this business. Her proceeds are about 16,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Nadezhda is seeking a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to purchase additional merchandise and increase her working capital as a result. Nadezhda rents an apartment and lives on her own separately from her parents. Increased inventory turnover will generate the necessary funds to sustain her business as well as meet her daily needs.

loans.use: to increase her working capital

loans.name: Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
Esta  foto fue tomada en el negocio de la Sra. Emma M. M., la cual es integrante del grupo “Guadalupe” que está ubicado en el Estado de  Puebla, en México. En la foto se ve claramente como elabora  antojitos típicos, los cuales se dedica a vender desde hace 16 años. 

Doña Emma tiene muchos clientes que le compran  antojitos, tanto para comer allí como para llevar a sus casas,   porque están hechos con productos  naturales y  además de que son muy ricos y a precio accesible. 
Ella se siente contenta con su crédito, ya que le agrada la idea de que alguien confíe en ella,  que tiene 40 años  y tuvo la oportunidad de cursar solo  hasta el sexto grado de primaria, lo cual no le ha impedido salir adelante y luchar para darle a su hija  una vida mejor.

Con el crédito ella piensa  seguir invirtiendo en su negocio de antojitos así como empezar a comprar diversas mercancías para complementar y fortalecer su negocio y también poder vender jugos, refrescos y tortillas.
texts.en:
This photo was taken at Emma's place of business. She is a member of the Guadalupe group, which is located in the state of Puebla in Mexico. In the photo you can see clearly how she makes typical snacks, which she have been selling for 16 years.

Emma has many customers who buy snacks, both to eat there and to take home, because the snacks are made from natural ingredients, in addition to being very tasty and well priced.

Emma is happy with this loan because it makes her feel like somebody trusts her. She is 40 years old and only had the opportunity to finish sixth grade, but this has not stopped her from succeeding and fighting to give her daughter a better life.

With this loan, she will invest in her snack business by beginning to buy different types of merchandise in order to complement and bolster her business and also be able to sell juice, soda, and tortillas.

loans.use: Invest in their businesses.

loans.name: Josefina Aquino

texts.es: Para la señora Josefina Aquino, quien tiene 49 años de edad,  comenta que su vida siempre la ha dedicado al comercio, ella nos comenta que vende ropa típica,  los fines de semana en la puerta de su casa juntamente con sus frutas pero viaja 3 veces por semana a otro departamento para la venta de ropa típica, ella se siente realizada ya que con el apoyo que recibe del crédito a través de sus ganancias ella sigue pagando la compra de  su casa que es su mayor sueño y que está casi por terminar, y el dedicarse a su negocio también ayuda económicamente a su hermana al cuidado de sus 4 sobrinos ya que ella es soltera y dice ver lejos la posibilidad de formar su propio hogar, y hacer lo que hace la hace feliz.
texts.en: Josefina Aquino, 49 years old, says that her life has always been dedicated to sales. She tells us that she sells typical clothing on the weekends out of the doorway of her home along with fruit, but she travels three times each week to another department (county) to sell typical clothing. She feels fulfilled because with the help of the loan she received as well as through her revenue, she can continue paying off her house, which is her greatest dream, and she is almost done paying for it. By working in her business, she is also helping her sister financially to care for her four nieces/nephews since her sister is single and, Josefina says, far from being able to afford her own home and do what makes her happy.

loans.use: Purchase typical clothing

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married with a 10-year-old daughter. She is a small entrepreneur from Berdyansk, in the southern part of Ukraine. Tatyana sells children’s clothes in the local market called ‘Privoz’. Her kiosk is well-known for regular additions of trendy merchandise, as well as her reasonable pricing policy and wise customer service. Tatyana is an experienced market vendor – she has been in the trade for 11 years. 

Presently, Tatyana has 25,000 Grivnyas in turnover capital. Her income amounts to 12,000 Grivnyas a month. Tatyana is requesting a 4,500 Grivnya loan to purchase additional merchandise and improve selection of products for sale in her kiosk.

loans.use: to diversify assorted merchandise in her kiosk

loans.name: Lamara

texts.en:
Lamara is a market entrepreneur from Zaporozhye. She sells women’s clothing in one the biggest central marketplace of her home town. Lamara has raised two sons who are grown now and live separately. She started her trade 12 years ago. Currently, she has 25,000 Grivnyas invested in business. 

Lamara is seeking a loan of 5,600 Grivnyas to increase her turnover capital and thus increase her income as a result. She is hoping to re-stock her inventory with fall/winter clothing items. Lamara is planning to re-invest generated profit in reconstruction of one of the vending locations that she owns and keep her business running efficiently in the future.

loans.use: to increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Fe Y Esperanza 1 & 2 Group

texts.es:
Eduviges es una de nuestras asociadas de Hato Mayor, y es miembro del grupo Fe y Esperanza 1 y 2, Hato Mayor una de las ciudades mas rurales del pais, cuya economia depende de la agricultura. Eduviges es una empresaria, dedicada a la venta de calzado y otros productos, es madre de 2 hijos, los cuales viven con ella junto a su esposo. Nos dice que su reto o desafío más difícil ha sido criar a sus hijos, y que disfruta  vestir bien y arreglarse, en su tiempo libre le gusta visitar.

Eduviges está muy emocionada de recibir su tercer préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, después de haber pagado satisfactoriamente sus préstamos anteriores y en cada uno haber dado un paso para el crecimiento de su negocio. Ella ha negociado por alrededor de 1 años, iniciando su actividad comercial con su primer prestamo. Está planificando invertir su nuevo préstamo en la compra de varios pares de zapatos, tambien correas y carteras. Planea utilizar sus ganancias para comprar un comedor, y mientras ahorra desea construir su casa de block y poder amueblarla, siendo este unos de sus sueños mas anhelado.
texts.en:
Eduviges is one of our partners in Hato Mayor and is a member of the group Faith and Hope 1 and 2. Hato Mayor is one the most rural cities in the country, whose economy is dependent on agriculture. Eduviges is an entrepreneur dedicated to selling shoes and other products. She is mother to two children who live with her and her husband. She tells us that her most difficult challenge has been raising her children and that she enjoys dressing well and smartening up. In her free time, she likes to visit.

Eduviges is very excited to receive her third loan from Esperanza Internacional, after having satisfactorally paid her previous loans and, with each one, takinga  step towards growing her business. For about a year, she has been negotiating, starting her commercial activity with her first loan. She is planning to invest the latest loan in the purchase of various pairs of shoes, as well as straps and wallets. She plans to use her earnings to buy a dining room set, and while she saves, she wishes to build her house from blocks and be able to furnish it, seeing that this is one of her dearest dreams.

loans.use: Shoes, straps, wallets, etc.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: La Señora Nelly es un cliente que ya trabajo varias secuencias  en la institución,   ella se dedica la venta de frutas en las diferentes ferias de la ciudad de el alto, su negocio esta ubicado en la zona 16 de julio,  a unos pasos de la famosa plaza 16 de julio, la feria de el alto es muy famosa en toda la ciudad de La Paz  por la gran diversidad de productos que tiene, en la feria se puede encontrar desde agujas hasta partes de aviones, la señora hace traer las frutas desde la región de yungas zona muy accidentada por la misma topografía, la señora invertirá el crédito en la compra de frutas, la mercadería de la señora tuvo un accidente hace tres meses en ese accidente tuvo una perdida cuantiosa en su capital pero ahora la señora se restableció económicamente,  pero la señora pese a esa desgracia no se da por vencido y sigue trabajando. La señora tiene dos hijas una mayor que sigue estudiando y una pequeña que sigue cuidando.
texts.en: Nelly is a client who has already worked for various cycles with the institution. She is dedicated to selling fruit at the various markets in the city of Alto. Her business in located in the July 16 zone, a few steps from the famous July 16 plaza. Alto's market is very famous in all of the city of La Paz due to its great variety of products. At the market, you can find everything from needles to airplane parts. She brings fruit from the Yungas region, a very rugged area of the same topography. She will invest the loan in the purchase of fruit. Nelly's merchandise had an accident three months ago. In this accident, she took a substantial loss to her capital but now she has reestablished herself economically. Despite the misfortune, Nelly has not given up and she continues to work. She has two daughters: an older daughter who is studying and a small daughter who she still takes care of.

loans.use: Purchase fruit at wholesale.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: La Sra. Edith desde hace dos años se dedica al comercio de zapatos, no cuenta con local propio ya que ella compra los calzados en la ciudad de Oruro y lo traslada a la ciudad de Cochabamba donde entrega la mercadería a personas que tienen un puesto fijo para su venta. En el mercado la paz,  Quillacollo y en sacaba. Solicita el monto para incrementar su capital de trabajo y de este modo tener mayores ingresos, muy aparte de dedicarse al comercio, ella estudia en la universidad la carrera de enfermería, es una señora bien trabajadora y con muchas ganas de superación, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: For two years, Edith has been dedicated to selling shoes. She does not have her own shop since she buys the shoes in the city of Oruro and transports them to the city of Cochabamba where she sells the merchandise to people who have fixed stalls for their sale in the markets of La Paz, Quillacollo and in Sacaba. She is requesting the amount in order to increase her working capital and, in this manner, have greater income. Apart from dedicating herself to this business, she is studying to be a nurse at the university. She is a hard-working woman, with a great desire to get ahead. She is very thankful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: Increase in working capital.

loans.name: Deyci

texts.es: La Sra. Deyci,  vive la zona de Villa  Obrajes vive en la casa de sus padres, es joven tiene un año de casada  y para ayudar a la economía de su familia  tiene una tienda de barrio y es la única en la zona  una es muy trabajadora, los días domingos se dedica a la venta de papa en la cancha de sacaba día donde es muy concurrido ya que es feria, el préstamo lo destinara la poder aumentar y variar su mercadería y compran algunos muebles para la tienda, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito. en la foto la Sra. Deyci esta acompañada de su esposo.
texts.en: Deyci lives in the Villa Obrajes zone. She lives at home with her parents. She is young and has been married for a year. To help her family with money, she has a neighborhood shop and it is the only one in the area. She is very hard working. On Sundays,  she is dedicated to selling potatoes in Sacaba's court since it is busy since it's market day. The loan will be used to enable her to increase and vary her merchandise, as well as buy some furniture for the store. She is very thankful to the institution for the support provided by granting her this loan. In the photo, Deyci is accompanied by her husband.

loans.use: Increase in capital to purchase products for her shop and furniture.

loans.name: Maria Julia

texts.es: La Sra. Maria Julia es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, vive en la zona D. villa Fátima que se encuentra a unos 25 minutos del centro D. la cuidad. Es madre D. tres hijos quienes ya son mayores D. edad y trabajan D. manera independiente. Ella tiene un kiosco en la calle Colombia cerca del centro D. la cuidad donD. venD. golosinas, dulces, y refrescos, además también prepara unas barras D. maní crocante con azúcar. Estas barras D. maní crocante son muy deliciosas y por eso la Sra. Maria julia es muy conocida ya que también realiza la venta por mayor D. las mismas. Con el dinero del crédito comprara maní por cantidad, dulces para surtir su kiosco. La Sra. Maria Julia es cliente antigua D. emprender, comenzó el año 2005 con un préstamo D. 100 dólares en el grupo solidario "avanti". Actualmente trabaja como préstamo individual. Ella es una persona muy puntual y alegre.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Julia is a very responsible and hardworking person. She lives in the community of Villa Fátima, located about 25 minutes from the city center. She is the mother of three grown children who support themselves independently.

She has a stand in Colombia Street near the city center where she sells snacks, sweets, and soft drinks. In addition, she also makes some peanut brittle bars with sugar. These peanut brittle bars are very delicious, and Sra. Maria is very well known since she also sells them wholesale.

With the money from the loan she will buy peanuts in bulk and sweets for stocking her stand. Sra. Maria Julia is an old client of Emprender. She began in 2005 with a loan of $100 in the Avanti support group. Currently, she is working with an individual loan. She is a very punctual and cheerful person.

loans.use: Purchase of peanuts, sugar, and sweets.

loans.name: Flor Maria

texts.es:
Flor de 62 años, tiene un taller de costura y confección vive en una zona periurbana llamada Duran de Guayaquil. Su esposo es sastre y le ayude en ocasiones en el negocio. 

Desde pequeña ella comenzó a practicar en el ambiente de costura y confección cuando se decidió realmente a estudiar costura fue cuando empezó a trabajar y tener practicas en esta profesión. Ahora ella tiene su propio taller trabaja desde muy temprano. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar telas para hacer mas confecciones y poderlas vender y exhibir como su propia ropa. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Flor is 62 years old and has a tailor shop where she sews and makes clothes.  The shop is located in a suburb called Duran de Guayaquil.  Her husband is a tailor and helps her with the business from time to time.

She began sewing and making clothes when she was a little girl.  It was when she began to seriously study the art of sewing that she began working and practicing this profession.  Now she has her own shop.

She will use the money from this loan to buy fabrics to make more items and be able to sell and show them as her own line of clothing.  In the future she wants to finish building her house and expand her business.

loans.use: Fabric

loans.name: Nataly

texts.es: Nataly tiene 23 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de sus padres y de su pequeño hijo; cada día trabaja para salir adelante. Esta joven mujer es muy trabajadora y actualmente labora en una inmobiliaria en donde se dedica a brindar información y realiza trámites de algún terreno o inmueble que se venda. Sin embargo atiende además otro negocio, en la que posee un puesto de venta de golosinas y gaseosas, siendo su madre quien la apoya en la atención hacía los clientes. Se siente muy satisfecha con lo que hace pues obtiene regular ganancia en ambos trabajos, de esa manera puede mantener sola a su hijo. Nataly trabaja sin descanso, pues sabe que tiene muchas metas que cumplir, es por ello que tiene planeado comprar un motocarro para poder alquilarlo, por lo que espera mejorar sus ingresos económicos, ya que quiere terminar de construir su casa de material noble. Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Nataly tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de cantidad de mercadería en golosinas y gaseosas, pues quiere abastecer su negocio para que sus clientes tengan mayor variedad para escoger, así espera ganas más.
texts.en: Nataly is 23 years old and lives in her own house along with her parents and her small son. Every day she works in order to move forward in life. This young woman is very hardworking and currently works in realtors office where she offers information and does the paperwork for land or property that is being sold. However, she also works at another business: she has a store where she sells candy and sodas, and her mother helps her to attend to the customers. She feels very satisfied with what she does and gets regular income from both jobs and this allows her to bring up her son alone. Nataly works without rest as she knows she has many goals to accomplish. For this reason, she is planning to buy a car to rent out, and in this way she hopes to improve her income. She also wants to finish building her house. This is the second loan that she has had from MFP and she promises to make her repayments punctually as she doesn't want to be in bad standing with the people who made this loan possible and are helping her to keep working and seeking to improve her situation. Nataly plans to use the loan to buy bulk stocks of candy and soda to supply her store and offer her customers a greater variety of goods. She hopes this will increase her income.

loans.use: To buy candy and other products to supply her store.

loans.name: Senobia

texts.es: La Sra. Senobia  vive en el municipio de el Torno, de la ciudad de Santa Cruz de la sierra, es nacida en el mismo municipio, se dedica a la venta de productos medicinales extraído de la naturaleza, su es poso con el que vive hace ya treinta años y tienen cuatro hijo de los cuales dos están a su cargo, también se dedica a este negocio el cual le a resultado rentable, el destino del crédito es para terminar de construir su domicilio que se encuentra en obra rustica, necesitan compra material de construcción como cemento, pintura, etc. La Sra. Esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mrs. Senobia lives in the municipality of Torno in the city of Santa Cruz de la Sierra. She was born there and works selling natural medicinal extracts. Her husband of thirty years also works in this business, which has proved to be profitable. They have four children, two of which are still under their care. This loan will be used to finish building their house which is currently built of simple, rustic materials. They need to buy construction materials like cement, paint, etc. Mrs. Senobia is very thankful for the support being offered her.

loans.use: To do construction on her house

loans.name: Yanira

texts.es: La Sra. Yanira Vive en la localidad de el torno, de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, es nacida en el departamento de Beni considerada la capital ganadera de Bolivia, su actividad es la venta de medicamentos naturales, su esposo se dedica a la misma actividad, tienen un hijo pequeño, viven en la casa de sus suegros, el destino del crédito es para comprar productos para surtir su negocio, hace 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad la cual le a dado el sustento de su familia. La Sra. Yanira es un apersona muy trabajadora atiende su negocio y a el cuidado de su bebe, tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante, la Sra. Esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Yanira lives in the town of El Torno in the city of Santa Cruz.  She was born in the state of Beni, considered to be the livestock capital of Bolivia.  She makes a living by selling natural medicines, and her husband dedicates himself to the same business. They have a small child and live with their in-laws.  Yanira will use this loan to buy products to supply her business.  She has dedicated herself to this business for 5 years and it has given her the income necessary to support her family.  Yanira is a very hardworking person.  She attends to her business and takes care of her baby.  She very much would like to get ahead and is very thankful to the institution for the support that it offers her.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Damiana

texts.es: Damiana, D. 67 años, vive en su casa que es propia, en compañía D. su esposo Hipólito D. 69 años y D. sus 2 hijas mayores y nietos. Sin embargo a pesar D. su avanzada edad se esfuerza cada día para salir adelante. DesD. muy joven esta trabajadora mujer se ha dedicado a la agricultura y al comercio, D. esa manera ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos. Hoy en día continua tan activa como antes, es así que se dedica a la venta D. comestibles en una tienda que instaló en el interior D. su casa. Manifiesta que le va muy bien en el negocio, ya que obtiene considerables ganancias, pues por la zona donD. vive no tiene competencia cercana. Paralelamente a este negocio, también se dedica a la siembra D. vegetales, para su consumo propio, aprovechando además para la venta al menoreo. Luego D. muchos años D. esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado terminar D. construir su casa, a base D. material noble, por lo que se siente en la capacidad D. realizar cualquier cosa que se proponga, ahora desea abastecer su negocio con variedad D. productos para así ofrecer tener poco a poco un minimarket. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete cumplir sus pagos puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Damiana tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra D. mercadería para abastecer mejor su tienda D. productos comestibles, D. esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Damiana is 67 years old and lives in her own home with her husband Hipólito (69 years old) and her two grown daughters and grandchildren.  Despite her advanced age, she strives daily to get ahead.  Since she was young, this hard-working woman has worked in farming and business, and thus has been able to successfully raise her children.  Today she is as active as always, and sells food in a store she set up in her house.  She states that the business is doing well.  She brings in significant earnings, as there is no competition close by.  In addition to this business, she plants crops, for personal consumption, and also for retail sales.  After many years of effort and hard work, she has finished building her house, using high-quality materials, and she thus feels she is ready to take on anything she proposes.  She would now like to stock her store with a variety of goods, thus gradually becoming a mini-market.  This is her first loan with MFP, and she commits to making her payments punctually.  She wouldn’t want to leave a bad impression with those who have maD. it possible for her to continue working to get ahead.  Damiana plans to invest the amount requested to purchase goods to better stock her store with food products.  She hopes thereby to improve her earnings.

loans.use: Abastecer su tienda con variados productos.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es: La Sra. Laura vive en la ciudad de Santa Cruz, es nacida en San José de Chiquitos, es una población declarada patrimonio cultural de humanidad, es conocida como las misiones jesuíticas, desde su corta edad se traslado a la capital Cruceña donde estableció su negocio de venta de muebles de fierro, hace unos tres año que se dedica a esta actividad su esposo es comerciante de productos ocasionales, tienen tres hijos en edad escolar, el destino del crédito es para comprar mercadería por fin de año, vive en casa prestada, por lo que su deseo es tener su propio domicilio.
texts.en: Laura lives in the city of Santa Cruz.  She was born in San José de Chiquitos, a town that was declared to be a cultural world heritage site, known for its Jesuit missions.  When she was young, she moved to the capital, Cruceña, where she established her first business, selling iron furniture, which she has been dedicating herself to for about three years.  Her husband is a salesman.  They have three school-aged children.  This loan will be used to purchase merchandise for the end of the year.  They live in a home that they rent and their dream is to one day have a house of their own.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Hatarinas Group

texts.es:
Marta R. Catillo. De 43 años de edad es una de las integrantes del grupo Hatarinas  El cual está conformado por 9 socias, viven en el AA.HH Hatary  LLacta, por ello el nombre de Hatarinas ya que todas son vecinas.
  Marta R., conviviente y madre de 4 hijos, 3 de ellos independientes, se dedica a la venta de comida por las mañanas y por las tardes a la venta de bebidas. Con el reciente préstamo lo invertirá en mejoras para el negocio de venta de comida y otra parte del dinero en la educación de su hijo que estudia Panadería. Un grupo con deseo de salir adelante y optimismo de lograrlo , que aceptan retos para el bienestar económico de ella y de sus familias.
texts.en:
Marta R. Catillo, age 43, is one of the members of the Hatarinas Communal Bank.  The group is comprised of nine members.  They live in AA.HH Hatary LLacta.  That is why they named the group Hatarinas; they are all neighbors.

Marta R. is in a common-law marriage, and she has four children.  Three of the children are independent.  Marta R. sells food in the mornings, and in the afternoons she sells drinks.  

She will invest the new loan on improvements to her food selling business.  She will use part of the money on the education of her child who is studying baking.

This is a group with the desire to get ahead and the optimism to achieve it.  They accept challenges for the economic well-being of the group and their families.

loans.use: For improvements in the business

loans.name: Maria Tomasa

texts.es: Maria Tomasa es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos, ella trabaja todos los dias para sacarlos adelante ya que estan en edad escolar, se be, en la necesidad de trabajar para darles lo que nececitan, porque no cuenta con el apoyo de nadie doña Tomasa se dedica a la Venta de tortillas y bebidas gaseosas,vende todos los dias en una caseta ubicada en el mercado Municipal de San Martin, biaja todos los dias para llegar a su negocio ya que vive un poco lejos, en la aldea donde vive tambien tiene crianzas de pollos y marranos los vende cada mes y de esa actividad obtiene ganacias solicita el credito para comprar Marranos maiz y bebidas gaceosas, para seguir con su negocio y asi sobrevivir agradese a fape por la ayuda brindada manifiesta que es una institucion distinta a las demas por su forma de trabajo, su sueño es tener un comedor propio para ya no seguir alquilando y que sus hijos llegen a ser unos profesionales.
texts.en: Maria Tomasa is a single mother, she has two children, and she works every day to help get them ahead as they are of school age. She needs to work to give them what they need, because she does not have support from anyone. Ms Tomasa sells tortillas and fizzy drinks, she sells them daily at a stand located at the Municipal Market of San Martin, she travels daily to get to her business as she lives a distance away. In the village where she lives she also raises chickens and pigs she sells them each month and from this business she gains profits. She is requesting the loan to buy pigs, corn and fizzy drinks, to continue with her business and therefore survive. She is grateful to FAPE for the help provided, it has shown that it is an institution different from the others by its type of work. Her dream is to have her own dining room so she does not have to keep renting and that her children become professionals.

loans.use: Purchase pigs, corn and drinks

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 46 años, vive en casa de su suegra en compañía de ella y de su esposo Pelayo de 45 años y de sus 2 hijos que son mayores e independientes, juntos habitan en un populoso barrio ubicado al norte de la ciudad. Siendo profesora en un centro educativo particular, tiene además otro ingreso económico que es la venta de productos de primera necesidad así como también vende algunos artículos y útiles escolares. Sus hijos la apoyan en la atención hacía los clientes, cuando ella tiene que salir a adquirir más productos; por otro lado elabora materiales didácticos hechos a base de corrospum (material micro poroso parecido al plástico), ya que los clientes fijos son sus colegas y alumnos del colegio donde trabaja. Manifiesta que le va bien en su negocio, pues obtiene considerables ganancias que le permiten ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Como es una mujer emprendedora en adelante tiene planeado surtir mejor su negocio ya que quiere ofrecer variedad de mercadería a sus clientes. Es el décimo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete cumplir con sus pagos puntualmente pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. María tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mercadería en corrospum, pues tiene varios pedidos pendientes;  también algunos comestibles y útiles escolares  para abastecer mejor su negocio.
texts.en: 46 year old María lives in her sister-in-law's house along with her sister-in-law and her husband, 45 year old Pelaya, and their 2 children who are grown-up and independent. They live together in a crowded neighborhood to the north of the city. She is a teacher in an education center and gets additional income from selling staple goods and some other items and school supplies. Her children help her attend to her customers when she has to leave to buy more goods. She also makes decorations from corrospum (a micro-porous material similar to plastic.) Her regular clients are colleagues and students at the school where she works.  She says that her business is doing well and she is making a good profit that enables her to help her husband with the household expenses. As she is a hardworking woman, she has future plans to better supply her business so that she can offer a greater variety of merchandise to her customers. This is the 10th loan that she has had from MFP and she promises to make her repayments punctually as she does not want to be in bad standing with the people who have made this loan possible and enable her to keep working towards greater success. María plans to use the loan to buy corrospum supplies as she has various orders in hand. She will also buy some food and school supplies to better stock her store.

loans.use: To add products to supply her store, also to buy corrospum (a plastic-like material) to make decorations.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Marlene, de 40 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Luis de 44 años que es taxista, y sus 2 hijos jóvenes que le ayudan en el negocio, juntos y con muchas ganas de salir adelante habitan al norte de la ciudad. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de comida que lo expende diariamente a sus clientes, quienes en su mayoría son trabajadores de una empresa aledaña a la zona donde vive. Cada día se despierta al amanecer para preparar sus platillos y al mediodía reparte sus platillos previamente pedidos un día antes. Se siente satisfecha con su labor pues le permite obtener regulares ganancias que le ayuda a su esposo en los constantes gastos del hogar. Por otro lado se dedica también a la crianza de 2 vacas y 3 docenas de gallinas, de las que obtiene leche fresca diaria y huevos que comercializa al menoreo. Esta emprendedora mujer tiene planeado ampliar su negocio de venta de comida e instalar un restaurante campestre, ya que por el lugar donde vive no hay nadie quien ofrezca este servicio. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Marlene tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en el pago de la inicial de un auto, ya que su esposo tiene el propósito de brindar el servicio de transporte, de esa manera espera mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Marlene, age 40, lives in her own house with her 44 year old husband, Luis.  Luis is a taxi driver.  They also live with their two young children, and they help her with the business.  They live together, and they have a great desire to get ahead.  They live to the north of the city.

For four years she has been selling food every day.  Most of her customers are workers for a business that is near where they live.  Every day she gets up at dawn to prepare her dishes.  At noon she distributes the dishes that were ordered the previous day.  She feels satisfied with her work.  It allows her to obtain regular earnings, and it helps her husband with the steady household expenses.

She also raises two cows and three dozen chickens.  She gets fresh milk daily, and she sells the eggs.  This enterprising woman plans to expand her business of selling food and set up a rural restaurant.  In the place where she lives there is no one who provides this service.

This is her first loan with MFP.  She pledges to make her payments on time.  She does not want to disappoint the individuals that made these funds possible.  This contribution will allow her to continue working and searching for progress.  Marlene plans to use the requested loan to make the initial payment for a car.  Her husband intends to provide his own transportation services, and they hope that this will improve their income.

loans.use: Buy a car so that her husband can provide transportation service

loans.name: Sandra Veronica

texts.es:
Sandra Veronica es casada con Moises tiene un hijo, trabaja todos los dias vendiendo trajes tipicos D. casa en casa, tiene que dejar a su hijo con su suegra para que pueda trabajar y ayudar a su esposo, ya que tambien recibe apoyo D. Moises, el es barbero trabaja todos los dias atendiendo a sus clientes ya que si no lo hace se le van, Sandra Veronica se dedica a la crianza D. pollos aparte D. eso tambien venD. avon en sus ratos libres, cuando ofrese cortes tipicos D. casa en casa venD. tedos los dias, es asi como Sandra obtiene ganacias.
Solicita el credito para comprar cortes y blusas tipicas asi vender otro poco mas y asi sobrevivir, agradece a fape por la ayuda brindada manifiesta que es una intitucion distinta a las demas por su forma D. trabajar, su sueño es tener o alquilar un local propio para ya no seguir con su negocio ambulantemente, y por ahora dejar a su bebe ya que le hace falta verlo todo el dia.
texts.en:
Sandra Veronica is married to Moises, and they have a son. She works every day selling traditional clothing from house to house. She has to leave her son with her mother-in-law so that she can work and help her husband, since she also receives support from Moises. He is a barber and works every day taking care of his customers, since if he doesn't do this, they will leave him. Sandra Veronica raises chickens, and in addition to this she sells Avon in her free time. When she sells typical clothing house to house, she works every day. This is how Sandra obtains her earnings.

She is applying for the loan to buy fabric and traditional blouses so that she can sell a little bit more and thus survive. She is thankful to FAPE for the help they offer. She declares that it is an institution that is different from others in the way it works. Her dream is to own or rent her own shop so that she doesn't have to continue with door-to-door sales and leave her baby, who needs to be watched all day.

loans.use: Buy fabric and traditional blouses to sell

loans.name: Melba

texts.es: Melba tiene 38 años, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de sus 2 hijos menores, que aún estudian en el colegio; juntos y con muchas ganas de salir adelante habitan en un populoso barrio de un balneario muy concurrido ubicado al  norte de la ciudad. Esta trabajadora mujer se despierta cada mañana con el  ánimo de continuar trabajando para sacar adelante a sus hijos, pues lo hace sola, y esta muy orgullosa de todos sus logros. Desde hace 2 años, decidió instalar un pequeño restaurante en una parte de su casa, pues no quería dejar de trabajar y se animó hacerlo pues cocina muy bien. En la actualidad obtiene considerables ganancias, ya que su restaurante está ubicado frente a un hospital y eso le beneficia en su economía. Generalmente recibe la ayuda de su hija mayor, ya que le faltan manos para atender a los clientes, es por eso que planea ampliar su negocio y mejorar la atención a sus asiduos comensales. Es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible que obtenga este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Melba tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de cantidad de ingredientes al por mayor, pues desea continuar ofreciendo a sus clientes lo mejor en platillos, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Melba is 38 years old. She lives in a house that is her own with her two young children, who still go to school, and she has a great desire to advance herself. They live in the crowded neighborhood of a well-used public bath located to the north of the city. This hard-working woman wakes up every morning with the will to continue working to raise her children, since she is doing it alone, and she is very proud of all their successes. 

Two years ago, she decided to set up a little restaurant in part of her house, since she did not want to stop working and she was inspired to do it because she cooks very well. At this time she has considerable earnings, since her restaurant is located across from a hospital, and this helps her economically. She generally receives help from her older daughter, since she doesn't have enough hands to attend to her customers. For this reason, she is planning to expand her business and improve her attention to her loyal diners. 

This is her third loan with MFP, and she promises to make her payments on time, since she doesn't want to make a bad impression on the people who made it possible for her to obtain this support, which will permit her to continue working in search of progress. Melba has plans to invest the loan in the wholesale purchase of ingredients in quantity, since she wants to continue offering her customers the best of dishes, and in this way she hopes to improve her earnings.

loans.use: Buy ingredients to make dishes in her restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Compra de productos comerstibles.

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es: Evangelina, es una madre de familia muy noble y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo y sus 4 hijos. Las actividades a la que se dedica Evangelina, es la costura y la venta de productos de belleza, es así que sus días los organiza de la siguiente manera: durante las mañana borda polos de algodón en su casa y por la tarde recorre las calles de su distrito, ofreciendo sus productos de belleza. En este último trabajo ella demuestra ser toda una experta, ya que tiene la facilidad de convencer a sus clientes de escoger tal producto, motivo por el cual venden muy  rápido los perfumes femeninos, joyas, por lo que tiene que abastecerse constantemente, de este modo hace que su negocio le sea muy rentable y así puede brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes sobre los productos que deben usar, disfruta mucho de su negocio, aunque eso implique que tenga que caminar mucho. Con el tiempo anhela poner un  bazar de ropa en un mercado que sea muy concurrido. Es su 21avo crédito con MFP y esta feliz de poder obtenerlo, manifiesta que lo invertirá todo en el negocio, ya que quiere mejorar su calidad de vida. Con el crédito solicitado, incrementará sus productos de belleza, asimismo desea llevar su maquina de coser al técnico para darle mantenimiento.
texts.en:
Evangelina is a very good mother and worker.  She lives in her own house with her husband and 4 children. Evangelina sews and sells beauty products and arranges her days in the following manner:  during the morning, she embroiders cotton t-shirts at home, and in the afternoon, she sells beauty products through the streets of her town.  It is through her sales ability that she proves herself an expert, since she has the knack to convince her customers to choose specific products.  It is because of this that she sells her products quickly - products like perfumes for women and jewelry, and it is because of this that she constantly has to restock her inventory of products so that she can keep her business profitable and continue to provide a good living for her children.  Evangelina loves advising her customers about which products to use, and enjoys this aspect of her business even though it sometimes means having to walk far.  Her long term goal is to sell clothes in the town's crowded market bazaar.

Evangelina is happy to get this loan and wants to invest it mainly in her business in order to improve their quality of life. This loan will enable her to increase her beauty product inventory, and she also wants to bring her sewing machine in to a technician for maintenance.

loans.use: Incrementar productos de belleza para tener en stock.  (to purchase beauty products to increase her inventory)

loans.name: Víctor

texts.es: Víctor B. A. de 62 años de edad, es un hombre muy trabajador quien cuenta con una amplia experiencia en el oficio que realiza. Él se dedica a la elaboración de calzado para niños, mujeres y hombres, los cuales son hechos de cuero y que poseen una excelente calidad, comprarle zapatos a Víctor es toda una tradición ya que tiene más de 30 años de elaborar este trabajo, en el pueblo de San Juan Opico, lugar en el cual también vive junto a su esposa y un nieto de 4 años de edad. Víctor solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar: cuero, cintas, hilo, agujas, pegamento y otros instrumentos primordiales que sean de mucha ayuda para agilizar y mejorar su trabajo, así de esta forma él espera iniciar a elaborar calzado más moderno y de esta forma llamar la atención de más personas.
texts.en: Victor B. A. is a 62-year-old is a hard working man who has extensive experience in his trade of making shoes for children, women and men.  His shoes are made of leather and are excellent in quality. Buying shoes from Victor has been a tradition for over 30 years in the town of San Juan Opico, where he lives with his wife and grandson (age 4).  Victor requests a loan so that he can purchase: leather, tape, thread, needles, glue and other key products that are needed to streamline and improve his work.  He hopes that he will be able to begin to develop more modern footwear and thus grow his business by attracting more customers.

loans.use: Compra de materia prima para fabricación de calzado. (To purchase materials for making shoes)

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es: Teresa de Jesús F. de 42 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Usulután, en donde vive junto a su esposo, y tres hijos de 16, 15 y 14 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Ella posee una tienda, en la cual comercializa productos de primera necesidad, tanto alimenticios como de primera necesidad en el hogar, la cual esta ubicada en su casa de habitación. Teresa solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir la tienda comprando más pan, leche, jugos y otros productos más, los cuales posee mayor demanda, así de esta forma ella espera mejorar sus ventas. Teresa es una mujer muy trabajadora la cual desea mejorar su negocio y de esta forma contar con una mejor estabilidad y de esta misma forma brindarle un mejor futuro a sus hijos en el cual puedan contar con todo lo necesario para vivir mejor.
texts.en: Teresa de Jesus F., 42 years of age and lives in Usulutan with her husband and three children, (ages 16, 15 and 14) who are in school. She runs a store out of her home where she sells basic products - both food and basic necessities for the home. Teresa requested a loan which she will use to re-stock her store and with which she will buy more bread, milk, juices and other products, due to the increased demand, and thus she hopes to improve her sales. Teresa is a very hardworking woman.  She wants to improve her business and create better financial stability, which in turn will help build a better future for her children, so they can have everything they need to live better.

loans.use: Compra de productos perecederos.  (To purchase products to re-stock her store's inventory)

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 38 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposa y sus 3 hijos. Desde hace 2 años, María se dedica a la preparación de salchipapas,  que consiste en papas y pollos fritos, siendo muy solicitada estos platos. Sus clientes son los jóvenes y demás vecinos de su barrio que gustan de su buena sazón y es por ello que no deja de salir ni un solo día para poder vender la cantidad posible de salchipapas y así generarse los ingresos que necesita. Los 2 años que lleva en este trabajo le ha ido muy bien, sin embargo tiene que quedarse hasta altas horas de la noche para vender todo lo que prepara al día. Le gusta el trabajo que realiza, ya que conversa mucho con sus clientes, además porque le resulta muy rentable. En adelante anhela poner una juguería para diversificar su negocio y aumentar sus ganancias. Es su cuarto crédito con MFP y esta muy contenta de contar con este dinero que le hacía mucha falta para mejorar la condición de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, va comprarse mesas y sillas para su negocio, asimismo desea comprar madera para acondicionar el garaje para guardar su carro.
texts.en:
Maria is 38 years of age and a hard working mother.  She lives in her her own home with her husband and 3 children.  For 2 years now, Maria has been  preparing and selling "salchipapas", a dish that consists of potatoes and fried chicken - and that has been much in demand.  Maria's customers are young people and residents in her neighborhood who like their food with great flavor.  Therefore, there isn't even one day which passes when she doesn't sell salchipapas and generates the income needed.  After 2 years at this work, Maria has done very well, but still has to stay up late at night to prepare everything in order to sell it the next day.  Maria likes the work she does, and enjoys talking a lot with her clients.  She longs to put in a juice bar to diversify her business and increase profits. 

This is Maria's fourth loan with MFP and will be very pleased to have this money, which is badly needed to improve her business. With the loan requested, she will buy tables and chairs for her business.  Maria also wants to buy wood to build a garage in order to house her car.

loans.use: Comprar mesas y sillas para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.(To purchase tables and chairs to offer better services to her clients)

loans.name: Vicenta Emperatriz

texts.es:
Vicenta de 51 años, vive en una zona periurbana llamada Duran de Guayaquil lugar caracterizado por su ecología en disolución. Tiene una tienda de víveres y venta de arroz. 

Empezó con la tienda cuando su esposo salio del trabajo y necesitaban dinero para mantener a sus hijos. Comenzaron a comprar arroz y vender por libra y así poco a poco vendieron por quintal. Después de tener capital pudo comprar suficiente dinero para surtir una tienda con víveres.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz para tener suficiente para sus clientes. En el futuro quiere comprar un vehiculo y ser distribuidor de arroz por todo Guayaquil y asi asegurar la economía de su casa.
texts.en:
Vicenta, 51 years of age, lives in the outskirts of Duran de Guayaquil known for it's community and natural resources. She owns a grocery store and sells rice.

Vicenta began her business when her husband lost his job and they needed money to support their children. She began by buying and selling rice per pound and then gradually she sold rice by the hundredweight (100 kilograms).  Then, after having enough capital, she bought enough to run a grocery store!  With this loan, she wants to buy enough rice to have enough for her customers. In the future, she wants to buy a car and become a distributor of rice around Guayaquil and in turn ensure her home's economy.

loans.use: Arroz (rice)

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra M. is from the village of Estrella, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. Alejandra is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Alejandra owns & operates a business venture in the services sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating transportation services. Alejandra has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Alejandra joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alejandra has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to additional capital for her business. Alejandra is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Alejandra from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Silvia Teresa

texts.es:
La Señora Silvia G. es socia del banco comunal San Vicente, vive en la comunidad de San Pedro que  pertenece a la parroquia de la Victoria del Portete, en donde la mayor parte de su población se dedican a la ganadería y agricultura, mucha de su población ha salido a la ciudad a trabajar en varias actividades como también han migrado en busca de un mejor trabajo.

Nuestra socia tiene  33 años, es casada y tiene  4 hijos de 13, 11, 3 años y un bebe de  11 meses de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en la escuela de la comunidad. Su esposo es profesional en la rama de la construcción en donde labora como albañil ya varios años, con la experiencia de su esposo en la construcción y el trabajo en conjunto han logrado construir su casa propia.
 
La Señora Silvia se dedica al bordado de polleras (vestimenta tradicional), se ha iniciado en esta actividad desde los once años hasta el día de hoy y ha sido su tía quien le ha enseñado este arte. También se dedica a la cría de cuyes, gallinas y borregos a los cuales los vende en su propia comunidad, cultiva hortalizas  para el consumo de su hogar y el sobrante lo vende en su comunidad o en la ciudad.
 
Doña Silvia es socia fundadora del banco comunal en el cual es integrante activa hace varios años, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en su alimento.

Su meta es entregarles a sus hijos los mejores estudios para que lleguen lejos en la vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Silvia G. is a member of the San Vicente community bank.  She lives in the town of San Pedro which belongs to the Victoria del Portete parrish, where most of its population is engaged in farming and agriculture.  It's a town which has attracted much of its population due to people searching for better jobs.

Silvia is 33 years of age, is married and has 4 children, (13, 11, 3 years and a baby of 11 months of age).  Her oldest two children attend school.  Her husband is a professional in the construction industry where he has worked as a mason for several years.  And, with her husband's experience in building and working, they have built their own home together.
 
Silvia embroiders skirts (traditional dress) for a living. She has worked at this business for eleven years, and it was her aunt who taught her this art. She also raises guinea pigs, chickens and sheep, which she sells in her town.  And, she grows her own vegetables for her family's use, but sells the surplus in town.

Sylvia is a founding member of the community bank, and has been an active member for several years.  This new loan is going to be used to purchase chickens and chicken feed.  Her goal is to give her children the best possible education so they can go far in life.

loans.use: Comprar pollos y alimento de animales.

loans.name: Cresildo

texts.en:
Cresildo L. is from the village of Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 32 years old. Cresildo is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Cresildo owns & operates a business venture providing transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating this service. Cresildo has been engaged in his business for over one year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Cresildo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cresildo is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This will be the first loan taken out by Cresildo from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Clementina

texts.es:
La Señora Clentina D. es socia del banco comunal San Vicente, vive en la comunidad de San Pedro que  pertenece a la parroquia de la Victoria del Portete, en donde la mayor parte de su población se dedican a la ganadería y agricultura, mucha de su población ha salido a la ciudad a trabajar en varias actividades como también han migrado en busca de un mejor trabajo.

La Señora. Clementina tiene 66 años, es viuda hace 3 años y tiene 7 hijos quienes son mayores de edad y  viven  independientemente con sus familias. Con el trabajo de ella y si esposo ha logrado construir su casa propia.

Nuestra socia se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos, también cría cuyes, pollos y vacas  que vende en su propia comunidad y cuando tiene alguna reunión sacrifican algún animalito para compartir en familia. También se dedica a la agricultura, siembra hortalizas y sus productos los vende en la ciudad o en su comunidad.
 
Es nuestra socia hace 3 años en los que ha compartido junto a la banca comunal y tiene una gran amistad con todas sus compañeras, su nuevo crédito va a invertir en pollos y también va a comprar su alimento.
 
Su sueño es  conservar su salud.
texts.en:
Mrs. Clentina D. is a member of the San Vicente community bank.  She lives in the city of San Pedro, which is part of the Victoria del Portete parrish.  Most people in the city are involved with farming and agriculture and have come to this city in search of a better job.

Clentina is 66 years of age and has been a widow for 3 years.  She has 7 children who are older and live independently with their families. She and her deceased husband built their own home with earnings from her business.

Clentina works performing household chores and also raises guinea pigs, chickens and cows, which she sells in her town. She also grows her own vegetables and sells her produce in her city.  
 
Clentina has been a community bank member partner for 3 years, and has great friendships with all the other bank's partners.  This new loan will be used to purchase chickens and chicken feed.
 
Her dream is to stay healthy.

loans.use: Comprar pollos y alimento de animales.  (to purchase chickens and animal feed)

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita T. is from the village of Panay, Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old. Emerita is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Emerita owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating service-based services. Emerita has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Emerita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emerita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,500 PHP from GDMPC. Emerita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Emerita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: María Martha

texts.es:
La Señorita María Zhining es socia del banco comunal San Vicente, vive en la comunidad de San Pedro que pertenece a la parroquia de la Victoria del Portete, en donde la mayor parte de su población se dedican a la ganadería y agricultura, mucha de su población ha salido a la ciudad a trabajar en varias actividades como también han migrado en busca de un mejor trabajo.
 
Nuestra socia se dedica al bordado labor que realiza hace 5 años y ha sido su hermana quien le enseño a trabajar en esta actividad, labora en su casa y no tiene un horario fijo. También se dedica a la cría de animales como cuyes y pollos  que son para el consumo de su hogar y en alguna necesidad los vende.
 
La Señorita María es soltera y tiene una hija de 8 años de edad que estudia en la escuelita de la comunidad, su padre tiene casa propia y nuestra socia vive solo con su padre ya que su madre ha fallecido hace 18 años.

Es socia fundadora de la banca comunal y ha llegado a tener un gran vínculo de amistad con todas las socias,  el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de tela y así poco a poco bordar por su cuenta y hacer un negocio propio ya que ahora solo trabaja realizando obras para otras personas.
 
Su meta es entregarle a su hija un buen estudio para que llegue lejos y también comenzar  su propio negocio de bordados.
texts.en:
Miss Maria Zhining is a member of the San Vicente community bank.  She lives in the city of San Pedro, which belongs to the Victoria del Portete parrish, where most of the population works in farming and agriculture. And, where most of the people have moved to the city searching for a better job.
 
Maria embroiders for a living and has been doing so for 5 years - she works at home.  It is a craft that was taught to Maria by her sister.  Maria also breeds animals like guinea pigs and chickens, some which are for home consumption and some which she sells when she needs the income.
 
Maria is single and has one daughter (8 years of age), who is currently attending the small school in her community.  She lives with her father, who has his own home.  Her mother passed away 18 years ago. 

Maria is a founding member of the community bank and has come to have a great bond of friendship with all its members.  The loan will be used to purchase fabric and she hopes that little by little her embroidery business will take off on its own, since right now she is working for other people.
 
Her goal is to give her daughter a good education so that she can go far in life, and to start her own embroidery business.

loans.use: Comprar tela (To purchase fabric)

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson P. is from the city of Gango, Ozamiz City. He is 38 years old. Wilson is married and has an infant child. To make a living, Wilson operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling cellphone accessories in the local community. Wilson has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Wilson joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilson is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Wilson from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.
