loans.name: Magali  Asunción

texts.es:
En las afueras de Portoviejo en Km 5 vía Manta  encontramos el Banco Comunal Loma De Los Vientos, que se reúnen cada quince días, lugar de gente dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales.

La señora Magaly tiene 35 años de edad y está casada hace 13 años. Tiene dos hijos de 14 y 11 años que estudian en el colegio. Su esposo se dedica al trabajo en el campo de jornalero temporal.

Ella se dedica a la cría de aves de corral, tiene una pequeña granja de pollos, nos cuenta que ella en temporadas compra de cien a doscientos pollos los cuales los cría durante dos a tres meses que es el tiempo para que ya estén listos para la venta, ella cuando ya están listos los pollos los pela y los entrega en  algunas tiendas en Portoviejo y también vende por libras en su casa. Trabaja de tres a cuatro horas al día en la alimentación y cuidado de sus animalitos y casi todo el día cuando tiene que entregar.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar la mayor cantidad de pollos que pueda ya que se viene la época de Navidad y esa temporada es muy buena y es cuando más ganancias deja el negocio. Es su cuarto ciclo en el Banco y está muy contenta porque  le han ayudado mucho.

Sus sueños son poner una tienda y seguir adelante para darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the outskirts of the city of Km 5 via Manta, you find the Loma De Los Vientos Community Bank.  The members meet every two weeks, in a place where people are mainly engaged in agriculture and in breeding animals.

Mrs. Magaly is 35 years of age and has been married for 13 years. She has two children (14 and 11 years of age), who are attending school. Her husband works as a temporary laborer. 

Magaly is a breeder of chickens and has a small poultry farm.  She tells us that during her buying season, she buys one to two hundred chickens which are bred for two to three months.  Then when the time for selling arrives, she prepares them and delivers them to some shops in Portoviejo and sells them by the pound.  She works three to four hours a day feeding and caring for her animals and then most of the day when she has to deliver her products.

This new loan is going to used to buy as many chickens as she can, because Christmas time is approaching and this particular season is very good for business. This is her fourth term with the bank and Magaly is happy because it has helped her a great deal.

Her dream is to open her own store and to continue to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: Comprar pollos. (To purchase chickens)

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en: Andresa B. is from the village of Punta, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 1 years old. Andresa is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Andresa makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling baked goods in the local community. Andresa has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Andresa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Andresa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Andresa is requesting a new loan of 9,500 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Andresa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Jose Julio

texts.es:
José Julio es un padre de familia de 60 años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el sector Keiko Fujimori del distrito de Manuel Mesones Muro, un distrito agrícola situado en la provincia de Ferreñafe, a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas desde hace mas de treinta años. Actualmente cuenta con un terreno de cultivo en donde suele sembrar algunos granos y menestras. En esta ocasión tiene instalados en su terreno los cultivos de maíz y pallar y se encuentra trabajando para lograr que le brinden una buena cosecha con la que espera sacar adelante a su familia.

José Julio desea adquirir fertilizantes y pesticidas para poder dar mantenimiento a su cultivo, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le permitan lograr su objetivo.

José Julio es una persona trabajadora y con bastante experiencia en el manejo de cultivos. Los vecinos de su zona le consideran alguien tranquilo y responsable.
texts.en:
José Julio is a 60-year-old father who lives with his family in the Keiko Fujimori section of the district of Manuel Mesones Muro, which is an agricultural district located in the province of Ferreñafe, half an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

Jose Julio has worked in agriculture for more than thirty years. He now has a plot of land where he will plant some grains and beans. This time he plans to plant a field of corn and lima beans and is working to ensure that he provides a good harvest with which he hopes to help his family get ahead.

José Julio wishes to purchase fertilizers and pesticides to maintain his crop and has applied for this loan, which he will use to achieve his objective.

José Julio is a hard worker with considerable experience in crop management. His neighbors consider him someone who is quiet and responsible.

loans.use: Adquirir fertilizantes y pesticidas para poder dar mantenimiento a su cultivo (To purchase fertilizers and pesticides so that he can help maintain his crop)

loans.name: Cruz Manuel

texts.es:
Cruz Manuel tiene 47 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en el sector Cruz Blanca del distrito de Túcume, un distrito conocido en el norte por su atractivo turístico ya que en su territorio se erige un complejo de 26 pirámides cuya construcción data de épocas preincaicas. La zona pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para efectuar servicio de transporte). El cubre las rutas Puente El Pavo – Granja Sasape todos los días y ofrece su servicio a los pobladores que se movilizan diariamente por esta ruta. Como el número de personas que transitan por esta vía es elevado y constante, su negocio siempre cuenta con una clientela y demanda estable.

Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores y su esposa cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su vivienda. Con estos ingresos se encargan de sacar adelante la economía de su familia. Cruz desea brindar mantenimiento y realizar algunas reparaciones en su mototaxi ya que esta ha empezado a sufrir algunas fallas debido al constante uso de su unidad móvil. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1800 nuevos soles.

Cruz es una persona responsable y bastante entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para poder ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cruz Manuel is 47 years old, is married and lives with his wife and three children in the Cruz Blanca district of Túcume, a district known in the north for its tourist attractions because there are 26 pre-Incan pyramids located within its territory.  The zone is a part of the Lambayeque province and is located 55 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Cruz provides transportation services for passengers and cargo from his moto-taxi (a modified motorcycle with a passenger compartment added to it).  He covers the Puente El Pavo – Granja Sasape route every day and offers his service to villagers who travel daily along that route.  Because the number of people who travel on that road is constant and increasing, he can count on a steady customer demand.

He also raises and sells small animals and his wife has a small store in their home.  These incomes allow them to move their family ahead financially.

Cruz wants to do maintenance and make some repairs to his moto-taxi, now that it has started to malfunction due to its constant use.  In order to do this, he has seen fit to request his first loan of 1,800 PEN ($650) through Edpyme Alternativa.

Cruz is a responsible person, very dedicated to his family.  His greatest desire is to continue to grow as an entrepreneur and provide his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: Vehicle repairs

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina tiene 63 años de edad, no tiene hijos dependientes y vive junto a su familia en el caserío Huaca Quemada, una zona rural dedicada principalmente a actividades relacionadas con la agricultura, pertenece al distrito de Mochumí y se encuentra ubicado a cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores en diversos ambientes ubicados cerca a su domicilio. Ella suele criar pavos, patos, ovejas y cerdos, alimentándolos de pastos naturales y alimento balanceado para lograr que se desarrollen de la mejor manera. Cuando ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo los ofrece en venta en el mercado Moshoqueque (mercado mayorista de la región). Con esta actividad ella sostiene su hogar por lo que siempre da lo mejor de si para mantenerla.

Sabina desea adquirir alimento para brindárselo a sus animales y hacer que estos se desarrollen rápidamente. Su objetivo es lograr que se desarrollen al máximo durante la temporada navideña, que es cuando su negocio obtiene mas demanda. Para realizar su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Sabina es una mujer responsable y bastante trabajadora. El negocio que posee le ayuda a sentirse activa y útil. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una mujer tranquila y de confianza.
texts.en:
Sabina is 63 years old. She doesn’t have any dependent children and she lives with her family in the small town of Huaca Quemada, a rural area where most of the economic activity is related to agriculture. She is from the district of Mochumí, which is located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. 

She raises and sells small animals in several places near her home. She usually raises turkeys, ducks, sheep, and pigs, feeding them natural grasses and commercial feed so that they grow well. When they have reached a good point, she sells them in the Moshoqueque market (the wholesale market for the region). With this she supports her household, and it always goes well enough to support her and her family.

Sabina would like to buy feed to provide to her animals so that they will grow quickly. Her goal is for them to grow as much as possible for the Christmas holidays, which is when her business is in its highest demand. In order to achieve her goal, she has decided for the first time to request a loan with Edpyme Alternativa for PEN 1000.00.

Sabina is a very responsible woman, and very hardworking. The business she has makes her feel active and useful. Those who know her consider her to be even-keeled and trustworthy.

loans.use: To buy feed for her animals

loans.name: Acosta Chero

texts.es:
P. tiene 40 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a su familia en el sector Tumi de Oro del caserío Yencala Boggiano, una zona rural dedicada principalmente a la agricultura, se encuentra situada en el distrito de Lambayeque, capital de la región del mismo nombre, ubicada a más de 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo 

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de cerdos. Ella cría estos animales en unos corrales situados cerca de su vivienda y los engorda para luego ofrecerlos en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde viven. Con este negocio ella sustenta sus gastos personales y ayuda a su familia a solventar sus gastos familiares.

P. desea realizar algunas mejoras en su vivienda, especialmente en el techo, ya que está construido de calaminas, el tiempo ha hecho que estas empiecen a sufrir deterioros y ahora ella ha creído conveniente techar de nuevo su vivienda pero con eternit (láminas mas fuertes y con mayor resistencia). Para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

P. es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y confianza.
texts.en:
P. is 40 years old. She is single and lives together with her family in the area of Tumi de Oro, near the small town of Yencala Boggiano, a rural area involved mostly in agriculture. It is located in the district of Lambayeque, the capital of the region of the same name, located more than 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She raises and sells pigs. She raises these animals in some corrals located near her home and fattens them for sale to businesses that regularly visit the area where she lives. With this business, she covers her own expenses and helps her family with household expenses. 

P. would like to make some improvements to her house, especially the roof because it is made of tin. Time has caused it to deteriorate and now she wants to re-roof her house, but with a product called Eternit (tin roofing that is stronger and more resistant). In order to achieve her goal, she has requested a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternative for PEN 1000.00. 

P. is a hardworking woman. Those who know her have much respect for and trust in her.

loans.use: Improvements to her house, especially the roof

loans.name: Chero De La Cruz

texts.es:
Jesús es casado, tiene 34 años de edad y vive junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en el sector Tumi de Oro del caserío Yencala Boggiano, una zona rural dedicada principalmente a la agricultura, se encuentra situada en el distrito de Lambayeque, capital de la región del mismo nombre, ubicada a más de 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo 

Se dedica a labores relacionadas con la agricultura, el suele criar ganado vacuno y caprino para su posterior engorde y venta. Adicionalmente se dedica a trabajar como peón agrícola en los diversos campos de cultivo de la zona. Ademas tiene un mototaxi con la cual trabaja en sus tiempos libres. Con estas actividades el saca adelante a su familia.

Jesús desea realizar algunas mejoras en su vivienda, especialmente en su sala, para comprar el material y realizar los acabados ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su mayor anhelo es seguir obteniendo estabilidad económica para poder brindarle a su familia una mejor de calidad de vida. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y confianza.
texts.en:
Jesús is married, 34 years old, and lives with his wife and three children in the Tumi de Oro section of the town of Yencala Boggiano.  This is a rural, primarily agricultural zone, that is located in the district of Lambayeque, more than 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

He dedicates himself to work related to farming, raising cattle and goats for later sale.  He also works as a farm laborer at the various harvest lands in the area.  In addition, he has a moto-taxi which he uses to provide transportation services in his free time.  All these activities help him get his family ahead.

Jesús would like to make some improvements to his home, particularly to his living room.  In order to buy the materials and do the work, he has requested his first loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

His greatest wish is to continue to obtain financial stability, in order to provide his family with a higher standard of living.  The people who know him, like and trust him a great deal.

loans.use: To make improvements to his house, especially his living room.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
Marcelino es casado, tiene 39 años de edad y vive junto a su esposa y a sus cuatro hijos en el sector Tumi de Oro del caserío Yencala Boggiano, una zona rural dedicada principalmente a la agricultura, se encuentra situada en el distrito de Lambayeque, capital de la región del mismo nombre, ubicada a más de 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo 

Se dedica a labores relacionadas con la agricultura, el suele criar ganado vacuno y caprino para su posterior engorde y venta. Adicionalmente se dedica a trabajar sembrando algunos granos y cereales en un pequeño terreno de cultivo con el que cuenta. Con estas actividades el saca adelante a su familia.

Marcelino desea realizar algunos arreglos en su terreno para poder instalar el cultivo de arroz en los próximos meses, por este motivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

El es un padre bastante trabajador y entregado a su familia. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y confianza.
texts.en:
Marcelino is married, 39 years old, and lives with his wife and four children in the Tumi de Oro section of the town of Yencala Boggiano.  This is a rural, primarily agricultural zone located in the Lambayeque district, which is more than 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

He dedicates himself to work related to agriculture, such as raising cattle and goats for later sale.  In addition, he works planting some grains and cereals on a small plot of land that he has.  With these activities, he helps his family get ahead.

Marcelino would like to make some improvements to his soil, in order to plant rice in the next few months.  For this reason, he has requested his first loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

He is a hard-working father, who is very devoted to his family.  He is well liked and trusted by the people who know him.

loans.use: To improve his soil in order to plant rice.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:

Boggiano, una zona rural dedicada principalmente a L. agricultura, se encuentra situada en el distrito D. Lambayeque, capital D. L. región del mismo nombre, ubicada a más D. 20 minutos D. L. ciudad D. Chiclayo 

Se dedica a labores relacionadas con L. agricultura, el suele criar ganado vacuno y caprino para su posterior engorD. y venta. Adicionalmente se dedica a trabajar trabajar como peón agrícoL. en los diversos campos D. cultivo D. L. zona. Con estas actividades el saca adelante a su familia.

Julio Cesar desea realizar algunos arreglos en el corral donD. guarda a su ganado para poder mantener a sus animales seguros, por este motivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.

El es un padre bastante trabajador y entregado a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para poder mejorar L. calidad D. vida D. su familia. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y confianza.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar is married, 32 years old, and lives with his wife and young child in the Tumi D. Oro section of the town of YencaL. Boggiano.  This is a rural, primarily agricultural zone, located in the Lambayeque district, which is more than 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

He dedicates himself to work related to agriculture, such as raising cattle and goats for later sale.  In addition, he works as a farm laborer on the various harvest lands in the area.  With these activities, he helps his family get ahead.

Julio Cesar would like to make some improvements to the corral where he keeps his livestock, in order to keep them secure.  For this reason, he has requested his first loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

He is a hard-working father, who is very devoted to his family.  His greatest wish is to continue growing as an entrepreneur, and to improve his family’s standard of living.  He is well liked and trusted by the people who know him.

loans.use: To pay for some expenses to improve his corral.

loans.name: Mankei

texts.en:
Mankei H., age 60, lives in Bayan-Ulgiy province, western Mongolia, with his wife and three children. His youngest daughter is a student and currently lives and studies in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital city. His oldest son works and lives in Kazakhstan after graduating from university, while Mankei's middle daughter has recently completed her undergraduate degree but stays at home currently. 

Since 2006, he has been operating a food-trading business next to his home and has gained many years of experience. His business has not built up to a sustainable level because he purchases his products from local markets at high prices. 

Mankei is an honest and hardworking man. He says, "I want to save my earnings for my children's tuition fees for the future." He is requesting a 1,400,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) loan to purchase more grocery products from Turlik market, one of the main and biggest markets of the province.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products

loans.name: Oyunmandaa

texts.en:
Oyunmandaa T. is 47 years old  and lives with her husband and three children in Harhorin, the ancient capital city of the Mongolian empire, in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. She has been living with her family in their ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent, for the past 18 years. Her middle son, aged 20, attends university while her youngest son, age 13, studies at the local secondary school. 

Oyunmandaa operates a small cafe with the help of her husband. She started her own food service business in 2005 and before that had a dairy product trading business. Since last summer, she has been providing a food service to the tourists at the Erdene-Zuu monastery. She and her husband are planning to open a small cafe by renting a place at the local police department. Today, they own land and a small summer house. Oyunmandaa is a modest woman who says, "All I want is that my children can have a higher education so that they can get good jobs." She is requesting a 1,400,000 MNT loan to change the location of her cafe as well as to pay her son's tuition fees.

loans.use: To open a new cafe and pay her son's tuition fees

loans.name: Satya Laksana Group

texts.en: Ni Ketut S. is a 62-year-old woman living in the town of Melaya - Bali. She is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Ni Ketut S. raises pigs for sale. She has been in this business for over five years and earns approximately 300,000 Indonesian rupiah (IDR) a month. She enjoys her work, especially feeding her pigs and watching them devour the food, as well as watching the birthing process. In 2010, Ni Ketut S. joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Ni Ketut S. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,500,000 IDR from MUK which was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She is now requesting a new loan of 1,500,000 IDR which will be used to purchase more livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her second loan from MUK. Ni Ketut S. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. She hopes also that she will be able to help her grandchildren with their education and hopes they attain a high level so they can have a bright future. Ni Ketut S. is the leader of a 14 member group accessing a loan offered by MUK. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Satya Laksana (PK-10306)". About MUK The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans, thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives. Ni Ketut S. 0 (0) merupakan 62 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali. Ni Ketut S. adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 14 anggota. Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar. Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Satya Laksana (PK-10306). Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Ketut S. sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 5 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Ketut S. menghasilkan sekitar 0,300 IDR. Dalam 2010, Ni Ketut S. bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Ketut S. telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya sebesar 1.500.000 IDR dari MUK. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli pakan ternak & pasokan lain. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1.500.000 IDR. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK. Tentang MUK: Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Tsegmid

texts.en:
Tsegmid T. is 34 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Uvs, Mongolia. He and his family live in their ger /Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His wife operates a sewing business by producing a variety of deels, a traditional Mongolian coat, in their home.Tsegmid has been operating a taxi service for the past five years after moving to the capital city of the province. He used to live a nomadic lifestyle in the country, herding his livestock. 

Over the years, he has built a stable taxi service with a monthly revenue of between 150,000 and 180,000 MNT. He wants to change cars and get a more convenient, faster one. He has sold his previous car at 2,000,000 MNT and soon will purchase a new car in Ulaanbaatar. Tsegmid is a very clever and talkative person. He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a new Japanese car at 4,500,000 MNT for his taxi business.

loans.use: To purchase a new car

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia C. is from the village of Marapong, Sibutad. She is 58 years old, married and has three adult children. To make a living, Sonia has grown rice to sell for the past eight years. She earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Sonia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC and is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used for rice production. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Sonia from PMPC. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for rice production

loans.name: Tumentungalag

texts.en:
Tumentungalag B. is a 30-year-old single mother with a ten-year-old son. She and her son live in Harhorin, the ancient capital city of Mongolian Empire. Her son attends a local secondary school. 

Tumentungalag operates a beauty salon in a rented space at the Manlai-Tod market. She began her business in 2001 with her mother and brother. All of the hairdressers are her family members. They are now planning to open and run an accessory selling business by renting another stall at the local market. She is a modest and hardworking woman who says, "I want to expand my business and increase my income." 

She is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a variety of accessories and fancy articles that will be sold in her new stall.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of accessories

loans.name: Melfie

texts.en:

To make a living, she makes and sells snacks, special recipes, ice and ice candy (similar to popsicles, only fruit juice based). Melfie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Melfie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC.

Melfie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells. This will be her 2nd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Sintia Josefina

texts.es: Sintia Josefina P. P. de 32 años de edad,  es una persona muy entregada a su familia, reside en Ciudad Delgado, en el departamento de San Salvador, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como mesero y junto a cuatro hijos de 12, 10, 7 y 5 años de edad. Sintia trabaja muy duro día con día para comercializa su producto, el cual es ropa interior femenina, durante toda la semana ella trabaja por todo el mercado Central de San Salvador, ofreciendo brasieres, pantys y otros más, las cuales vende con las vendedoras  y propietarias de los puestos y así mismo con las personas que visitan el mercado. Desde hace 9 años que ella se gana la vida de esta manera lo que le ha permitido brindarle ayuda económica a su esposo. Es por esta razón que ella solicita un préstamo con el deseo de aumentar sus productos y de esta forma mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Sintia Josefina P. P. is 32 years old and devoted to her family. She lives in Ciudad Delgado, in the department of San Salvador, where he lives with her husband, who works as a waiter, and their four children, aged 12, 10, 7 and 5. Sintia works very hard every day to sell her goods, basically female underwear. During the week she works in the central market of San Salvador, offering bras, panties and more, which she sells to the sellers and stall owners as well as the people visiting the market. She has doing it to earn a living for 9 years, which has allowed her to financially help her husband. She is requesting a loan to increase her stocks and improve profits.

loans.use: Buy underwear to resell.

location.town: Ciudad Delgado en el departamento de San  Salvador

loans.name: María Francisca

texts.es: María Francisca A. D. B. D. 53 años D. edad, resiD. en San Juan Opico, ubicado en el departamento D. La Libertad. Ella vive junto a su hijo D. 14 años D. edad, y junto a su esposo quien trabaja como agricultor. María es una persona muy esforzada quien se dedica a sus dos negocios: una tienda en la cual comercializa productos D. primera necesidad y así mismo D. uso domésticos, y también cuenta con una panadería en la cual ella se encarga D. elaborar el pan cada mañana. Los negocios están ubicados en su casa D. habitación lo cual es muy bueno para ella debido a que se encuentra en una zona muy populosa en donD. no hay otra panadería en los alrededores, por lo que sus ventas diarias son muy aceptables. María con el deseo D. ver en mejores condiciones su hogar, solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar: harina, manteca, sal, levadura y todo lo esencial para elaborar más pan, así mismo ella desea invertir en la tienda para aumentar sus productos y D. esta forma percibir mayores ganancias.
texts.en: María Francisca A. D. B. is 53 years old and lives in San Juan Opico, in the department of La Libertad. She lives with her 14 year old son and her husband, who works as a farmer. María is a very hardworking person and she runs two businesses: a shop, selling staples and basic household products, and a bakery, for which she bakes bread every morning. The businesses are run from her own home, which has a great location. It's in a very populated area with no bakeries nearby, which means that her daily sales are more than acceptable. María wants to improve her home, so she is applying for a loan to buy flour, butter, salt, yeast and other essentials to produce larger quantities of bread, as well as to buy more stock for the shop and so increase her profits.

loans.use: Buy perishable goods.

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es: María Isabel R. G. 57 años de edad, se dedica al cuidado de la imagen de las personas, tanto de hombres como de mujeres y niños, ella vive en San Juan Opico, un pequeño pueblo ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad, lugar en el cual reside junto a su esposo, el cual trabaja como ordenanza y junto a una nieta de 16 años de edad. María posee una sala de belleza, la cual esta ubicada en  su casa de habitación, una zona muy apta para todo tipo de negocio, ya que es un lugar muy concurrido. Ella es una persona la cual realiza un excelente trabajo, elaborando diferentes servicios como: cortes de cabello, tintes, faciales, pedicure, entre otros más, María es muy recomendada en el lugar ya que desde hace 13 años que ella se dedica a este trabajo, el cual con el paso de los años ha ido perfeccionando, por lo que sus clientes están muy satisfechos, lo que es de mucho beneficio para ella ya que la recomiendan con más personas. María no solo es una persona muy trabajadora, sino también es una mujer muy dedicada a su hogar, ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda  invertir en su negocio, y así mejorarlo,  para contar con más cliente y de esta forma salir adelante.
texts.en: María Isabel R. G. is 57 years old. Her job is to groom her clients, from men to women and children. She lives in San Juan Opico, a small town in the department of La Libertad. She lives with her husband, who works as a porter, and a 16 year old niece. María owns a beauty salon, which is located in her home, in an area suitable for all types of business because it is always very busy. She does an excellent job and provides different services such as haircuts, hair colouring, facials and pedicures, among others. María has been working in the area for 13 years and she gets lots of recommendations. She has refined her technique and her clients are very happy, which is very beneficial for her because she is recommended to more and more people. María is not only very hard working, but also devoted to her family. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business in order to improve it, so she can serve more customers and get ahead.

loans.use: Buy products for beauty salon.

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Francisca Isabel

texts.es: Francisca Isabel B. D. M. D. 50 años D. edad, vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos D.: 15 y 23 años D. edad quienes se dedican a estudiar, y junto a los cuales vive en Santa Tecla, ubicado en el departamento D. La Libertad. Francisca posee una tienda D. productos perecederos, la cual esta ubicada en su casa D. habitación, negocio el cual le permite contar con todo lo necesario para el hogar y sus familia, es por esta razón que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda  contar con el dinero necesario para equipar su negocio con todo lo necesario para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, ya que en muchas ocasiones se ve obligada a perder algunas ventas, ya que no posee los productos que le solicitan, circunstancias las cuales ella desea poder cambiar, para mejorar y salir adelante con su negocio. Francisca es una señora muy visionaria quien siempre desea salir adelante e ir creciendo día con día por el bienestar D. ella y su hogar, ya que para ella es muy importante poder aportar a su casa y D. esta forma poder vivir D. una manera tranquila en la cual pueda contar con todo lo necesario para sus hijos, su esposo y ella.
texts.en: Francisca Isabel B. D. M. is 50 years old. She lives with her husband and two children, aged 15 and 23 years old, who are in school. They live together in the town of Santa Tecla, located in the department of La Libertad. Francisca has a perishible products store located in her house. This business allows her to have what she needs for her home and family. That is why she is asking for a loan with which she can have enough money to outfit her business with everything it needs to offer her customers a better service. On many occasions she has had to lose some sales since she doesn't have the products they are asking for. She would like to be able to change these circumstances to improve and get ahead in her business. Francisca is a visionary woman who always wants to get ahead and keep growing day to day for her and her home's wellbeing. For her it is very important to be able to contribute to her home and in this way be able to live in a calmer way with everything she needs for her children, her spouse, and herself.

loans.use: To buy perishable products.

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Reyna Elizabeth

texts.es: Reyna Elizabeth M. J. de 22 años de edad, reside en Cojutepeque, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Ella vive con su esposo el cual trabajo como comerciante de productos varios y así mismo vive junto a su pequeño hijo de 1 año de edad. a pesar que Reyna es una mujer muy joven, cuenta con grandes responsabilidades, por lo que trabaja muy duro día con día en su venta de sandalias para hombres, mujeres y niños, la cual esta ubicada en el mercado de San Martín ubicado en el departamento de Cuscatlán, gracias a este negocio Reyna le ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar una mayor variedad de sandalias de forma que obtenga mayores ganancias. Reyna es una joven muy emprendedora quien posee muchas ganas de salir adelante y darle todo lo mejor a su pequeño hijo para quien desea un futuro mejor.
texts.en: Reyna Elizabeth M. J. is 22 years old and lives in Cojutepeque, located in the department of La Libertad. She lives with her husband, who works as a merchant of various products. She also lives with her young son who is 1 year old. Despite being a very young woman, Reyna has a lot of responsibilities. She works very hard day to day selling sandals for men, women and children. Her stall is located in the San Martin market located in the  department of Cuscatlán. Thanks to this business, Reyna helps her husband with the household expenses. She is asking for a loan with which she can buy a greater variety of sandals in order to have more profit.  Reyna is a very enterprising young woman who really wants to get ahead and give the best to her young son for whom she wants a better future.

loans.use: To buy sandals

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: María Edulia

texts.es: María Edulia A. D. A., madre soltera D. 34 años D. edad, vive junto a sus dos hijos D. 12 y 13 años D. edad, con los cuales resiD. en el municipio D. Soyapango. María posee su propia tienda en la cual comercializa productos varios como golosinas, pan, papel higiénico, pastillas y algunos tipos D. detergentes, a pesar que ya cuenta con 8 años D. experiencia, debido a que la mayoría D. ganancias son destinas al sostenimiento del hogar, ella invierte muy poco al negocio, por lo que necesita una ayuda para mejorarlo. Es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo a Integral, por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad D. productos como huevos, jugos, leches, pan, más golosinas en diferentes marcas, D. manera que sus clientes tengan mayor variedad para escoger y así comprar más. María es una persona muy dedicada a lo que hace, es por ello que su mayor deseo es poder crecer en su negocio y así mismo brindar un mejor servicio en el cual sus clientes se sientan cómodas al comprar en su tienda y D. esta manera ella pueda mejorar sus ganancias, lo cual sería D. gran beneficio para su familia.
texts.en: María Edulia A. D. A. is a 34 year old single mother who lives with her two children, aged 12 and 13. They live in the town of Soyapango. María owns her own store where she sells various products such as snacks, bread, toilet paper, pills and some types of detergent. Despite having 8 years of experience, she invests very little in the business, since most of the earnings are used to support the home. That is why she needs some help to improve it. She is asking Integral for a loan with which she can have enough money to be able to buy a larger quantity of products such as eggs, juice, milk, bread, and more snacks from different brands. That way, her customers will have a wider variety to choose from and will buy more. María is a very dedicated to what she does and that is why she wants to grow her business and offer a better service where her customers can feel comfortable shopping and thus she can improve her income.  This would be a great benefit for her family.

loans.use: To buy basic necessity products

loans.name: Olivia

texts.es: Olivia M. D. M. D. 40 años D. edad, resiD. en San Juan Opico, departamento D. La Libertad. Ella vive junto a sus dos hijos D. 18 y 20 años D. edad, quienes estudian y le ayudan con los quehaceres del hogar a Olivia. Ella posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos D. primera necesidad tanto alimenticios como para el hogar, Olivia es una señora muy alegre y amable, quien debe esforzarse mucho por salir adelante y poder contar con todo lo necesario para tener una vida digna. DesD. hace 12 años que ella posee la tienda en su casa D. habitación, por lo que es muy conocida en la zona y a pesar D. que tiene mucha competencia en los alrededores, siempre es preferida por las personas del lugar, ya que es D. mucha confianza en toda la zona. Olivia solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar todo lo necesario para surtir más su negocio, comprando granos básicos, detergentes, desinfectantes, pan, leche, huevos, productos lácteos y todo lo que es más necesario y que sus clientes solicitan más en la tienda, así mismo Olivia desea poder incluir productos nuevos, los cuales a pesar que tienen poco tiempo D. estar en el mercado poseen una gran demanda como golosinas y bebidas, las cuales le asegurarían aumentar sus ventas, lo cual es la prioridad principal D. ella, ya que D. esta manera podrá contar con una mejor estabilidad en su hogar.
texts.en: Olivia M. D. M. is 40 years old and lives in San Juan Opico, La Libertad department. She lives together with her two children who are aged 18 and 20 years. They study and help Olivia with the household chores. She has a shop selling basic necessities such as everyday food items. Olivia is a very happy and amiable person who works hard to get ahead and to be able to live a decent life. She has run the shop from her home for 12 years and she is well known in her local area. Despite a high level of competition, she is always people’s preferred place to go to as everyone is confident in her. Olivia is asking for a loan so that she can buy the necessary stock for her business: grains, detergents, disinfectants, bread, milk, eggs, dairy products and all of the things that her customers come into her shop asking for. Also Olivia wants to be able to introduce new products for which there is high demand, such as sweets and drinks, which will be sure to increase her sales. This is her main priority as she will then be able to have a more stable home life.

loans.use: To buy food and household stock for her shop

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel es un padre de familia de 43 años de edad que reside en el sector Insculas del distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicada a más de una hora y cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace más de cinco años a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura. Por un lado posee un pequeño terreno de cultivo en el que usualmente siembra limón y adicionalmente cría animales menores para venderlos a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona. Con estas actividades el saca adelante a su familia y trata de darles una mejor calidad de vida.

Daniel desea adquirir una motobomba para poder regar su cultivo de manera más eficiente, ya que en la zona el agua para usos agrícolas es escasa y generalmente tienen que valerse de pozos para regar sus cultivos. Durante los últimos meses ha venido ahorrando dinero y ahora se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles con los cuales espera completar el dinero que necesita para lograr su objetivo.

El es una persona emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario y poder obtener buenas cosechas para asegurarle el sustento a su familia.
texts.en:
Daniel, 43, is a father who lives in Insculas, an agricultural region that belongs to the Lambayeque province, which is located more than an hour and 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. 

He has worked for over 5 years in agriculture. On one side, he has a small field in which he usually plants lemons. In addition, raises animals to sell to dealers who often visit the area. With this work, Daniel helps his family get ahead and tries to give them a better quality of life. 

Daniel wants to buy a pump in order to irrigate his crops more efficiently, since water for farming use is scarce in his area and people generally rely on wells for irrigation. Over the last few months, Daniel has been saving money and he is now requesting a loan for 800 soles (USD 300) from Edpyme Alternativa, which he hopes will satisfy the total amount of money he needs to complete his goal. 

Daniel is an entrepreneurial person with a strong desire to succeed. His greatest desire is to continue growing as a business person and to harvest good crops, ensuring his family’s livelihood.

loans.use: Purchase a pump to draw water from wells and irrigate crops

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchasing a new sewing machine

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es:
Fidel es un padre de familia de 24 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el sector Insculas del distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola ubicada en la provincia de Lambayeque a más de una hora y cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
Se dedica desde hace cuatro años a la crianza y comercialización de animales. El adquiere los animales a los vecinos del lugar, los engorda y luego los vende a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive. Usualmente comercializa ovejas. El negocio le ayuda a solventar sus gastos personales y sacar adelante a su familia.
Fidel desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales para así poder ampliar sus ventas y pedir más ganancias. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles con los cuales espera seguir adquiriendo ovejas para lograr su objetivo.
Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y confianza.En la imagen aparace junto a sus hijos
texts.en:
Fidel is a 24 year old family man.  He lives with his wife and their children in the Insculas sector of the Olmos district.  It is an agricultural zone located in the Lambayeque province, which is over an hour and 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

He has been raising and selling animals for four years.  He gets the animals from neighbors in the area.  He fattens them and then sells them to merchants who always visit the area where he lives.  He usually sells sheep.  The business helps him pay for personal expenses, and it helps get the family ahead.

Fidel wishes to expand his business by purchasing more animals.  That way he would be able to increase sales and solicit more income.  

That is why he believed it was advisable to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan for 2,000 soles.  He plans use the loan to continue getting sheep in order to obtain his objective. 

His greatest desire is to continue growing as a businessman in order to improve his family’s quality of life.  People who know him hold him in high esteem and trust him.

He appears in the photo with his children.

loans.use: To buy sheep to raise and sell

loans.name: Jose De Los Milagros

texts.es:
José tiene 27 años, es soltero y vive junto a su familia en el caserío Cruz Verde del distrito de Motupe, una zona agrícola de la provincia de Lambayeque, se encuentra situado a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace más de dos años a la crianza y venta de animales menores, cría diversos animales en algunos corrales situados cerca de su vivienda y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes de la zona. Estas actividades son las que le permiten sustentar sus gastos personales y apoyar a su familia.

El desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales para ampliar su negocio, piensa comprar ganado ovino, caprino y porcino. De este modo planea ampliar su negocio y percibir más ingresos. Para lograr sus clientes ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

José desea seguir creciendo para mejorar gradualmente su calidad de vida. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
José is 27 years old and single.  He lives with his family in the Cruz Verde settlement in the Motupe district.  It is an agricultural zone located in the Lambayeque province, which is over an hour and 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For more than two years he has been raising and selling small animals.  He raises different animals in some pens close to his home.  When the animals have reached a good level of development he sells them to the merchants in the area.  These activities allow him to pay for personal expenses and to support his family.

He wishes to expand his business by purchasing more animals.  He plans to buy sheep, goats, and pigs.  This is the way he plans to expand his business and get more income.

In order to achieve this he has requested a loan for 1,500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

José wishes to keep growing in order to gradually improve his quality of life.  The people who know him consider him to be a levelheaded and responsible person.

loans.use: To buy animals to raise and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy animals to raise in order to sell their meat at home.

loans.name: Vazgen

texts.en:
Vazgen G. was born in 1976. He lives in Gandzakar village in the Ijevan area with his parents, his wife and his newborn baby. Vazgen is a policeman and, simultaneously with his permanent work, Vazgen engages in land cultivation, cattle breeding and swine breeding. He says cattle breeding is more profitable than land cultivation and swine breeding, thus thanks to profit from cattle-breeding, Vazgen solves most parts of his family’s needs. 

Vazgen asks for an 800.000 Armenian Dram loan to buy some calves for his farm and fodder for his farm animals. Vazgen is on his fifth loan cycle as a client with Nor Horizon and he has never delayed his repayments.

loans.use: To buy some calves for his farm and fodder for his farm animals

loans.name: Geoffry

texts.en:
Geoffry is a dairy farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been farming for the last three years and employs one farmhand. He sells his milk to the local market. He also earns income from his small-scale farming of tea, which he sells locally.

Geoffry is 36 years old and married with two children, ages 3 and 7. Both children attend school.

Geoffry has requested this loan of 70,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will go towards the education of his children. His biggest challenge has been lack of enough animal feeds. Despite this challenge, he hopes to acquire a pure dairy breed and build a dairy unit in the future. He says that he is happy with the way Juhudi operates.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Pigy Lestari Group

texts.en: Ni Komang R. is a 46-year-old woman living in the town of Melaya - Bali. She is married and has three adult children. Ni Komang R.'s main source of income comes from raising pigs for sale. She has been in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 250,000 Indonesian rupiah (IDR) a month. In 2009, Ni Komang R. joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Ni Komang R. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000,000 IDR from MUK which was used to invest in expanding the business. She is now requesting a new loan of 1,000,000 IDR which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her fourth loan from MUK. Ni Komang R. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. Ni Komang R. is the leader of a 10 member group accessing a loan offered by MUK. The official name of this borrowing group is "Pigy Lestari" (PK-10313). While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. As the leader of this group, Ni Komang R. hopes the group can become financially independent so they do not need to borrow again. This is evidenced by requiring each member to save in accordance with their capabilities. When the numbers are sufficient, the group members can pay off their loans. About MUK The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans, thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives. Ni Komang R. 0 (0) merupakan 46 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali. Ni Komang R. adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 10 anggota. Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar. Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Pigy Lestari (PK-10313). Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Komang R. sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 10 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Komang R. menghasilkan sekitar 0,250 IDR. Dalam 2009, Ni Komang R. bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Komang R. telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya sebesar 1.000.000 IDR dari MUK. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk berinvestasi dengan mengembangkan bisnis. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1.000.000 IDR. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 4th pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK. Tentang MUK: Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Shaloobu

texts.en:
Shaloobu I. is 57 years old, married, and has five grown children. Her four daughters live on their own. Her son, in keeping with Kyrgyz tradition, lives with her and helps in the family household. Shaloobu is well educated and works as a geography teacher in the school in Kenesh village. She is known for her strong commitment to education. 

Unfortunately, teacher salaries in rural areas are very low. For this reason, in 1990, Shaloobu began to breed farm animals using starting capital of 10,000 KGS. She also began to grow potatoes and clover on her farm. Her ongoing efforts to develop the farm led Shaloobu to obtain her first loan from Bai-Tushum and Partners, which was used as intended and repaid without any delays. Now Shaloobu plans to use this loan of 100,000 KGS to buy eleven sheep, three bull calves, and two colts. With the revenues from the loan, she plans to pay for her son's wedding. In the future, Shaloobu wants to increase the number of cattle on her farm. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase sheep, cattle, and horses

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan N. is 33 years old and married to Joshua N.. They have two children, ages 16 and 10. They live in Baharini near Eldoret town. Susan has a grocery store. She has been in this business for the past ten years and earns an income of 10,000 KES per month.

Susan was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend. She is applying for her second loan of 50,000 KES with KADET LTD. With this loan she plans to buy bananas, tomatoes, onion, carrots, and potatoes.

She hopes to operate a large scale grocery in Municipal Market of Eldoret.

loans.use: To buy produce for her store

loans.name: Hadicha's Group

texts.en: Hadicha H. is the leader of the group. She is 42 and married. She has a daughter and three sons. Hadicha makes money by selling wood and her husband works as a cook. He also earns money by transporting goods. Hadicha started her business five years ago with the initial investment of 300 soms and now she makes 6,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, she wants to increase the turnover of her business. In the future, she wants to improve her living conditions and provide her children with a good education. Muharramhan M. is the treasurer of the group. She is 59 and a widow. She has raised two sons and a daughter. Six years ago, with the initial investment of 80,000 soms, Mauharramhan started a wholesale trade in sunflowers. In this way, she makes 10,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, she wants to increase the turnover of her business. In the future, she wants to start building a house for her son. Manzurahon H., 37, is married. She has a son and two daughters. The son is at school and the daughters are not yet. Manzurahon is a nurse and her husband works as a cook. Six years ago, they started to breed livestock. Manzurahon hopes to obtain the loan because she needs money to purchase farm animals for breeding. In the future, she wants to increase the number of livestock, build a new house and provide her children with a good education. Muhtabarhon H., 62, is a widow. She has raised daughters and two sons. All the children are married and working. A year ago, Muhtabarhon bought a calf and now she wants to get a loan to purchase sheep for breeding. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase more wood

loans.name: Dorfina Filipe

texts.pt:
Dorfina Filipe C. nasceu no Distrito de Massinga, Província de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique, mãe de 2 filhos. Fez somente 7ª classe não continuou devido a falta condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria e sustenta seus irmãos que vivem com ela. 

Saiu de Inhambane para Maputo a fim de continuar com seus estudos a residir com a sua tia. Trabalha como operaria agrícola numa empresa de produção agrícola ha mais de 4 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salario de 1.690.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum de vez enquanto na sua conta bancaria.
 
Nunca teve empréstimo em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos que são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (portas, cimento, barrotes, pedra, areia, chapas de zinco e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua residência.

Esta confiante que vai pagar sem nenhum problema e pedir um novo empréstimo para concluir sua casa.
texts.en: Dorfina Filipe C. was born in Massinga, province of Inhambane, in Southern Mozambique. The mother of two, she left Inhambane to go live in Maputo with an aunt, in order to continue her studies. Her schooling was interrupted when she was in 7th Grade, due to financial constraints. She lives in a house she owns with her children and brothers, whom she supports. For the past four years she has been working at an agricultural factory, currently earning a monthly salary of 1.690.00mt, which allows her to take care of household expenses as well as save some money in the bank. Dorfina has never requested loans from other banks. She found out about Hluvuku through friends who are clients of the institution. This is her third loan and she plans to use the money to buy construction material (cement, iron, stones, beams, sand, zinc plates, etc) to continue the construction work on her house. She's confident in her ability to pay back the loan and plans to apply for more loans in the future, to finish the house.

loans.use: to buy construction material (doors, cement, beams, stone, sand, zinc plates, etc)

loans.name: Bernard Wachira

texts.en:
Bernard runs his transport business in Naivasha town. He also buys farm products directly from farmers and sells them at a profit in Naivasha town. He is 36 years old and married to Sarah Wanjiru. They have two children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD. by a friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to buy 15 bags of maize and eight bags of beans at a wholesale price from the farmers and sell at a profit at the market.

In the future, Bernard hopes to own a big store of cereals and become a major supplier of cereals in Naivasha.

loans.use: To buy 15 bags of maize and eight bags of beans

loans.name: Eugenia Joaquim

texts.pt:
Eugenia Joaquim C. nasceu no Distrito de Massinga, Província de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique, mãe de 1 filha já casada. Fez somente 6ª classe não continuou devido a falta condições financeiras para sustentar seus estudos. Vive na casa própria e sustenta sua mãe enviando alguns bens alimentares e valor monetário. 

Saiu de Inhambane para Maputo a fim de vir residir com o irmão que era militar e residia na capital do país. Trabalha numa empresa de produção de Biscoitos como segurança ha mais de 5 anos. Tem um salario de 2.625.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum de vez enquanto na sua conta bancaria.
 
Nunca teve empréstimo em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de trabalho de mobilização efetuada pelos oficiais da instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 10.400.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, ferro, barrotes, pedra, areia, chapas de zinco e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua residência.

Esta confiante que vai pagar sem nenhum problema e pedir um novo empréstimo para concluir sua casa.
texts.en: Eugenia Joaquim C. was born in the district of Massinga, in the Inhambane province of Southern Mozambique. She is the mother of a grown and married daughter. Her schooling was interrupted in 6th Grade due to financial constraints. Eugenia left Inhambane for Maputo to go live with her brother, who was in the military. She now owns the house she lives in and supports her mother, who is still in Massinga, by sending her money and foodstuffs. For the past five years she has been working as a security guard at a cookie factory, where she earns a monthly salary of 2.625.00mt. Her salary allows her to take care of her needs and obligations as well as to save some money in the bank. Eugenia has never requested loans from other banks. She found out about Hluvuku through the outreach efforts of the institution's officers. This is her first loan and she plans to use it to buy construction material (cement, iron, stones, sand, zinc plates, etc) to continue working on her house. She's confident in her ability to pay back the loan and plans to apply for more loans in the future, to finish the house.

loans.use: To buy construction material (cement, iron, stones, sand, zinc plates, etc)

loans.name: Manuel

texts.pt:
Manuel H. nasceu na cidade de Tete, Província do mesmo nome, norte de 
Moçambique, casado. Fez somente 5ª classe não continuou devido a dificuldades 
Financeiras. Vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém para além da sua família.

Saiu de Tete para Maputo a procura de melhores condições de vida. Tem um negócio próprio que desenvolve em sua própria casa ha mais de 10 anos. Não possui nenhum empregado e tem um rendimento de cerca de 5.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de um vizinho que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (arroz, cerveja, refrescos, farinha e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.

Esta confiante que vai pagar sem nenhum problema, no futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para melhorar cada vez mais o seu negócio.
texts.en: Born in the town of Tete, in the province of the same name in Northern Mozambique, Manuel H. is married and lives with his family in a house they own. Due to financial constraints, his studies were interrupted in 5th Grade. He left Tete for Maputo 10 years ago, in search of a better life, and since then has been running a small home-based grocery store. Since he doesn't have any employees working for him, he is able to make 5.000.00mt per month. After paying for household expenses, each month Manuel is able to save some money in the bank. He had never taken out any loans before learning about Hluvuku from a neighbor. This is his third loan with the institution. He plans to use the 15.000.00mt to by more products to sell (rice, beer, soft drinks, flour, etc). He's confident in his ability to pay back his loan and plans to continue applying for loans with Hluvuku in the future, to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell at his home-based grocery store (rice, beer, soft drinks, flour, etc)

loans.name: Mariya's Group

texts.en:
Mariya  J. is the leader of this group. She is 58 years old and married. She has ten children, most of whom are married. A long time ago, Mariya and her husband started to breed livestock. They make 5000 KGS a month selling the fattened farm animals. They also have a piece of land where they grow wheat. Maria applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase hay and to hire laborers to collect the harvest. In the future she plans to repair her house.

Mahabat J. is the treasurer of the group. She is 38 years old and married. She has three sons and a daughter.  The first son works in constructor and the other children are in school. Mahabat breeds cattle. Her husband went to work in Russia. With the loan money, Mahabat wants to purchase hay for her cattle.

Seyezbek T., 44, is married. He has two sons and two daughters. Seyzbek is a farmer who grows wheat. With the loan money, he wants to hire laborers for the harvest. He wants to provide his children with a good education. 

Abdiubiraiym  B., 44, is married and has three children who are in school.  Abdiubiraiym also breeds cattle. He hopes to obtain the loan because he needs money to repaire his house. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious, and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line:
• People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society)
• Planet (being environmentally friendly)
• Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). 

MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members receive special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To hire laborers for the harvest

loans.name: Malumbo Group

texts.en:
Kulwa S. is in his mid forties. He is married and has four children. Kulwa has been running a food stall since 1999. He sells fruits and vegetables. The stall is open daily between 6 am and 6 pm. Kulwa earns a good monthly profit from his business. 

This will be Kulwa's second Mothisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  (A Mothisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended.) Kulwa used his first loan to increase his stock of vegetables, and he plans to do the same with his second loan. Kulwa also plans to use the loan to buy new types of fruits and vegetables. Kulwa's dream is to open another food stall in the near future. 

Kulwa will share the loan with his loan group called Malumbo, which has 12 members. The members of the group will hold each other responsible for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Kulwa is standing in the back row, the first person on the left.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Anne Wanjiku

texts.en:
Anne Wanjiku N., 34, is a hardworking lady. She is married to David N., and they have two children (ages 14 and 12). Anne has sold electrical gadgets for the past 12 years and she earns a monthly income of 12,000 KES.

When Anne learned about KADET LTD, she immediately applied for a loan of 15,000 KES, which she will use to buy bulbs, electrical wires, and fuses. Anne hopes to grow her business and become the leading local investor in her town. 

She wants to provide her children with a good education so they can realize their dreams in life.

loans.use: To buy bulbs, electrical wires, and fuses.

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared, 30, is married and has two children. He runs a furniture workshop. He has been running the workshop with two employees. To earn extra income, he also runs a retail shop and his wife assists him in running the business. Jared, who has 10 years of experience in his business, hopes to open more businesses in the future. He has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to expand his furniture business.

He was not available for the photo, so we took his wife’s photo in their retail business.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a member of Pamoja Entrpreneurs group in Faulu Kenya. For four years, he has been running a retail shop. He also sells mobile phone air-time cards in wholesale. He has been able to increase his business assets through Faulu Kenya. He was previously selling spare parts to earn a living.  He hopes to penetrate a larger market in the future.  

George has requested a loan of 70,000 KES to buy sugar, rice, cooking fat, and bar soap.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, cooking fat, and bar soap

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is a hardworking businessman. He is married and blessed with three children who go to school. He owns and runs Genesis Butchery, which is located within the Mukuru kwa Njenga slums. He has been running the business for three years. Apart from that, he runs a retail shop.  He hopes to own a wholesale business as well as a popular hotel in the future.  

He has requested 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy meat and to add stock of sugar, cooking fat, maize flour and salt.

loans.use: To buy meat and add stock of sugar, cooking fat, maize flour and salt

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline is a member of the Vigilant Group in Faulu Kenya. She sells charcoal in the Fuata Nyayo slums. She has been engaged in the business for three years, with most of her customers being low-income earners.  

She has benefited from the training offered by Faulu Kenya and she has learned how to manage her business. She wants to add stock of charcoal with the loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings. She hopes to expand her business into a wholesale one in the future.

loans.use: To add stock of charcoal

loans.name: Fatima Ricardo

texts.pt:
Fátima Recardo G. nasceu na cidade de Quelimane, Província da Zambezia, norte de Moçambique, solteira. Freqüenta o último ano do Instituto superior. Vive na casa própria e sustenta sua irmã e 2 sobrinhos que vivem com ela. 

Saiu de Quelimane para Maputo na companhia da sua irmã afim continuar com os seus estudos. Trabalha como escriturária na contabilidade do Ministério do interior ha mais de 16 anos, recebe um salario de 11.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum valor na sua conta bancaria (Banco Barclays).

Nunca teve empréstimo em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (ferro, cimento, areia, pedra e outros) para construir uma garagem para a sua viatura.

Esta confiante que vai pagar sem nenhum problema e pedir um novo empréstimo para iniciar uma actividade comercial.
texts.en:
Fátima Recardo G. was born in the town of Quelimane, province of Zambezia, in Northern Mozambique. She's attending the last year of Instituto Superior. Single, no children, Fátima lives with her sister and two nephews in a house she owns.

She left Quelimane for Maputo in the company of her sister in order to continue her studies. For the past 16 years she has been working as a clerk in a public institution, receiving a monthly salary of 11.500.00mt. After paying for the household expenses, she is able to put some money into her savings account at Barclays Bank.

She has never had a loan with another institution and learned about Hluvuku through friends who are clients. This is her first loan and she plans to use the 20.000.00mt to buy construction material (iron, cement, sand, stones, etc) to build a garage for her car.

She's confident in her ability to pay back this loan and plans to apply for another loan in the future, to start her own business.

loans.use: to buy construction material (iron, cement, sand, stone, etc)

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a dairy farmer in Kiambu. He is married and blessed with five children. He has been farming for the past nine years. He sells milk to the people of his local residence. In addition to farming, he is a photographer.  

As a businessman, he says that Faulu Kenya has helped him to save his money. He has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings from Faulu Kenya.  With the loan, he will buy another cow.  He hopes that he will become a large-scale farmer in the future.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a member of the Kiserian Victory group in Faulu Kenya. He sells food, milk and eggs to earn a living. He was previously employed before he started the business. He has become more focused in his business since he joined Faulu Kenya.  

So far, he has serviced one loan from Faulu Kenya. He hopes to expand his food kiosk in the future. He has requested 40,000 Kenyan shillings to build a food kiosk.

loans.use: To build a food stall

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a 33-year-old married man.  He runs Vision Property Agents to earn a living.  He has been running the business for eight years and has employed two people.  He also has transport business to boost his income. He was previously selling vegetables. He hopes to expand his business and get a business network with many landlords. This will help him to grow his business. He has requested for a loan of 40,000 KES to buy a computer.

loans.use: To buy a computer.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.pt:
Luciana T. nasceu na cidade de Tete, Província do mesmo nome, norte de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 6 filhos maiores de idade 2 dos quais ainda freqüentam escola. Fez ensino primário na Republica do Zimbabwe, não continuou devido a dificuldades financeiras. Vive na casa própria e sustenta sua irmã e 2 sobrinhos que vivem com ela. 

Saiu de Tete para Maputo com o seu esposo quando foi transferido pelos serviços. É pensionista do Ministério da Defesa e recebe 5.154.00 por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum com ajuda do marido que também é reformado do mesmo Ministério.

Nunca teve empréstimo em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (pregos, ferro, cimento, areia, pedra e outros) para continuar com a construção da sua casa.

No futuro quer solicitar mais um empréstimo para a conclusão da sua casa. Esta confiante que vai pagar sem nenhum problema.
texts.en:
Luciana T. was born in the town of Tete, in the province of the same name, in Northern Mozambique.
