loans.use: To purchase cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en: Gevorg M. is married with 2 children. The happy family lives with Gevorg’s pensioner parents. Gevorg has been in the car spare parts business since 2008. He has longstanding and well-developed customer relations. Being a good and trustworthy businessman, Gevorg offers his clients competitive deals. With the business income, Gevorg takes care of his whole family. Gevorg would like to purchase spare parts to meet his clients’ needs and extend the business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Mariée et mère  de 5 enfants, Madame Aminata Koné est âgée de 38 ans et vit dans une famille monogame avec  son mari et ses enfants  dans le quartier Hamdallaye de la préfecture de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso).  
Elle n’ a pu faire des études dû à des raisons sociales. C’est ainsi qu’elle s’est  vite intéressée au commerce depuis à bas âge auprès de sa maman, en exerçant diverses activités génératrices. Depuis maintenant dix ans elle évolue seule et est très sollicitée dans son secteur.  Elle reçoit des commandes de bazins à travers des associations féminines de son quartier pour des uniformes lors des événements sociaux.  
Pour l’élargissement et l’amélioration de son activité,  Madame Aminata n’a pas pris du temps pour faire recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis 3 ans.  Après 4 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) tous payés correctement sans difficulté, elle est à son 2ème prêt individuel  dont le précédent a été bien remboursé. 
Avec ce financement, elle compte acheter, 6 pièces de bazins moyen riche, 2kg de potasse et divers colorants à Bamako.  Elle effectue son activité dans la ville de Koutiala et vend ses articles à une clientèle mixte au comptant et à crédit.   
Elle compte sur un bénéfice mensuel de 100.000 FCFA qu’elle envisage utiliser pour le remboursement du prêt et participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille. 
Avec ce financement sa perspective est bonne car elle doublerait de bénéfice qui la permettrait d’améliorer sa condition de vie et bien mener son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aminata Koné is 38 years old and lives in a monogamous family with her husband and her five children in the neighborhood of Hamdallaye, prefecture of Koutiala (Sikasso region).

Social reasons prevented her from getting an education. She took an interest in trade at an early age, engaging in various income-generating activities alongside her mother. For ten years now, she has worked on her own and is in high demand. She receives orders for bazins through local women's associations to be used for uniforms at social events.

To expand and improve her business, Aminata quickly turned to the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution three years ago. After four group loans, all fully repaid, she is now seeking her second individual loan. The first one was repaid without any problems.

With this loan, she plans to buy 6 pieces of medium-rich bazin, 2 kg of potash and various dyes in Bamako. She runs her business in the city of Koutiala, selling to a mixed clientele for cash or on credit.

She expects a monthly income of 100,000 FCFA, which she will use to repay the loan and help with the family’s daily expenses.

This funding gives her good hope for the future as she would double her profits, thus improving her living conditions and her business.

loans.use: Purchase dyeing supplies

loans.name: Daouda

texts.fr:
Âgé de 41 ans, Monsieur Daouda  C. est mariée à deux épouses père de 5 enfants et vit chez lui-même avec sa famille dans le quartier Darsalam I de la préfecture de Koutiala  (Région de Sikasso).  
A cause des problèmes de famille, il n’a pas pu continuer ses études secondaires, alors il s’est intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus  auprès de son père.
Cette activité lui est très rentable et lui procure assez de revenus car il reçoit beaucoup de commandes de pièces détachées et des vitres pour auto dans le mois. 
Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle et l’élargissement de son activité,  Monsieur Daouda a fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier  prêt.  
Ce prêt servira à acquérir quelques pièces détachées d’occasion à Lomé. Il  effectue sa vente dans la ville  de Koutiala à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’ hommes au comptant  et à crédit.  
Avec l’élargissement de son activité, Daouda compte réaliser un  bénéfice de 150 000 FCFA par mois qu’il utilisera pour le remboursement du prêt, prendre en charge les besoins de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité. 
Il envisage rembourser ce prêt correctement pour qu’il puisse bénéficier d’un autre dans le but d’agrandir son activité.
texts.en:
41 years of age, Mr. Daouda C. has two wives and five children, and lives with his family in the Darsalam I district in the Koutiala Prefecture (Sikasso Region).

Due to family difficulties, he has not been able to continue secondary studies, and very early started earning a living alongside his father.

This activity is profitable and brings him quite a bit of income as each months he receives many orders for spare parts and car glass. In order to better satisfy this customers’ needs and to expand his business, Mr. Daouda has turned to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, and is now on his first loan.

This loan will allow him to purchase some used spare parts in Lomé. He sells his wares in the town of Koutiala to a customer base composed of both women and men, for cash and on credit.

By expanding his business, Daouda plans to achieve a monthly income of 150,000, which will be used to repay his loan, take care of the family needs and reinvest the remainder n his business.

He plans is to repay this loan properly in order to be able to obtain another one subsequently and continue growing his business.

loans.use: Purchasing used spare parts

loans.name: Nanou

texts.fr:
Madame Nanou Koné est âgée de 54 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle vit dans une famille polygame avec son époux, sa coépouse et leurs enfants dans le quartier Kouloukoro  de la ville de Koutiala.  
Madame Nanou Koné n’a pas fréquenté l’école (victime de l’époque où les filles n’avaient pas l’assentiment  des parents d’aller à l’école).  Nanou s’est vite intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus  en l’occurrence le commerce qu’elle appris auprès de sa maman. Elle  s’est spécialisée dans l’achat vente du Sounbala (un condiment alimentaire très prisé en Afrique de l’Ouest) depuis plus de  30 ans. Elle est très sollicitée par sa clientèle et peut vendre plus de 20 cartons dans le mois.  
Pour augmenter son fonds de commerce afin d’élargir son activité et satisfaire sa clientèle, Madame Nanou a décidé d’intégrer Soro Yiriwaso depuis 6 ans. Elle a pris 3 prêts de groupe (prêt solidaire ) tous  remboursés correctement  et elle est à son 6 eme prêt individuel dont les cinq précédents ont été payés sans difficulté. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 10 gros paniers de Sounbala avec des villageoises lors des foires hebdomadaires de la ville de Koutiala. Elle vend à Bamako à une clientèle constituée essentiellement de femmes  et au comptant.
Elle compte sur un bénéfice mensuel de 125.000FCFA qu’elle envisage utiliser pour le  remboursement du prêt   et contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nanou Koné is 54 years old, married and the mother of five children. She lvies in a polygamous family with her husband, her husband’s other wife and their children in the Kouloukoro district of the town of Koutiala.

Mrs. Nanou Koné has not attended school (victim of an age when parents wouldn’t allow their daughters to go to school). Nanou quickly developed an interest in earning a living and learned her trade from her mother. She is purchasing and reselling sounbala (a food condiment very popular in West Africa) for over 30 years. Her business is very popular with customers, and she can sell over 20 boxes per month.

In order to increate her working capital so as to expend her business and meet her clients’ needs, 6 years ago Mrs. Nanou decided to join Soro Yiriwaso. She had taken out three group loans (solidarity loans), all duly repaid; she is now on her 6th individual loan, having repaid the previous five without any issues.

With this new loan, she plans to purchase ten big baskets of sounbala from  village sellers at the big weekly marked at the town of Koutiala. She sells in Bamako, to a coustomer based composed essentially of women, for cash.

She plans to achieve a monthly income of 125,000 West African Francs, which she  intends to use for repaying her loan and contributing to improving the life conditions of her family.

loans.use: Purchasing sounbala, a traditional condiment

loans.name: Voskehat

texts.en: Voskehat B. is married and a proud mother of 4 children. The family lives in Talin, Aragatsotn region of Armenia. The family’s main income comes from the agriculture. Together with her husband, Voskehat grows wheat on 2 ha of land. The family has a cattle farm too. Voskehat is preparing her household for the winter. She has applied for this loan to buy cattle feed.

loans.use: To purchase cattle feed.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty P. is currently in the business of selling mixed goods such as cooking oil, tomatoes, etc. and is requesting a loan to improve stock. Betty is 30 years old and is married to a businessman. She has 4 children and 3 of her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy goats and invest another profits in the existing business.

loans.use: Improve stock.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty K. is currently in the business of selling mixed goods like beans, maize flour, rice, etc. and is requesting a loan to improve stock. Betty is 28 years old and is married to a farmer. She has 3 children and 2 of her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to invest in the business by buying more goods.

loans.use: Improve stock.

loans.name: Saiberia Group

texts.en:
Zainabu K. is in her early thirties and is married with three children. Zainabu has been running her own grocery store for the past two years where she sells food, juice, water and other goods. The shop is open daily between 7 am and 9 pm and earns Zainabu a small monthly profit. 

This will be Zainabu's first loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. With this loan, Zainabu aims to increase her stock of goods, and thus expand her business. Zainabu wishes to expand her business and gain a good credit history in order to be eligible for an individual loan.

Zainabu will share the loan with her loan group Saiberia, which totals 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans. 

In the picture, Zainabu is wearing green, and is 1st on the left front row.

loans.use: Increase stock of goods.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce A. is currently in the business of selling sugar and cooking oil at a shop and is requesting a loan to improve stock. Joyce is 23 years old and is married to a businessman. She has 1 child and her child does not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to invest in her business by improving stock more.

loans.use: Improve stock.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty A. is currently in the business of selling women's, men's and children's clothes and is requesting a loan to stock more clothes to sell.  Betty is 24 years old and is married to a businessman. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy goats and also continue with her business.

loans.use: To stock more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina N. was born in1969, she is married to Thomas Ngang and they are blessed with five children, amongst which two are below the age of fifteen. They live in a house made of five rooms and two persons occupy a room. She lives in Ntangang a quarter in Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon.

Christina N. has faced some challenges in life. The most terrifying thing that happened in her life has been the issue of accidents and death of her family members. Poverty has been her major difficulty in life, and the inability to raise capital for business projects. She plans to invest this loan in a house rental business. With this loan she plans to improve the living standard of her family with the proceeds from the investment. She believes the business will succeed because she has been in the business for a long time. She thinks the pressing needs of housing by inhabitants of the locality and students coming to studying in the locality will be an outstanding factor for the success of the business. The structure will be styled beautifully and hence will attract potential tenants, and subsequently lead to the success of her business. The loan will help her community because they will be able to accommodate families and visitors to the neighborhood.

Christina N. will plough back her profit into her business and use part to care for her family. She also will use the proceeds to expand her business and save for rainy days. She prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives and the low cost in obtaining and paying back a loan.

About GHAPE 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To build a house for rental.

loans.name: Kisiwani Group

texts.en:
Hadija H. is in her late thirties and is married with three children. Hadija has been running her own beauty salon for the past 6 years. The shop is open daily between 8 am and 9 pm and earns Hadija a good monthly profit. 

This will be Hadija's 8th loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loans to increase her stock of beauty products for the salon. She also used the previous loans to start another business selling womens suits. With this loan, Hadija hopes to buy more suits, as well as find a store from which she can sell them. Hadija's dream is to one day be able to go to China and buy good quality suits. 

Hadija will share this loan with her loan group Kisiwani, which totals 18 members. The members of the group will hold each other responsible for repaying the loans. 

In the picture, Hadija can be seen in the back row, wearing black, third from left.

loans.use: Increase stock of beauty products and buy women's suits.

loans.name: Lusik

texts.en: Lusik Saqaryan is married and lives with her husband, 5 children and father-in-law in the village of Tsghuk in the Syunik region, Armenia. Lusik has invented a unique method for smoked cheese preparation. The cheese is very popular both inside and outside the region. The family cultivates land and keeps a small cattle farm. Lusik wants to buy cows to use their milk produce for cheese production.

loans.use: To buy cows.

loans.name: Burema Women's, Kihihi Group

texts.en:
Hard working and cooperative Edith K. has been running a general merchandise retail shop from Burema trading centre in Kihihi, where she sells general merchandise and basic items for home use. She has been operating this business for over 6 years. She started this business with capital she got from farming business and so far it earns her 300,000 Ugandan Shillings. The mother of 8 children confirms that she has had problems in restocking her business as the stock available is not satisfying for the customers' demands.

Therefore she is seeking a loan to help her buy more goods for the business for resale in hopes of earning more income to cater for her family's needs, thus improve her standard of living. She belongs to Burema Women’s group with other members who hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for business.

loans.name: Adolf

texts.en:
Adolf M. was born in 1978. He is married to Odette Nyonga and they are blessed with three children and all are below the age of 15 years old. He and the family live in a small house of three rooms. He lives in Nitop III, a quarter in Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon.

Adolf has faced some challenges in life. Amongst which are the inability to meet the basic necessities of his family, like clothing, feeding, transportation and educating himself and his children. It is difficult to raise capital to start up a small business that will sustain him and his family. He plans to invest this loan in a transport business, by buying a motorbike for transporting people and goods from one place to another. He believes the business will succeed because the previous loan he took was repaid by the income raised from an old bike of his, therefore he concludes that he is sure the business will succeed. He is certain that this business will succeed because the roads around the area of residence are poor, therefore the bike is a paramount way of transportation. The loan will help his community because they will be able to afford a considerable means of transport at cheaper fares. 

Adolf will plough back his profit into his business and use part to care for his family. He also will use the proceeds to pay his children’s school fees and cater for the family. He prefers GHAPE because of the training he frequently receives and the low cost in obtaining and paying back a loan.

About GHAPE 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Reli Group

texts.en:
Michael A. is in his early thirties and is married with three children. Michael owns a photography business which he has been running for 5 years now. The shop is open daily and earns Michael a good monthly profit.

This will be Michael's 2nd loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. Michael used his previous loan to contribute to buying a new camera. Michael has since successfully repaid this loan. Michael aims to use his 2nd loan to buy a new flash for his camera in order to improve the quality of his pictures. Michael's dream is to one day open an office from where he can organise and run his business.

Michael will share this loan with his loan group Reli, which totals 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans. 

In the picture, Michael can be seen in the middle in the back row.

loans.use: To buy a new flash for his camera.

loans.name: Kikoni Bakyara Tweyambe Group

texts.en:
The determined Hadija N., aged 38 years, is a go getter business woman who has been dealing in the sale of sweet yellow bananas from Ntungamo as one of her agricultural products. This stickler for hard work and also a married mother of 6 children, has basked in the career graces of her grocery business for over 10 years. With this experience behind her, she has managed to subdue most of the uncertain adversities that have threatened to play havoc with her business.

In a month her business generates her a profit of 120,000 Ugandan shillings. This to all intents and purposes a low figure compared to the responsibilities cut out of her. What has played into her hands as she operates her business has been her exceptional customer relationship skills. As it is now she is taking a long view with an aim of maximizing her small profits. She figures this loan will come in significantly handy in helping her buy more stock as she looks at expansion.

Hadija belongs to Kikoni Bakyara Tweyambe group in Ntungamo.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of yellow bananas.

loans.name: Neba Eveline

texts.en:
Neba Eveline N.	was born in1972, she is married, and they are blessed with three children and live in Ntamulung, a quarter in Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon.

Eveline has faced some challenges in life. She has been struggling with ill health and the problem of poor yield due to natural disaster. Sometimes the chicks she keeps die. The most difficult has been the problem of raising capital for her business, paying for her children’s education, and building a house of her own. She plans to invest this loan in agricultural products, poultry farming, and the production of cash crops and other farm produce such as cassava, corn, and cocoa yams. She also has a general provision store which will raise the daily income for her family. She believes the business will succeed because she was born a farmer and now she is an expert in farming. She also thinks her approach to her customers will be welcoming and hence lead to the success of her business The loan will help her community because they will be able to afford at least three meals per day at affordable prices.

Eveline will plough back her profit into her business and use part to care for her family. She also will use the proceeds to pay her house rents and save for rainy days. She prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives and the low cost in obtaining and paying back a loan.

About GHAPE:
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase cassava, plantain, groundnut oil, and seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Rutwe Women's Group, Kihihi

texts.en:
Hard working with a cordial character, Sarah K. is married with 6 children of her own to take care of, and knows that she has her responsibility tasks cut out for her. This reality has looked her in the face for the past 10 years as she goes about her trivial retail shop business selling general merchandise, especially for home use, from Rutwe, Kihihi.

With her monthly earnings amounting to 400,000 Ugandan shillings, she has faced long odds in providing for all her family’s needs and principally catering for her children’s welfare as the husband seems not to be so productive. Sarah wants to improve on the status quo of her family with the acquisition of this loan as she wants to give this business an improved lease of life in terms of restocking and expansion. Through restocking her shop with a vision of making it a wholesale business will make her earn more sales revenue and be able to pay the education bills for her children.

Sarah belongs to Rutwe women's group, Kihihi.

loans.use: Business restocking.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina L. was born in1940, she is married to James, and they are blessed with three children and live in Ntamulung, a quarter in Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon.

Regina has faced some challenges in life.  She has been struggling with ill health and the problem of poor yield due to natural disaster. The most difficult has been the problem of raising capital for her business, paying for her children’s education, and building a house of her own. She plans to invest this loan in agricultural products, for the production of cash crops and other farm produce such as cassava, corn, and cocoa yams. Most  especially cassava, which is used in the production of garri and water-fufu. She also plans to invest part in her general provision store, which will raise daily income for her family. She believes the business will succeed because she was born a farmer and now she is an expert in farming over the past years. She also thinks her approach to her customers will be captivating and hence lead to the success of her business The loan will help her community because they will be able to afford at least three meals per day at affordable prices.

Regina will plough back her profit into her business and use part to care for her family. She also will use the proceeds to pay her house rent and save for rainy days. She prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives and the low cost in obtaining and paying back a loan.

About GHAPE 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase cassava seedlings.

loans.name: Mitooma Tumanyane Group, Bushenyi

texts.en:
A self-motivated Enid M. of Mitooma Tumanyane group, Bushenyi, aged 40, is a married mother of 6 aged between 20 and 8 years. She has been operating a retail shop business selling general products for home use from Mitooma town council, Bushenyi. She started this business 21 years ago after realizing the ready market in the area and at the end of every month she is able to pocket profits to the tune of 800,000 Ugandan shillings.
 
Her main drawback has been having small stock in the business that cannot match the purchasing rate of the customers. She is therefore seeking a loan that she figures will help her stock more goods that will satisfy the customers’ high demand and also transform her enterprise into a big enterprise. 
Being very committed to the business with good customer care, she hopes to increase her sales revenue. This will bring about a transformation in her business as she hopes to build a family house and enable her to achieve a self-sustaining life, and cater for her children’s education expenses.

loans.use: To purchase more stock.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine S. was born in1940, she is married to James, and they are blessed with three children and live in Ntamulung, a quarter in Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon.

Geraldine S. has faced some challenges in life. She has been strungling with ill health and the problem of poor yield due to natural disaster. The most difficult has been the problem of raising capital for her business, paying for her children’s education, and building a house of her own. She plans to invest this loan in agricultural products, for the production of cash crops and other farm produce such as cassava, corn, and cocoayams. Most especially cassava, which is used in the production of garri and water-fufu. She also plans to invest part in her general provision store, which will raise the daily income for her family. She believes the business will succeed because she was born a farmer and now she is an expert in farming. She also thinks her approach to her customers will be captivating and hence lead to the success of her business The loan will help her community because they will be able to afford at least three meals per day at affordable prices.

Geraldine S. will plough back her profit into her business and use part to care for her family. She also will use the proceeds to pay her house rent and save for rainy days. She prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives and the low cost in obtaining and paying back a loan.

GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy beans and cassava seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Cristina's Group

texts.en:
Cristina A. is from the village of Lullutan. She is 48 years old. Cristina is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Cristina A..

Cristina is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Cristina owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Cristina has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Cristina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cristina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Cristina is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Cristina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Odette

texts.en:
Odette E. N. was born in1984, and is married to Muyamabat Adolf and they are blessed with three children and living in Nitop III, a quarter in Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon.

Odette has faced some challenges in life. The most difficult have been the problem of paying for her house rent and building a house of her own.  She plans to invest this loan in an off-license business where she will buy foodstuff which include cocoa yams, palm oil and other ingredients, in order to prepare Ekwang (it is an African dish prepared with cocoa yams). She believes the business will succeed because she has been in the business for a long time. She also thinks her approach to her customers will be captivating and hence lead to the success of her business The loan will help her community because they will be able to afford at least three meals per day at affordable prices.

Odette will plough back her profit into her business and use part to care for her family. She also will use the proceeds to pay her house rent and save for rainy days. She prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives and the low cost in obtaining and paying back a loan.

About GHAPE 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs, flour, sugar, groundnut oil, beans and wood.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine A. was born in1975, she is single and she has two children. She lives at Ntamulung Junction a quarter in Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon.

Justine, as any other entrepreneur, has faced significant challenges in life. She has suffered terribly in the hands of ill health; poverty has been her major difficulty in life, and the inability to raise capital for business projects. She plans to invest this loan in her marketing business in which she plans to buy and sell clothes and assorted dresses for resale. She believes the business will succeed because she has been in the business for a long time. She also thinks her approach to her customers will be welcoming and hence lead to the success of her business. She has also put in place factors that will ensure the success of her business like getting her business advertised at cheaper rates. With this loan she will be able to support her community firmly in improving their standard of living and social interaction, not forgetting decent appearance. The inhabitants of her locality will also benefit from low transportation costs which would have been incurred in distant places.

Justine will plough back her profit into her business and use part to care for her family. She also will use the proceeds to expand her business and save for rainy days. She prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives and the low cost in obtaining and paying back a loan.

About GHAPE:
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase secondhand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Silvia Josefina

texts.es:
Silvia de 30 años, ella vende productos Yambal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes), vive en una zona periurbana con caminos de tierra llamada Fortin de Guayaquil. 

Realiza su trabajo sola para poder mantener a sus dos hijos de tres años y otro 11 meses, trabaja desde muy temprano ofreciendo los productos a sus vecinos y amigos, vende perfumes desde $ 20.00 hasta $ 75.00 c/u. Para tener mas ingresos también vende bebidas y snack a los hijos de sus vecinos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos Yambal como perfumes, cremas y bebidas. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y tener un local para una pequeña tienda.
texts.en:
Silvia is 30 years old. She sells Yambal products. Yambal is a business that offers female entrepreneurs the opportunity to sell independently. She lives in a suburban area with dirt roads called Fortin de Guayaquil.

She carries out her work only in order to support her two children, ages 3 years and 11 months. She works from very early in the day offering products to her neighbors and friends. She sells perfumes from $20.00 to $75.00 per unit. In order to have more income, she also sells drinks and snacks to her neighbors’ children.

With the loan she wants to buy Yambal products such as perfumes, creams and drinks. In the future she wants to finish building her house and to have a place for a small shop.

loans.use: Perfumes, creams, drinks

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina S. is from the village of Sta. Ana Echague. She is 44 years old. Marcelina is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Marcelina owns and operates a clothing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general clothing services to local community members. Marcelina has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 2,300 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Marcelina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marcelina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fabrics & materials. Marcelina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fabrics & materials. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Marcelina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics & materials.

loans.name: Sandra Yanira

texts.es:
Doña Sandra Yanira M. tiene 45 años de edad es casada actualmente se dedica al comercio tiene 2 hijas mayores de edad.
Sandra inicio su negocio de modista cuando tenia 18 años luego tubo una pequeña tianda en la comunidad de Villanueva por varios años pero decidio trasladarla a su casa donde la administro con ayuda de su familia, su tienda duro 20 años pero serro por motivo de la delincuencia.
actualmente se dedica a vender productos mexicanos, ahora Sandra solicita un nuevo credito a Fape y a Kiva para poder invertir en compra de granos basicos y bebidas ya que tiene una propuesta de comprar por mayor y con descuento.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sandra Yanira Méndez, 45, is married and has two adult daughters.  She is a merchant.

Sandra started her business when she was 18 years old and later had a small store in Villanueva for several years but decided to move it into her home where she ran it with help from her family.  Her store stayed open for 20 years but had to close due to crime in the area.

She currently sells Mexican products and is requesting funding from Fape and Kiva to invest in basic grains and beverages because she has an opportunity to buy at wholesale and with a discount.

loans.use: To buy basic grains and beverages.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita Q. is from the village of Cabisera 27. She is 51 years old. Lolita is widowed and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Lolita owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Lolita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Lolita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Karen

texts.es:
Karen vive en casa de su hermana en la zona las lomas de la ciudad de La Paz, es madre soltera, tiene una niña de 5 años de edad; la actividad que realiza es la venta de pollos a la broaster en una tienda que funciona en su mismo domicilio. El crédito que solicita es para implementar su negocio, ya que fue heredado por su mama y necesita renovar los muebles, cocina y otros.

El negocio es su única fuente de ingresos, por lo tanto se sugiere otorgar el crédito, esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito.
texts.en:
Karen lives in her sister’s house in La Paz’s Las Lomas neighborhood.  She is a single mother of a five year old daughter.  She sells Broasted-style chicken in a store she runs at her home address.

The loan is to equip her business since she inherited it from her mother and she needs to refurbish furniture, stove and other items.

The business is her only source of income so granting the loan is advisable; this is the first time she has requested a loan.

loans.use: For costs to refurbish furniture, stove and other items in her broasted-style chicken sales business.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr:
Madade Mariama D. est une femme de 53 ans. Elle est veuve et mère trois enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de quatre autres enfants qui lui sont confiés par des proches. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de ADIAF depuis le 28 juin 2008. Elle a 4 fois de suite reçu de crédit et a toujours remboursé sans difficulté.

Elle fait un petit commerce de bananes. Elle achète sa marchandise à bord champ pour revendre dans les marchés environnants. 

Avec son nouveau crédit elle va renforcer son niveau d'approvisionnement afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire. 

Son objectif est d'assurer la scolarité de ses enfants, leur nourriture et leur couverture sanitaire
texts.en:
Mrs. Mariama D. is 53 years old. She is  a widow and the mother of three. She also has four other children in her care, entrusted to her by relatives. She has been a member of Banc Villageois of ADIAF since June 28, 2008. After joining, she obtained  loans four times and always repaid them without issues.

She sells bananas. She purchases her produce at  groves in order to resell it at nearby markets.

With this new loan she is going to increase her stock level in order to better meet her customers’ needs and increase her profit margin.Her goal is to be able to provide for her children's schooling, food and healthcare.

loans.use: Purchasing banans

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita A. is from the village of Cabisera 27. She is 52 years old and married with eight school-aged children. To make a living, Carmelita raises pigs to fatten and sell. She has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Carmelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from ASKI used to invest in expanding the business and is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Carmelita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell

This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Lolita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand the her business.

texts.en:

In 2006, Marilyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase additional products to sell and is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the 9th loan taken out by Marilyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Mariama Cire

texts.fr:
Mariama Ciré D. est une femme de 25 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de ADIAF depuis le 28 juin 2008. Elle a été 4 fois de suite bénéficiaire de crédit et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement.

Elle est détentrice d'une boutique où elle vend divers produits (denrées alimentaires et produits cosmétiques) 

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de renforcer son niveau d'approvisionnement en marchandises afin d'accroitre ses recettes financières. 

Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge de la famille et de subvenir à ses besoins personnels
texts.en:
Mariama Ciré D. is a 25-year old woman. She is married and the mother of three. She joined Banc Villageois of ADIAF on June 28, 2008. She obtained loans four times in the past and never had any problems with repayment.
She keeps a store in which she sells a variety of goods (food products and cosmetics). Her new loan will allow her to boost her stock level in order to increase her income. Her goal it to contribute to the family budget and to provide for her own personal needs.

loans.use: Growing and promoting her business

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda A. is from the village of Bolinao. She is 35 years old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Erlinda owns a business making and selling food and drinks to passengers in the bus terminal.She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Erlinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Erlinda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia T., from the village of San Antonio, Cauayan City, Isabela, is 51 years old, married, and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Lilia has been raising pigs for breeding for over 15 years, earning approximately 6000 PHP every four months.

In 2009, Lilia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 9000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase breeding livestock, Lilia is now requesting her third loan of 11000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Aida

texts.es: Aida, de 45 años, es una mujer que a lo largo de su vida siempre ha luchado por forjarse un buen futuro, vive en su casa propia junto a su madre Romina de 69 años y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Desde muy pequeña Aida aprendió a trabajar en la chacra junto a sus padres, quienes le enseñaron todo lo que se tiene que hacer, para lograr un buen cultivo. Ahora tiene sus propias tierras, las cuales cultiva y cuida con mucho amor y paciencia. Ella siembra arveja, papa y habas, las cuales lleva a vender al mercado mayorista de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus cultivos, ya que siente que su arduo trabajo esta dando sus frutos, lleva 25 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas de insectos que afectan sus plantaciones. Su deseo es comprar nuevas tierras, para que pueda incrementar su producción. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y esta dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y siempre está poniendo la cuata de humor en el grupo. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará abono para sus tierras, ya que desea que sus nuevas siembras le den buenos frutos.
texts.en:
Aida, 45, is a woman who has fought to create a better future for herself throughout her life.  She lives in her own home with her mother, Romina, 69, and what she wants most is to improve her quality of life.

Since she was little, Aida learned to work the fields with her parents who taught her everything she needed to know to have good crops.  Now she owns her own fields that she cultivates with much love and patience.

She farms peas, potatoes and lima beans that she then sells in Tarma’s wholesale market.  What she likes best about her work is harvesting since that’s when her hard work pays off.  She has been in farming for 25 years and considers the most difficult part of it ensuring that her plants are safe from insect infestations that might affect yields.  She wants to buy new lands so that she can increase production.

This is her first loan with MFP and she knows that she must repay on time and is willing to do so.  She is a very cheerful member of her communal bank who always provides her group with a dose of good humor.

She will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy manure for her fields because she hopes her new plantings will yield good fruits.

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora U., from the village of Bolinao, is 47 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Aurora has been planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale for over five years, earning approximately 2000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Aurora joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 3000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase fertilizers, she is now requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP to purchase more fertilizers such as manure. This will be Aurora's fifth loan from ASKI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Johnelyn

texts.en:
Johnelyn D., from the village of Bolinao, is 31 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Johnelyn owns and operates a general store selling a variety of products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over eight years, she earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Johnelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 9000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase new items to expand product offering, she is requesting her fifth loan of 10000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. Johnelyn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the store.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es: Felicia a sus 56 años es madre D. 10 hijos, pero solo vive con uno D. ellos, puesto que los demás, ya tienen sus familias, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad D. vida. Trabajando arduamente Felicia ha logrado sacar adelante sus sembríos, todas las mañana se levanta muy temprano para regar y brindarle el cuidado respectivo a sus papas, arvejas y maíz, los cuales posteriormente venderá en la ciudad D. Tarma, ya que es ahí donD. obtiene los mejores precios por sus productos. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo, es que pueD. disfrutar D. la libertad D. laborar en sus campos, lleva 26 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que arar la tierra, puesto que su esposo falleció hace 11 años y ella tiene que realizar el sembrado y cosechado sola. Con el tiempo, espera poder adecuar sus tierras para el sembrado D. arveja, ya que por estas fechas es lo que mejor se venD.. Este es el noveno crédito con MFP, sabe que este préstamo le ayudará bastante en el progreso y desarrollo D. su negocio, es por eso que esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, en su grupo comunal es una socia muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy querida. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más semillas D. papa y arvejas, para la nueva la próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Felicia, 56, is the mother of 10 children but only lives with one of them since the rest have their own families.  She lives in her own house and what she most desires is to improve her quality of life.

By working hard Felicia has raised her crops.  She gets up very early every morning to water and care for her potatoes, peas and corn which she subsequently sells in Tarma because that’s where she gets the best prices for her products.

What she likes best about her work is the freedom she enjoys working in the fields.  She has been a farmer for 26 years and considers plowing the fields to be the most difficult part because since her husband died 11 years ago she has to do the planting and harvesting by herself. In time she hopes to make her fields adequate for pea cultivation because that’s what sells best nowadays.  

This is her 9th loan with MFP and she is aware that the loan will be of much help for the progress and development of her business so she is more than willing to repay on time.  She is a responsible member of her communal group which makes her very well liked.

She will use the requested 2000 new soles to buy more potato and pea seed for the next planting cycle.

loans.use: To buy pea and potato seed.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna P., from the village of Bolinao, is 48 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, for over 20 years Myrna has been planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale, earning approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Myrna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure, she is now requesting her fifth loan of 10000 PHP to pay for services to increase crop yield. Myrna plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines, with 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es: Georgina, de 54 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre y amorosa, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Crisanto de 49 años y sus 4 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Trabajando arduamente, Georgina ha logrado que sus chacras le brinden los productos necesarios, para mantener a su familia. Antes que el sol deje ver sus primeros rayos, sale de su casa y camina cerca de una hora para llegar a sus tierras, donde tiene sembrado papa, maíz y habas, productos que posteriormente lleva a vender hasta el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, ya que siente que les da un buen uso, lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta Tarma, ya que los costales que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Con el tiempo desea poner una tienda de abarrotes, las cual les pueda ayudar a mejorar su economía. Este es el noveno crédito con MFP, está muy feliz de poder acceder a este crédito y quiere agradecer a todas las personas que harán posible que obtenga el dinero que necesita. En su banco comunal es una socia muy respetada por el orden que pone en las reuniones. Con los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará nuevas semillas para sembrar y abono.
texts.en:
Georgina, 54, is a cheerful, loving mother.  She lives in her own house with her husband, Crisanto, 49, and their four beloved children for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life.

Working hard Georgina has managed to have her fields produce the necessary products to support her family.  Before the first rays of the sun appear she leaves her house and walks for about an hour to reach her fields where she has potato, corn and lima beans planted, products that she subsequently sells in Tarma’s wholesale market.

What she likes best about her work is tilling the soil because she feels she is putting it to good use.  She has been a farmer for 30 years and considers the most difficult part to be transporting her goods to Tarma because the sacks she carries are very heavy and they tire her out. In time she’d like to set up a grocery store to better help her economy.

This is her 9th loan with MFP and she is happy to have access to this loan and wants to say thank you to all those who make it possible for her to have the money she needs.  In the communal bank she is a very respected member because of the order she imposes during meetings.

She will use the requested 3000 new soles to buy new seed to plant and manure.

loans.use: To buy potato and lima bean seed as well as sacks of manure.

loans.name: Orquideas San Jose Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Orquídeas de San José, tiene este nombre porque a la presidenta del grupo le gustan mucho las orquídeas y ella les comentó a las integrantes del grupo.  El grupo estuvo de acuerdo y por ese motivo se llama así. Se ubica en Tula de Allende Hidalgo, México, el grupo está conformado por 12 integrantes.
La Sra. Verónica M. Mejía es la presidenta del grupo tiene 28 años de edad estudió hasta la secundaria, ella se dedica a la elaboración de manualidades y venta de estas, inició su negocio hace aproximadamente 3 años, solicita el préstamo para invertir en el negocio y que de esta manera crezca para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hija y su familia en general. 
La Sra. Rosa Matilde Rodríguez T. es otra integrante de este grupo tiene 39 años de edad estudió hasta la secundaria, su estado civil es unión libre tiene 2 hijos uno de 15 años y otro de 10 años de edad, el mayor es hombre y la menor es mujer. La Sra. Rosa Matilde se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, negocio que inicio hace aproximadamente 5 años, solicita el préstamo para invertir en el negocio ya que espera hacerlo crecer y de esta manera poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos que son la razón por la que ella se esmera tanto en salir adelante echándole todas las ganas del mundo.
texts.en:
This group is called “Orquídeas de San José” (St. Joseph’s Orchids) so called because the group President likes orchids very much and she mentioned this to the group members.  They agreed and that’s why it’s called that.  It is located in Tula de Allende, Hidalgo, México.  It has 12 members.

Mrs. Verónica M. Mejía, 28, is group President.  She finished middle school and she makes and sells crafts.  She started her business about three years ago and is asking for funds to invest in her business so that it will grow and to provide a better quality of life for her daughter and her family in general.

Mrs. Rosa Matilde Rodríguez T. is another member of the group.  She is 39 years old and finished middle school.  She is in a common law relationship and has two children who are 15 and 10 years of age.  The oldest is a boy and the youngest is a girl. 

Rosa Matilde sells fruits and vegetables, a business she started about 5 years ago.  She is asking for funds to invest in the business hoping it will grow so that she will be able to provide her children with a better quality of life.  They are the reason she tries so hard to get ahead making the best possible effort in the world.

loans.use: To invest in the business.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys, de 31 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Yony de 36 años y su hijo Edison de 11 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Los arduos días de trabajo que Gladys tiene en su chacra, le han servido para mejorar sus cultivos y hacer más productivas sus tierras, trabaja desde muy temprano por la mañana, cultivando papas y habas, productos que posteriormente llevará a vender al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Paralelamente a esta actividad, ella también tiene una tienda de abarrotes, con la cual surte de víveres a todo su poblado. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y ver como sus cultivos van creciendo, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus tierras de la plaga de insectos. Con el tiempo, espera comprar más tierras y así ampliar la cantidad de su producción. Este el cuarto crédito con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus socias. Con los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará abono para sus chacras, también comprará más productos, para implementar mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
Gladys, 31, is a very loving, cheerful mother.  She lives in her own house with her husband, Yony, 36, and her son Edison, 11, who are the reasons behind all her efforts.

The hard days of labor Gladys puts into her fields have led to improved crops and more productive fields.  She works from very early in the morning cultivating potatoes and lima beans, products she subsequently takes to Tarma’s wholesale market to sell.  She also has a grocery store that supplies the entire settlement with foodstuffs.

What she enjoys most about her work is planting her fields and seeing how the plants develop.  She has been in this activity for 10 years and considers the most difficult part seeing that her plants are safe from insect infestations.  In time she’d like to buy more land to expand production.

This is her 4th loan with MFP.  She knows that if she pays on time she will be able to request another more easily and without causing complications for her communal bank where she is very well liked by all the members.

She will use the requested 3000 new soles to buy manure for the fields as well as for more stock items for her store.

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: Hilda, de 28 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Teófilo de 32 años y sus 2 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles un mejor futuro. Con mucho esfuerzo Hilda ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, ella cultiva, papa y maíz, las cuales lleva a vender hasta el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, donde las vende al por mayor. Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia, es por eso que desea poner todas sus ganas en sacar adelante este negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, lleva 9 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta Tarma, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. En adelante, desea alquilar un puesto en el mercado mayorista, para así poder mejorar sus ingresos. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores oportunidades y espera serlo también ahora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y siempre esta al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo. Con los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono, con lo cual espera mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Hilda, 28, is a very hard working mother.  She lives in a rented house with her husband, Teófilo, 32, and their two beloved children for whom she wants to provide a better future.

With much effort Hilda has been managing to make her fields more productive.  She grows potato and corn which she then sells in Tarma’s wholesale market where she sells them at wholesale.

Her crops have provided income necessary to support her family.  This is why she wants to continue to put everything into having her business succeed.

What she likes best about her work is caring for the crops.  She has been a farmer for 9 years and considers the most difficult part having to transport the products all the way to Tarma because the sacks she carries are very heavy and they tire her out.  In the future she’d like to lease a stand in the wholesale market in order to improve her income.

This is her 8th loan with MFP.  She has been very punctual with her previous loans and is always aware of her group’s decisions.

She will use the requested 3000 new soles to buy more manure that she expects will improve her crops.

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Valientes Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Valientes, está ubicado en Morelos en México. El grupo está conformado por 9 integrantes y es la primera  vez que solicitan un crédito a CrediComún.

Ignacia S. M., es integrante del grupo. Tiene 49 años de edad, y cuenta con su molino de nixtamal, ella se ha beneficiado, con esta actividad, ya que la mayor parte de las personas de esta localidad elaboran diariamente en casa las tortillas que consumen, es por eso que el servicio de la señora Ignacia es básico, lo que le ha permitido tener un ingreso seguro todos los días, con lo que ha logrado mejorar su local, porque en sus inicios sólo era de lámina de cartón, al igual que su casa, y actualmente su local ya es de loza. 
Utiliza su crédito para darle mantenimiento a su molino, y para comprar refacciones como el balero y la flecha, que ya están deteriorados, estas partes se cambian periódicamente  por el uso, sin contar algunas fallas que a veces le resultan por la antigüedad de la maquina, que tiene ya 60 años de estar en función. Tiene 6 hijos (3 varones, Gustavo de 23 años, Daniel de 19 años y José Manuel de  17 años y 3 Antonia de 28 años, Juana de 26 y Guadalupe de 21 años). Ella se dedica a  esto desde hace 26 años, actualmente su hijo Daniel está estudiando una licenciatura en el estado de México, y ella trabaja para apoyarlo, ya que siempre fue un sueño para ella que uno de sus  hijos fuera profesionista.
texts.en:
This group is called “Valientes” (Brave Ones) and is located in the Mexican state of Morelos.  It has 9 members and this is the first time they have requested a loan from CrediComún.

Ignacia S. M., 49, is a group member.  She has a nixtamal (tortilla dough) mill.  This activity has been beneficial to her because most of the people in her locality make tortillas at home every day to eat.  Therefore, the service Ignacia provides is basic which has provided her with guaranteed daily income.  This has allowed her to improve her locale because at the beginning it was made from cardboard sheets, as was her house, and now it is stone.

She uses the loan to provide maintenance and repair for the mill and to buy parts, like gears and bearings, to replace deteriorated ones.  These parts need to be changed periodically due to use and this isn’t counting some breakdowns caused by the machine’s age since it has been in operation for 60 years.

She has 6 children (3 boys: Gustavo, 23, Daniel, 19 and José Manuel, 17, and Antonia, 28, Juana, 26 and Guadalupe, 21).

She has been in this line of work for 26 years.  Her son Daniel is currently in college in the state of México and she has to work to support his efforts because she’s always dreamed with her children becoming professionals.

loans.use: To invest in her business and service her mill.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel, de 62 años, es una mujer que a lo largo de su vida siempre ha querido brindarle lo mejor a sus hijos, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Clímaco de 69 años y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila. El trabajo que realiza Isabel es el cultivo de maíz, choclo y papa, esta labor lo realiza junto a su esposo, quien también trabaja arduamente para obtener ingresos para su familia, Ella ha visto por conveniente llevar sus productos hasta el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, ya que según manifiesta, es ahí donde mejores ganancias obtiene. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos de las plaga de insectos que pueden amenazar su productividad, lleva 21 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que el camino es muy largo y agotador. Con el tiempo, espera comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos y con su venta pueda mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, se siente en la obligación de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy querida. Con los seiscientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para sus cultivos y contratará operarios, para que trabaje sus tierras.
texts.en:
Isabel. 62, is a woman who throughout her life has always wanted to provide her children with the best.  She lives in her own house with her husband, Clímaco, 69, and what she wants most is to have a peaceful old age.

She is a corn, potato and choclo (an Andean tuber) farmer.  She works with her husband who also works hard to produce family income.  She has deemed it advantageous to take her products all the way to Tarma’s wholesale market because that’s where she gets the best prices for them.

What she likes best about her work is protecting her crops from insect infestations that could affect production.  She has been farming for 21 years and considers the most difficult part having to transport her products because it’s a long, exhausting trek. In time she’d like to buy more land to increase her production and have more income through sales.

This is her 2nd loan with MFP.  She feels obliged to repay on time because she does not want to cause problems for the other group members where she is very well liked.

She will use the requested 600 new soles to buy manure for her crops and to hire laborers to till the soil.

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure and to hire laborers to help her with the next planting.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 52 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus dos menores hijas a quienes desea darles una mejor vida. Los hermosos campos del poblado de Villa Visca (pueblo de la provincia de Tarma), han sido en la vida de María, el lugar que la ha visto crecer y formar su familia, desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar en la chacra y ahora ella tiene sus propias tierras en las que trabaja con mucho esmero y sacrificio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar arvejas, papa y choclo, lleva 27 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos, hasta el lugar donde los vende en el mercado de Tarma. Con el tiempo, espera poner un pequeño puesto en el mercado, ya que siente que pierde mucho al vender sus productos al por mayor. Este es el sexto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene la responsabilidad de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo. Dentro su banco comunal siempre esta al tanto de todos los acuerdos a los que llegan. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará semillas de arveja, ya que esta planta leguminosa se esta vendiendo muy bien en el mercado.
texts.en:
Maria, 52 years old, is a very simple and hard-working woman who lives in her own house with her 2 minor daughters for whom she wishes to provide a better life.

The beautiful fields of Villa Visca (a town in the province of Tarma), have always been a part of Maria's life.  She has seen it grow since she was very small and her parents taught her to work on the farm, and now she has her own lands on which she has worked with much pride and sacrifice since forming her own family.

What Maria likes most about her work is cultivating peas, potatoes and maize.  For 27 years she has been doing this.  She considers the most difficult task to be transporting her harvest to market in Tarma.  In time, Maria hopes to establish a small post in the market, since she believes she is losing much by selling her products at wholesale.

This is Maria's 6th loan with MFP, and she is certain that she can take on responsibility for making all her payments punctually and she is disposed to do so.  Within her communal bank, Maria is always in compliance with all the decisions they make.

With the 2,000 new sols she solicits, Maria will purchase pea seeds, since this legume is selling very well in the market.

loans.use: BUYING PEA SEEDS TO PLANT IN HER FIELDS

loans.name: Nazario

texts.es: Nazario, de 32 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y alegre, vive en su casa propia y esta dispuesto a trabajar muy duro con tal de sobre salir en la vida. Teniendo todavía una vida por delante, Nazario sabe que tiene que poner todas sus fuerzas, para lograr ganarse la vida con su labor. Él se dedica a la siembra de papa, choclo y arveja, productos que llegada la época de cosecha, llevará a vender al mercado mayorista de Tarma, donde sus clientes, conocedores de la calidad de sus cultivos, los compran rápidamente. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es cuidar sus siembras de las plaga de insectos, lleva 11 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil, es llevar sus cultivos hasta el mercado donde los vende, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados. En adelante, desea comprar más tierras con las cuales pueda aumentar sus cultivos. Este es el noveno crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente si desea acceder a otro crédito posteriormente. En su banco comunal, es un socio muy participativo. Con los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará semillas de papa y arveja, asimismo comprará abono.
texts.en:
Nazario, age 32, is a very unassuming and cheerful man.  He lives in his own house, and he is prepared to work very hard in order to do well in life.  As he still has his life in front of him, Nazario knows that he has to put forth all of his efforts to manage to earn a living with his work.

He grows potatoes, corn, and peas.  At harvest time he will take his crops to sell at Tarma’s wholesale market.  His customers know the quality of his crops, and they quickly buy from him.  What he likes the most about his work is taking care of his crops so they are not infested with insects.

He has been doing this activity for 11 years.  The most difficult part is taking the crops to the market where he sells them.  The sacks that he takes to the market are very heavy.  In the future he wishes to buy more land where he will be able to increase his crops.

This is his ninth loan with MFP.  He knows that he needs to make his payments punctually if he wishes to have another loan later.  He is very active in his communal bank.  He will use the 3,000 soles that he is requesting to buy potato and pea seeds.  He will also buy fertilizer.

loans.use: Buy seeds for peas and potatoes and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Octavia

texts.es: Octavia, de 52 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus dos menores hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Junto a sus hijos, Octavia trabaja todos los días en sus cultivos. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado que sus tierras sean muy productivas y ahora siembra de todo, ya que sabe que todo producto que obtenga será de muy buena calidad. Ella principalmente siembra papa y habas, ya que estos productos se están vendiendo muy bien en el mercado. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de las plagas que pueden afectarlas, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos, hasta el mercado mayorista de Tarma, ya que es ahí donde vende sus productos. Para el futuro de su negocio, espera juntar el dinero necesario para poner un puesto de venta en el mercado mayorista, ya que actualmente vende de forma ambulatoria.
