Marco desea brindar mantenimiento completo a su vehículo asi como realizar algunas reparaciones que le ayuden a funcionar de un mejor modo, como no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Marco es una persona responsable y que diariamente brinda su mejor esfuerzo para sacar adelante a los suyos. Anteriormente ya ha tenido créditos con Edpyme Alternativa y ha cancelado sus cuotas de manera puntual y responsable.
texts.en:
Marco Antonio, 37, is a father living with his wife and children in San Pedro de Loc, Pacasmayo province, La Libertad region, over two hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region capital.

He provides public transportation services in a car.  He provides collective service along routes that join his district with nearby locations like Pacasmayo, for example.  He spends all day in this activity and depends on it to provide support for his family.  His wife has a small grocery store in their home and their joint income allows them to support their household.

Marco wants to provide complete service maintenance to his vehicle as well as do some repairs that will make it run better but since he lacks sufficient capital to do so he is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan.

Marco is a responsible person who daily puts in his best effort to provide for his loved ones.  He has had past loans with Edpyme Alternativa and he has repaid them all in a timely fashion.

loans.use: For major vehicle service and repair.

location.town: San Pedro de Lloc - Pacasmayo - La Libertad

loans.name: Teresa Isabel

texts.es:
Teresa tiene 59 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo dependiente, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Mochumí, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicado a cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales desde hace cinco años, ella cría animales en la parte posterior de su domicilio y los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentan la zona en donde vive, paralelamente vende carnes rojas en su domicilio, las cuales compra en el mercado del pueblo, a veces aprovecha para ofrecer en venta la carne de los animales que cría. Con los ingresos que le brindan estas actividades ayuda a su esposo, que es agricultor, a solventar los gastos familiares.

Teresa desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas animales y alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio de crianza y venta, para ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer bastante tranquila y entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es ver a su familia progresar y gozar de una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Teresa, 59, is married and has a dependent son.  She lives with her family in Mochumí district which is a farming area in Lambayeque province located forty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She has raised small farm animals for sale for the past five years in her backyard.  She sells them to merchants who come by the area frequently. She also sells red meats in her home that she buys in the town’s market.  She sometimes offers for sale meat from the animals she raises too.  Income from these activities helps her husband, who is a farmer, to cover family expenses.

Teresa wants to enlarge her business buying more animals and nutritionally balanced feed to expand her business.  To do so she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for her first, 1000 new sol, loan.

She is quite a calm woman who is dedicated to her family.   Her greatest wish is to see her family progress and enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: To enlarge her business buying more animals and nutritionally balanced feed for them.

loans.name: Maria Hilda

texts.es:
María Hilda es una madre de 61 años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el caserío Muy Finca del distrito de Mochumí, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicada a mas de cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pavos, patos, pollos, palomas y cuyes. Ella cría estos animales en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales y cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta en el mercado de la ciudad de Lambayeque. Este negocio es una fuente importante de ingresos para su familia, por lo que siempre trata de dar lo mejor de si para sacarlo adelante.

María desea adquirir más animales y alimentos con los cuales alimentarlos. Con esta inversión ella espera aumentar sus ventas, especialmente durante la navidad, que es cuando la demanda aumenta. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer bastante trabajadora y emprendedora. Su anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Hilda is a 61-year-old mother who lives with her family in the village of Muy Finca in the Mochumí district, an agricultural zone that belongs to the province of Lambayeque and located more than forty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She raises small animals to sell such as turkeys, ducks, chickens, pigeons, and guinea pigs.  She raises these animals in the back of her home.  They are naturally grain and grass fed and when they have reached a good level of development, they are offered for sale in the market town of Lambayeque.  This business is an important source of income for her family, so she always tries to do her best to succeed.

María wants to purchase more animals and food to feed them.  With this investment she expects to increase sales, especially at Christmas, when demand increases.  To achieve her objective, she has decided to apply for the first time to Kiva field partner Edpyme Alternativa for 1000 soles.

María is a very hardworking and enterprising woman.  She desires to continue growing as an entrepreneur to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase more animals and feed for them.

loans.name: Petra

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres Unidas se reúne en la ciudadela San Alejo de la bellísima ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita, conocida por las hermosas playas que recorren todas sus costas y que son muy visitadas por los turistas nacionales e internacionales.

La señora Petra lleva en el Banco Comunal 15 años, es socia fundadora, le gusta por los beneficios que ha recibido por parte de la institución y por la comunicación que existe con sus compañeras. Tiene 57 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tuvo tres hijos todos ya mayores de edad, dos de ellos viven con ella. Su esposo trabaja en un garaje.

Ella junto con un hermano tiene un gabinete de belleza en  la ciudad de Montecristi, trabaja desde las 9am hasta las 18h00, realizan una gran cantidad de trabajos y además venden productos de belleza y de dieta,  dice que les va muy bien porque su negocio está bien ubicado.

Este crédito lo va a emplear la mitad para su negocio para comprar tintes,  cremas, esmaltes, etc. Y el resto para poner unos rieles metálicos en el techo de su casa que es de madera y ya están apolillados y se pueden romper.
 
Su meta es tener su casa con una buena losa de hormigón y terminada por completo.
texts.en:
The communal bank Mujeres Unidas (United Women) meets in San Alejo, the beautiful capital of Portoviejo, Manabi province, known for its lovely beaches up and down the coast that are very popular with both international and national tourists alike.

Mrs. Petra has been in the communal bank for 15 years.  She is one of the founders and she likes the benefits that she receives from the institution as well as the understanding that exists among the members.  She is 57, and in a common law marriage.  She has 3 adult children, 2 that live with her and her husband works in a garage.

She and her brother have a beauty salon in the city of Montecristi.  She works from 9 am to 6 pm, taking care of many customers.  She also sells beauty and diet products and she says that the business is doing very well because of its good location.

She will use half of this loan to buy hair dyes, creams, nail polish, etc, and the rest will be used to purchase metal rails for the roof of her house.  The roof is made of wood and is infested with powder post beatles and it can fall.

Her dream is to have a complete house built on a concrete slab.

loans.use: To buy hair dye, creams, nail polish, etc and metal rails for her roof

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es:
María Margarita es una madre de familia de 48 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de movimiento comercial considerable que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio. Este negocio ya cuenta con tres años de antigüedad y debido al buen trato que ofrece y a la calidad de los productos que brinda su negocio cuenta actualmente con un grupo de clientes fieles. Con los ingresos que ella percibe de esta actividad ayuda a su esposo con los gastos de la economía de su familia.

María desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de modo que pueda ampliar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias. Como no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

María es una mujer bastante activa y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es ver a su familia progresar y mejorar su calidad de vida. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una persona tranquila y confiable.
texts.en:
Maria Margarita is a 48 year-old mother who lives with her husband and their children in the Olmos district, an agricultural area where there is considerable commercial activity that is located in the Lambayeque province, more than an hour and 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.  

She sells groceries and other basic consumer goods in a small store that is set up in her home.  This business is already 3 years old, and owing to the good service offered and the quality of the products provided the business has a group of loyal customers. With the income she earns from this activity, she helps her husband with the household expenses.

Maria wants to expand her business by purchasing more products so that she can increase her sales and her earnings.  But as she lacks sufficient capital to do this, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2,000 Peruvian soles

Maria is a very active and responsible woman.  Her main desire is to see her family progress and improve their quality of life.  The people who know her  consider her to be a calm and reliable person.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing more products to sell

loans.name: Esther Clotil

texts.es:
Esther es una madre de familia de 34 años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el caserío Insculas una zona agrícola del distrito de Olmos, perteneciente a la provincia de Lambayeque, se encuentra ubicado a mas de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la comercialización de productos de primera necesidad, abarrotes y algunas medicinas en una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Este negocio ya lleva funcionando cerca de cinco años y tiene mucha acogida ya que le permite a sus vecinos agenciarse de diversos productos a los que usualmente no tienen acceso rápido debido a su ubicación. Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad ella ayuda a su esposo con los gastos económicos de su familia.

Esther desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de modo que sus ventas e ingresos aumenten y así pueda mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Como no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 600 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Esther es una mujer responsable y bastante activa. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una mujer amable, tranquila y confiable.
texts.en:
Esther is a 34 year-old mother who lives with her family in the rural Insculas settlement in an agricultural area in the Olmos district, part of the Lambayeque province, located more than 2 hours from the city of Chiclayo.

She sells groceries and basic consumer goods and some medicines in a store that is set up in her home.  This business has been running for about 5 years, and is well-received, since it allows her neighbors to buy a variety of products that they usually do not have access to due to their remote location.  With the income she earns from this activity she helps her husband with the family's expenses.

Esther wants to expand her business by buying more products to increase her sales and her income.  In this way she can improve the quality of life of her family.  As she lacks the capital she needs to achieve this objective, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 600 Peruvian soles.  

Esther is quite active and responsible.  The people who know her consider her to be a friendly woman who is calm and reliable.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell in her store

loans.name: Yolanda Eulalia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres Unidas se reúne en la ciudadela San Alejo de la bellísima ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita, conocida por las hermosas playas que recorren todas sus costas y que son muy visitadas por los turistas nacionales e internacionales.

Aquí encontramos a la señora Yolanda que nos cuenta algo de su vida, tiene 62 años, es soltera pero en su juventud tuvo tres hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad, su hijo mayor vive en Junín, la menor vive en Quito y solo uno  vive con ella.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja todos los días desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 14h00, ella deja a crédito y cobra por semanas, dice que sus clientes son fieles a ella ya que son varios años que ella les entrega sus productos, se desplaza hasta Guayaquil a comprar sus productos una vez por mes cuando ya tiene algunos pedidos.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en ir a Guayaquil a comprar más mercadería. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 9 años y le gusta por los créditos que llegan rápido y sin tantos tramites.

Sus sueños son salir adelante y tener un local para ya no recorrer más sino que sus clientes lleguen a su local.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres Unidas" meets in the San Alejo neighborhood of the beautiful city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí province, known for the beautiful beaches that line its coasts that are often visited by national and international tourists.

Here we find Yolanda, who tells us something of her life.  She is 62 years old and is single, but in her youth she had 3 children who are now adults.  Her oldest child lives in Junin, the youngest lives in Quito, and only one of them lives with her.

Yolanda sells clothing door-to-door.  She works every day from 9 in the morning until 2pm.  She sells on credit and collects weekly.  She says that her customers are loyal to her, since she has been delivering their products for a number of years.  She travels to Guayaquil to buy her products once a month when she already has some orders.

She will use this loan to go to Guayaquil to buy more merchandise.  She has been a member of the communal bank for 9 years, and she likes it because of the quick access to funds without as much paperwork.

Her dreams are to get ahead and to have her own shop so that she wouldn't have to go around to sell anymore, rather, her customers would come to her place of business.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, T-shirts and clothing in general

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca tiene 53 años D. edad, es casada y vive junto a su familia en el caserío Guaraguaos, una zona rural que pertenece al distrito agrícola D. TambogranD., ubicado en la región Piura, a mas D. tres horas y media D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta D. animales menores, especialmente ganado ovino y aves D. corral, ella las alimenta con granos y pastos naturales, cuando ya ha alcanzado un buen nivel D. desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes D. la zona. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y actualente tiene sembrado plantas D. mango. Con los ingresos que ambos perciben se encargan D. sacar adelante a su familia.

Ella desea ampliar su negocio con la compra D. más animales y alimentos para criarlos, con esta acción piensa aumentar sus ventas y percibir mas ingresos. Para realizar su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles.

Francisca es una mujer entregada a su familia y a su trabajo. Su día transcurre en el cuidado D. su hogar y en el cuidado D. sus animales. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Francisca, 53, is married and lives with her family in the Guaraguaos settlement, in a rural area that is part of the agricultural district of TambogranD., located in the Piura region, more than 3 and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

Francisca raises and sells small animals, particularly sheep and barnyard fowl.  She feeds the animals with grains and field grasses.  When they have reached a good level of development she offers them for sale to the traders in the area.  Her husband is a farmer and he is now planting mango plants.  With the income that they both earn they proviD. for their family.

She wants to expand her business with the purchase of more animals and feed to raise them.  She thinks that this would increase her sales so that she could earn more.  To do this, she is requesting for the first time a loan with Edpyme Alternativa for 1,500 Peruvian soles.

Francisca is a woman who is very dedicated to her family and her work.  She spends her days caring for her home and for her animals.  The people who know her consider her to be a person who is calm and responsible.

loans.use: to buy more animals and to buy feed to raise them

loans.name: Adriana Del Carmen

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres Unidas se reúne en la ciudadela San Alejo de la bellísima ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita, conocida por las hermosas playas que recorren todas sus costas y que son muy visitadas por los turistas nacionales e internacionales.

Son nueve ciclos los que la señora Adriana lleva en el Banco Comunal y esta muy contenta y agradecida con la Fundación Espoir porque gracias a ellos ha logrado salir adelante en su negocio y en su vida personal, ella es una persona muy activa y luchadora. Está casada y tiene tres hijos, dos de ellos son mayores de edad, el menor vive con ella, pero sus otros hijos viven también cerca en la misma ciudadela con sus familias.

Ella vende comida, tiene un pequeño restaurante en su casa, trabaja desde las 5 am hasta las 14h00, vende desayunos y almuerzos, prepara una gran variedad de platos para tener contentos a sus clientes ya que la competencia es dura y no puede dejar escapar a sus clientes, por eso siempre les da lo mejor acompañado de su gran humor.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar productos para la preparación de sus deliciosos platos y para comprar una mesa y 8 sillas.

Sus sueños son que su hijo sea un buen profesional y tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres Unidas"  (Women United) meets in the San Alejo neighborhood in the beautiful Manabí capital Portoviejo.  The city is known for its beautiful beaches that cover all of its coastal area and are visited by national and international tourists alike.  

This is Señora Adriana's ninth cycle with the communal bank and she is very happy and grateful to Fundación Espoir because, thanks to them, she has been able to get ahead in her business and her personal life.  She is a very active and hard-working person.  She is married and has three children, two of whom are older.  The youngest still lives with her, however, the older two live  with their families in the same neighborhood.  

Señora Adriana sells food for a living.  She has a small restaurant in her house and she works from 5:00 am until 2:00 in the afternoon serving breakfast and lunch.  She prepares a wide variety of dishes to please her customers as the competition is tough and she can't afford to lose her customers.  For this reason she always serves her customers cheerfully.
 
She will use this loan to buy ingredients to prepare her delicious dishes and also to buy a table and 8 chairs.  She dreams of seeing her son become a professional and to have a large restaurant.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for the foods she prepares and a table and 8 chairs for her restaurant

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda es una madre de familia de 25 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a su pequeño hijo en el caserío Santa Clara, una zona agrícola situada en el distrito de Pítipo, provincia de Ferreñafe, se encuentra ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace cuatro años a la venta de cerveza y comida en un local acondicionado en su vivienda. Allí ella ofrece a sus clientes algunos platos de comida como ceviche, guisos de pescado y platos hechos a base de carne seca los cuales suelen ser acompañados por cerveza. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida por parte de sus clientes, ya que ella suele ofrecer una buena atención y prepara sus platos con muy buena sazón. Su esposo trabaja como agricultor y con los ingresos que ambos perciben tratan de sacar adelante a su familia.

Yolanda desea realizar algunas mejoras en el local donde atiende a sus clientes, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer bastante tranquila y responsable. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una persona tranquila y confiable.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a 25 year-old mother who lives with her husband and their small son in the rural Santa Clara settlement, an agricultural area located in the Pitipo district in the Ferreñafe province, which is located an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

For 4 years she has been selling beer and food in a restaurant attached to her home.  There she offers her customers some dishes such as ceviche, fish stew and dishes made from a base of dried meat, which are usually consumed with beer.  This business is well-received by her customers, since she offers good service and prepares tasty dishes.  Her husband works as a farmer, and with the income that they both earn they try to get ahead with their family.

Yolanda wants to make some improvements to her restaurant, and to do this she is requesting for the first time a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 Peruvian soles.

She is a woman who is quite calm and responsible.  The people who know her consider her to be tranquil and reliable.

loans.use: to make improvements to her restaurant

loans.name: Elida Del Rocío

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres Unidas se reúne en la ciudadela San Alejo de la bellísima ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita, conocida por las hermosas playas que recorren todas sus costas y que son muy visitadas por los turistas nacionales e internacionales.

Aquí encontramos a la señora Elida, ella tiene 45 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tuvo dos hijos de 15 y 16 años los mismos que están en el colegio estudiando.

Es comerciante, Se dedica junto con su marido a la venta de  mariscos, lo que más venden son el pescado albacora por libras o enteros, también los camarones tienen bastante demanda, pero ellos venden de todo, trabajan todos los días desde las 4am que salen de su casa para recibir los productos en el mercado de mariscos en Portoviejo y en algunos casos van a comprar a Puerto López y Manta ya que allá les salen más baratos, luego sale a recorrer en un carro por todo Portoviejo, tienen muchos clientes que le compran, también entregan en tiendas.

Este crédito lo van a ocupar para comprar más pescado y camarones para la venta. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por las facilidades de pago. 

Su sueño es tener un frigorífico.
texts.en:
The United Women Communal Bank is located in the San Alejo citadel, which is found in Portoviejo, the beautiful capital city of the Manabí province. Portoviejo is known for its scenic beaches that stretch across its coasts. These beaches are frequently visisted by national and international tourists.  It is here where Elida resides. 
 
She is 45 years old, and lives in a common law marriage. She has two children, ages 15 and 16, who are students.
 
Along side her husband, Elida works selling seafood. The main item they sell is albacore, a fish which they sell individually or by the pound. Shrimp, which are sold individually, are also in high demand. They begin working at 4am when they go to the fish market in Portoviejo to gather their merchandise. To take advantage of cheaper prices, they sometimes go to the fish markets in Puerto López and Manta. From there they drive to several locations throughout the city to serve their clients. They also sell to stores.
 
Elida is requesting this loan in order to purchase more fish and shrimp for her business. This is her second loan cycle with the communal bank, whose payment services she's been pleased with.

Her dream is to have a vehicle equipped with refrigeration for the seafood.

loans.use: To purchase fish and shrimp.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen C. is 36 years old, married and has two school-aged children. She is from the village of R J Macias in Sindangan municipality, a part of Zamboanga del Norte province on the Mindanao islands. Carmen runs a general store from which she sells a variety of different products to the local community. She has been in business for over ten years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2010 Carmen joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. Carmen successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC which she used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Carmen is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP that will be used to purchase new items to expand her product line. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product line

location.town: R.J. Macias, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad O. is 56 years old, married and has four adult-aged children. She is from the village of Maikay, Tudela municipality in Misamis Occidental province on the islands of Mindanao. Caridad runs a general store from which she sells a variety of different products to the local community. Caridad has been in business for over twelve years and earns approximately 2400 PHP a month.

In 2004, Caridad joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 40,000 PHP from PMPC which she used to purchase additional products to sell. Caridad is requesting a new loan, her tenth from PMPC, of 35,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement her family's income.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

texts.en:
Ricky C. is 38 years old, married and has four school-aged children. He is from the village of Mibantang in the municipality of Quezon, Bukidnon province on the Mindanao islands. Ricky runs a sari-sari (variety) shop from which he sells both food and daily use products to the local community. While his wife manages the store, he also works on a sugarcane farm. Ricky has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010 Ricky joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. Ricky is requesting a loan, his first, of 5000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional products to sell. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma es una madre D. familia D. 49 años D. edad que vive junto a su esposo y a su hijo en el caserío Santa Clara, una zona rural del distrito D. Pítipo, provincia D. Ferreñafe. Se encuentra ubicado a una hora D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica desD. hace mas D. diez años a la ganadería, ella cuenta con cuatro cabezas D. ganado vacuno D. las cuales comercializa la leche que producen a un acopiador D. la zona que a su vez la venD. a una D. las empresas procesadoras D. lácteos más granD. del país. Su esposo es agricultor y con el dinero que ambos perciben tratan D. sacar adelante a su familia.

Irma desea adquirir alimentos balanceados para mejorar la calidad D. la leche que producen y D. ese modo obtener mas ingresos al momento D. venderla, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles.

Irma es una mujer entregada a su familia y con muchas ganas D. sacarla adelante. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una persona tranquila, responsable y D. confianza.
texts.en:
Irma, 49, is a mother living with her husband and son in Santa Clara, a rural area in Pítipo district, Ferreñafe province, located an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

For over 10 years she has raised cattle.  She has four head of cattle.  She sells the milk they produce to an area milk consolidating firm that in turn sells it to one of the country’s largest dairy products processing plants.  Her husband is a farmer and income they both earn supports the family.

Irma wants to buy nutritionally balanced feed to improve the quality of the milk her animals product so that she can earn higher income at the time of selling it.  She has, therefore, deemed it convenient to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for the first time in the amount of 1500 new soles.

Irma is a woman who is dedicated to her family and she very much wants to see them get ahead in life.  People who know her consider her to be levelheaded, responsible and trustworthy.

loans.use: To acquire nutritionally balanced feed to improve the quality of the milk her cows produce.

loans.name: Segundo Marcos

texts.es:
Segundo es un padre de familia que tiene 47 años de edad, reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Pacasmayo, una zona que es la capital de la provincia del mismo nombre y que se encuentra ubicada a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace más de 15 años a la venta de limones y ajíes en un puesto situado en el mercado de su distrito. El suele ofrecer estos productos por las mañanas y debido al tiempo que lleva trabajando en esta actividad actualmente cuenta con un grupo de clientes fieles que siempre acuden a su puesto porque prefieren su buen trato y la calidad de los productos que ofrece.

Segundo se vale de estos ingresos para sustentar a su familia. Actualmente desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más verduras para ofrecérselas a sus clientes, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Segundo es una persona honrada y bastante trabajadora. Anteriormente ya ha tenido créditos con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Segundo, 47, is a father living with his family in Pacasmayo district, a place that’s the capital of the province of the same name, located over two hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

For over 15 years he has sold lemons and chilies in a stand located in the district market.  He usually works during the morning and due to the length of time he’s been in business he has a base of regular customers that always come by his stand because they prefer the good treatment and quality of products he offers.

Segundo avails himself of this income to support his family.  He wants to enlarge his business buying more vegetables to offer his customers.  He has, therefore, thought it convenient to request a 1000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

Segundo is an honest, quite hard working person.  He has had previous loans with Edpyme Alternativa and has been punctual and responsible with his repayments.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en: Nelly S. is from the village of Lilingayon, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 44 years old. Nelly is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Nelly owns and operates a mini-restaurant. The main source of income for the business comes from serving a variety of different meals to customers and also running a mini store. Nelly has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Nelly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelly is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant. This will be the first loan taken out by Nelly from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase food and drinks for the restaurant

loans.name: Residenciales El Campo N° 2 Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Residenciales El Campo #2 está integrado por tres socias, los cuales realizan diferentes actividades económicas. Doña Elbia es una las socias, tiene 51 años de edad, es viuda y tiene cinco hijos. De lunes a viernes, ella tiene un empleo fijo como aseadora y el fin de semana vende verduras. El problema más difícil que enfrenta es que no tiene una vivienda propia, y los directivos de la escuela le dieron permiso para que construyera una habitación dentro de las instalaciones de la misma y gracias a los préstamos obtenidos en FAMA pudo hacerlo aunque es muy pequeña para su familia. Su reto es ahorrar aunque sea de poco en poco para comprar un solar y poder construir su casa, seguir manteniendo a su familia porque hace dos años su esposo murió y no tiene ningún otro soporte económico. Elbia solicita el préstamo para comprar papas, chiles, cebollas, zanahorias, pataste, repollo, etc. y así ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes. Una de sus ventajas es que su hijo mayor le ayuda a transportar en una carreta las verduras desde su casa al mayoreo y no tiene que pagar transporte ni empleado porque él también le ayuda a atender a los clientes. Con el apoyo del préstamo espera obtener mejores ganancias para ahorrar un poco, seguir llevando el alimento a su casa y seguir pagando el estudio de sus cuatro hijos menores. Su sueño es tener también un puesto de venta de ropa para contar con otra entrada de dinero y así poder empezar a construir su casa, y graduar a sus hijos. Elbia se siente muy agradecida porque con el financiamiento obtenido en FAMA ha podido mejorar sus condiciones económicas y de antemano se siente agradecida con todas las personas que invertirán en ella a través del préstamo.
texts.en:
The “Residenciales El Campo #2” (El Campo Residences #2) group consists of three members who do different economic activities.

Mrs. Elbia, 51, is one of the members.  She’s a widow and has five children.  From Monday to Friday she has a steady job working as a Cleaning Lady and on weekends she sells vegetables.

The greatest obstacle she faces is not owning her own home and the school administrators gave her permission to build a room on the school grounds.  Thanks to FEMA loans she was able to do so although it is too small for her family.

Her challenge now is to save up, even if just bit by bit, to buy a piece of property on which to build her house and to continue supporting her family because her husband died two years ago and she has no other source of income.

Elbia is requesting funds to buy potatoes, chilies, onions, carrots, chayote, cabbage, etc. in order to have a wider variety available for her customers.
An advantage she has is that her oldest son helps her move the vegetables from home to the wholesale market with a cart so she doesn’t have to pay transport costs nor hire an employee since he helps her tend to customers too.

With support from the loan she hopes to earn better profits so that she can start to have some savings, continue to bring food home and pay for her four youngest children’s education.  Her dream is to also have a stand to sell clothing to have a second source of income and start to build her house and have her children graduate.

Elbia is very grateful because financing from FEMA has helped her improve her economic conditions and she would like to thank everyone ahead of time who will invest in her through the loan.

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley Q. is 44 years old, married and has five adult-aged children. She is from the village of Lower Lilingayon within Valencia City, Bukidnon province on the Mindanao islands. Shirley runs a sari-sari (variety) shop from which she sells both food and other products as well as a variety of viands for meals to the local community. She also buys and sells bananas. Shirley has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Shirley joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. She is requesting a loan, her first, of 5000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

loans.name: Cristo Resucitado (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de  Portoviejo, capital manabita conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Cristo Resucitado.
Este es un grupo de señoras que a pesar de que este es su primer ciclo es muy unido y con  ganas de salir adelante, es por eso que se decidieron unir. Unas  para instalar sus negocios y otras para mejorar el que ya tienen, siempre tratando de mejorar en su vida diaria para su propio bienestar y el de sus familias. Ellas se dedican a diferentes actividades tales como, (comercio, ventas, producción y  servicios,).

Aquí conversamos con la señora Maribel, tiene 39 años, en la actualidad está separada pero tuvo tres hijos de esta relación, desde que se separo tuvo que hacerse cargo de los gastos de sus hijos que aun son menores de edad y están estudiando dos en colegio y la menor en escuela, lo cual representan muchos gastos. 

Es así como hace unos años atrás decidió dedicarse al comercio, primero empezó vendiendo productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza y perfumería) pero al darse cuenta que no le alcanzaba con esto decidió vender zapatos y ropa de damas, eso es lo que realiza en la actualidad vende todos estos productos. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8am hasta las 11am y desde las 15h00 hasta las 17h00 ya que también tiene que atender su hogar y sus hijos. La ropa y los zapatos los compra en Quito y Guayaquil, ciudades a la que viaja una vez al mes dependiendo de los pedidos que tenga.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar mas mercadería para aumentar sus ventas. Este es su primer crédito y le ha gustado por la facilidad para obtener los créditos.

Su sueño es tener una boutique.
texts.en:
The “Cristo Resucitado” (Christ Resurrected) communal bank meets every two weeks in Portoviejo, known for many years as the Royal Tamarinds City. 

This is a group of women who, despite being in just their first cycle, are very unified and eager to get ahead which is the reason they came together.  Some want to set up their businesses and other want to improve the ones they already have always aiming at improving their daily life for their own and their families’ wellbeing.  They are involved in a variety of economic activities like: commerce, sales, production and services.

On this occasion we chatted with Maribel, 39.  She is separated at the moment but has three children.  Since separating she had to take charge of her children’s expenses.  All are minors and two go to secondary school and the youngest daughter is in elementary school.  This means high expenses.

A few years ago, then, she decided to go into commerce.  First she started out selling Yanbal brand beauty products and perfumes.  However, noting that this did not produce income sufficient to meet her needs she decided to sell shoes and ladies clothes.  This is what she is currently selling.  She works every day from 8am until 11am and again from 3pm until 5pm because she also has to tend to her home and children.  She buys the clothes and shoes in Quito and Guayaquil, cities she travels to once a month depending on the number of orders she has.

This financing will be used to buy more merchandise to increase sales.  It is her first loan and she liked it because of the ease in obtaining loans.

Her dream is to have a boutique.

loans.use: To buy ladies clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Las Amigas Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Las Amigas está integrado por dos socias, los cuales realizan diferentes actividades económicas en el municipio de San Francisco de la Paz, Olancho. Doña María Leticia M. es una las socias, tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y tiene ocho hijos. Desde hace 6 años ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotería en general en una pequeña pulpería que tiene instalada en una parte de su casa de habitación. Sus hijos se dedican a estudiar pero cuando tienen un tiempo libre le ayudan a atenderla mientras ella se ocupa de los quehaceres del hogar. Ella solicita el préstamo para surtir el negocio con la compra de productos como manteca, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, condimentos, salsas, pastas, pan, churros, refrescos, lácteos, carnes, embutidos, etc. El único problema que enfrenta por los momentos es que sus ventas han bajado, pero espera que la situación mejore. Con el apoyo del financiamiento tiene la perspectiva de que su pulpería sea más atractiva para los compradores y que con eso se convierta en la mejor de la comunidad. Es su primer ciclo en FAMA.
texts.en:
The “Las Amigas” (The Girlfriends) group has two members who do different economic activities in San Francisco de la Paz, Olancho.

One of the members is Mrs. María Leticia M., 43.  She is married and has eight children.  For six years now she has sold groceries in a small grocery store installed in part of her house.  Her children are in school but when they have free time they help her tend to the store while she does household chores.

She is asking for funding to stock the store with items like: lard, rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, condiments, sauces, noodles, bread, churros (fried dough), beverages, dairy products, meats, sausages, etc.

The only problem she is currently facing is a drop in sales but she hopes this situation will improve.  With financial help she has the possibility of improving her store’s appearance to make it more attractive to customers thereby becoming the best one in her community.  This is her first cycle with FAMA.

loans.use: To buy general groceries.

loans.name: Michelle Joy

texts.en:
Michelle Joy A., from the village of Lurugan, Valencia City, Bukidnon, is 22 years old, married, and has one infant-aged children. To make a living, Michelle Joy owns and operates a specialized retail store selling clothing and other personal products such as umbrellas in the local community. Engaged in her business for over a year, she earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Michelle Joy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Juana Gelsamina

texts.es: Juana Gelsamina M. es una comerciante de 34 años de edad, casada, madre de cuatro hijos y junto a su familia reside en el Barrio Centro en la comunidad de San Francisco de la Paz, Olancho. Hace seis años su madre le enseñó a trabajar para que día a día se pudiera ganar el sustento. Desde ese tiempo ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y abarrotería en su casa de habitación, su horario de atención es desde las 6:00 am hasta las 6:00 pm y mientras ella cuida su negocio tres de sus hijos se van a la escuela.  Con el financiamiento obtenido podrá surtir sus dos negocios de más y variados productos. Una de sus dificultades es la ubicación de su casa ya que está un poco escondida y no tiene la oportunidad de exhibir mejor su mercadería. Con el apoyo del préstamo espera seguir  ayudando a su esposo con el sostenimiento del hogar, y ahorrar para poder alquilar un local que tenga una muy buena ubicación. Su sueño es ver crecer a sus hijos sanos y que se conviertan en personas que contribuyan a la construcción de una mejor sociedad. Es su tercer ciclo en FAMA  y con los financiamientos obtenidos ha podido ir mejorando su vida económica.
texts.en:
Juana Gelsamina M., 34, is married and has four children.  She and her family live in the Centro neighborhood in San Francisco de la Paz, Olancho.

Six years ago her mother taught her how to work so that she would be able to earn her own living.  Since then she has sold clothes and groceries from home.  She is open for business from 6am until 6pm.  While she tends to the business three of her children attend school.

With the obtained financing she will be able to stock both her businesses with a greater variety of products.

One of the difficulties she faces is her house’s location because it’s a bit hidden so she can’t display her merchandise very well.

With help from the loan she hopes to continue to help her husband support the household and save up to rent a place that’s better situated.

Her dream is to see her children grow up healthy and that they become persons who contribute to building a better society.

This is her 3rd FEMA cycle.  With loans received she has been able to gradually improve her economic life.

loans.use: To buy clothes and groceries.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita L. is from the village of Poblacion, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 51 years old and is widowed. To make a living, Carmelita owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling home products such as utensil sponges, sewing thread, etc. in the local community. She also makes and sells food like jack fruit salad. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Carmelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell and to provide capital for her business. This will be the first loan that Carmelita has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly M. is a hard-working married woman who operates a tricycle (three-wheeled-vehicle) business and a sari-sari (variety) store to earn a living. Her supportive husband, Vilmado, is a farmer and manages their transport business. Nelly and Vilmado offer a good transport service for people in their village. Nelly belongs to a group of entrepreneurs where she saves her money and has secured access to capital from ASHI. She appreciates that the organization has helped her improve her businesses and therefore her quality of living.

She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to pay for maintenance of their tricycle with some of the loan funds to be used to purchase necessary supplies for her store. She hopes to buy more tricycles in future for better output and so that her children can make their own living. She sees herself venturing into “Talyer” which means auto repair and a vulcanizing shop business in the next five years. Nelly is hoping that her envisioned businesses will help her to support the financial needs of her family so that they can move away from the nightmares of poverty. By then, Nelly thinks positively that their lives would be changed and she will have achieved her dreams.

loans.use: To pay for maintenance of their tricycle (three-wheeled-vehicle) and to buy supplies for her store.

loans.name: Jeyrhan

texts.en:
Jeyrhan A. is 52, married and has one daughter. She works as a Head deputy of the school in Sokuluk village and is known as a strict and impartial teacher. Jeyrhan, being an example of commitment to profession, inspires her daughter, who is a student, to reach new levels in education.  In order to pay for university fees, Jeyrhan began to develop her business in cattle breeding. She bought milk cows and sold milk at the local market.  She is also engaged in raising bulls, which became an additional mean of income. 

Jeyrhan plans to use her loan of  25,000 KGS to broaden her business by buying bull calves and a feed for them. With the revenues from these investments, she will be able to pay for the education for her daughter and raise her family's living standards.

As for her personality, Jeyrhan likes French literature and dreams to see Paris some day. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Oyunbold

texts.en:
Oyunbold B. is 29 years old and lives with his wife and two year old daughter in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. They live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His wife is currently unemployed and takes care of her young daughter. 

Oyunbold operates a transportation service business in his province which started  in 2008 and has found success as a motorcycle driver. He owns one motorbike and transports people by it. In addition, he also operates a meat trading business by purchasing meats at wholesale price to sell back as a retailer at the local market to supplement his income. Currently he has stopped running his meat selling business for a while. When he obtained his first loan on June, 2008, he had not had any electronic products in his home, but since then he managed to improve his family's standard of living. His earnings have enabled him to buy electronic products for his home as well as to purchase his own land and fence. Moreover, he owns 10 goats that are being herded by his father. Oyunbold is a very hard working and creative person. He is requesting a 150,000 MNT loan to purchase spare parts in order to maintain his motorcycle.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts

To make a living, Azucena owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies like boiled corn and rice cakes in the local community. Azucena has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Azucena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Azucena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Azucena is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional corn to sell and working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Azucena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business.

loans.name: Azylkan's Group

texts.en:
Azylkan S. is the leader of the group. She is 57 and married. She has raised two sons and four daughters. All the children are married and live separately with their families. Azylkan and her husband are engaged in farming.  They sell agricultural products. In this way they make 3000 soms per month. With money received from the loan Azylkan wants to purchase two tons of wheat to resell later at the higher price. In the future she wants to expand her business and improve the living conditions. 

Kulumkan J. is the treasurer of the group. She is 63 and married. She has raised thirteen children. Kulumkan and her husband are farmers. They grow wheat. With money received from the loan Kulumkan wants to purchase seeds of wheat (one ton) for sowing. 

Almaz B. is 26. Three years ago, with the initial investment of 15000 soms, he started to sell agricultural products. He applied for the loan because he needs money to purchase apples (one ton) in order to resell them at the higher price in winter.

Ruslan K., 34, is married. He has a son and two daughters. The daughter is at school and the sons are not yet old enough to attend school. In order to make money Ruslan sells agricultural products. With money received from the loan he wants to purchase three tons of wheat. In the future he wants to expand his business, build a shed and start breeding cattle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase wheat

With money received from the loan, Zainagul wants to purchase two calves for breeding. In the future she wants to see her youngest son get married and to start building a new house in Karakol.

Apal N., 55, is married. She has a daughter and three sons. Apal is engaged in cattle breeding and her husband works as a teacher. With money received from the loan, Apal wants to purchase two calves in order to increase the number of cattle.

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Micro-finance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

He will use the anticipated extra profits to expand his shop to ensure financial stability.

In the future Japhet hopes to have a hotel to earn additional income. His deepest desire is to see his children realize their goals in life through a good education.

After the rainy season, when the rams have fattened, he sells them at a higher price and earns some profit.

He learned about KADET LTD. from marketing awareness done by KADET staff in his area. This will be his first loan, which he is planning to use to buy more sheep for fattening to sell later at a profit.

With the anticipated profit, he intends to acquire a bigger piece of land and fence it for grazing.

His future dream is that he will become a large-scale farmer in sheep rearing.

Cherry has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Cherry joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cherry has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Cherry is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be the third loan taken out by Cherry from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra N. is 16 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Sandra has a business of selling charcoal, which she has had for four years.  She sells vegetables too.

To help expand her business, Sandra has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more charcoal and vegetables. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Sandra hopes to generate greater profits to pay for school fees. In the future, Sandra hopes to go back to school and become a doctor.  

Sandra is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to behave.

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Asuncion

The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Asuncion has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Asuncion joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Asuncion has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Asuncion is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be the second loan taken out by Asuncion from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. location.town: San Luis, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala West region of Uganda.  She is married and has three children, all of whom are currently in school.  Prossy has a business of selling charcoal, which she has had for two years.  She also sells dry fish and runs a small hotel.  

To help expand her business, Prossy has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more charcoal, caps, and plates.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Prossy hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.  In the future, Prossy hopes to expand all of her businesses.  Prossy is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by enabling her to save money.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Bulbul

texts.en: Bulbul M. is 41 years old and lives with her husband and two teenage sons in Bayan-Ulgiy province of western Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her oldest son, 17, is a student and works and studies in Kazakhstan while her youngest son, 16, attends a local high school. Her husband works in a construction company. Bulbul operates a clothing retail trading business in her town. She used to work as a clothing salesperson where she sold other people's clothes and received a salary. Based on her experience, she started her own business in a rented stall at the Hurd trade center in 2008. She is planning to expand her business and import more clothing items from Erlian, a border city in China. She wants to open her own shop when her business reaches a sustainable level. Her earnings have enabled her to buy a new house after selling her old one. Bulbul is a very modest and hardworking woman and says, " All I want is to continue operating my business with success and provide for my children's education. " She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more clothes from China which she can sell in her market.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing

loans.name: Parmusenke Ole

texts.en:
Parmusenke Ole K. is 62 years old. He and his wife, Ntajiri K., have seven children. Parmusenke has reared cattle for ten years and his goal is to buy young heifers during the dry season when they are not very costly, then keep them in his farm, which he has fenced purposely for grazing. After the rainy season when the bulls have fattened he sells them at a higher price and earns a profit.

He learned about Kadet Ltd from marketing awareness done by Kadet staff members in his area. This will be his second loan, with which he is planning to buy ten more young bulls for fattening to sell later at a profit.

With the anticipated profit he intends to acquire a bigger piece of land and fence it for grazing.

His dream for the future is to rear cattle on a larger scale.

He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To spend Kshs 70,000 to buy seven heifers of Ksh10,000 each for fattening to sell later.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe L., age 51, is from the village of Tambagan, Medina, Misamis Oriental. Fe and her husband have three school-aged children. To make a living, Fe owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She chose to lower down her loan from 17,000 PHP to 5,000 PHP because she finds it easier to repay. Fe has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Fe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Fe is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and will also be used as working capital. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Fe from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther M., age 18, lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is single and has no children.  Esther has a business in tailoring, which she has had for three years.         

To help expand her business, Esther has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase materials like cloth and thread. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Esther hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, Esther hopes to expand more on her business. 

Esther is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her meet new friends and learn important life skills.

loans.use: to buy more materials like clothes

loans.name: Beth Muthoni

texts.en:
Beth has been selling used clothes in Naivasha town for the last four years. She is 29 years old and married to Joseph Guthonda. They have one child.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend. This will be her first loan. She plans to use the cash to buy more second hand clothes to sell.

In the future, Beth is planning to diversify and move into real estate.

loans.use: To buy more second hand clothes

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen D. is from the village of San Luis, Gingoog City. She is 35 years old. Helen is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Helen owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Helen has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Helen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Helen is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This will be the second loan taken out by Helen from HSPFI.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

To make a living, Junaphil owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling bananas in the local community. Junaphil has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Junaphil joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. loans.name: Tsermaa

texts.en: Tsermaa D. is 55 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in Dundgovi province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. All three of her children are grown and currently work, while her husband is retired and has a monthly pension of 110,000 MNT. Tsermaa operates a wool product-making business in her home. She began her business in 2002 and has since built a stable and successful operation. After many years of operation, she has managed to purchase her own equipment, such as an electric sewing machine, felt scribbler and knitting machine that all are necessary for her wool production. She is a wool training teacher, and she also graduated from vocational training as a shoemaker. Tsermaa is a modest and hardworking woman. She says, "My products' quality is improving, which attracts many customers. With my business profits, I have been able to buy new equipment. In the future, I plan to open my own shoemaking business." She is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to buy necessary raw materials, such as fine, wool, camel yarn, in order to keep her business growing.

loans.use: To buy necessary raw materials

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene B. is from the village of Purok 5, Barangay 24, Gingoog City. She is 33 years old. Arlene is widowed and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Arlene owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of food products in the local community. Arlene has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Arlene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arlene is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Arlene from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Artur

texts.en: Artur S. is single and currently lives with his mother, brother, and sister-in-law. After having served in the Army, Artur needed to find his way in life, to make a stable living, to have his own place, and plan for a family. He decided to import elegant ladies clothing from the US. He is renting a shop in “Hayastan” trade center and has long-standing customers, offering them both good service and quality clothing. Artur has applied for a loan to purchase new inventory and expand his business.

loans.use: new clothing inventory

loans.name: Kulziya

texts.en: Kulziya H. is a 65-year-old widow with three adult children. Her husband passed away five years ago. She and her children have been living in a house in Bayan-Ulgiy province, Mongolia, for the last 20 years. Her two daughters attend university. She has been operating a sewing business since 2000 after working as a seamstress in a tailoring company from 1990 to 1995. She usually sells her products through people with stalls at the local market. She makes a variety of felt products with nice traditional ornamentation. After many years of successful operation, she has managed to build a sustainable business. Because of her success, Kulziya was able to pay off her son's tuition fees and is still paying those of her two daughters. She is an open-minded and hard-working woman who says, "I want to expand my business and have my own workplace in the future." During winter, she needs to buy more felt and wool, so she is requesting a 400,000 MNT loan in order to purchase materials from Taikeshken in China.

loans.use: To purchase more materials

loans.name: Gladies Musimbi

texts.en:
Gladys Musimbi S. is 50-year-old lady, married to Jamin S.. Gladys runs a grocery in Kabarnet to support her family of six. Most of her customers are residents of Kabarnet.

Gladys is borrowing a second loan of Kshs 20,000 from KADET Limited to purchase vegetables tomatoes, cabbages, carrots, bananas, garlic and ginger. The remainder will be used for transportation and other overhead costs.

Gladys intends to plough back the profits into the business for expansion. Her dream is to grow her business and purchase a pick-up truck for transportation. She would like to be able to give her children the best education possible.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables for her store and for transportation

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline S. is from the village of Agay-ayan, Gingoog City. She is 38 years old, separated from her spouse, with five school-aged children. To make a living, Evangeline owns a sari-sari (variety) shop selling both food and daily-use products. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Evangeline joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the first loan taken out by Evangeline from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Houssam

texts.en: Houssam is a 28 year-old married man living in Bint Jbeil with his wife and two children. He has worked in construction since 1999, and specializes in cement. This is his first time requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to pay his children's school fees. His work is going well, but clients are often slow in paying, which makes it difficult for him to meet his children’s school needs. Houssam’s clients are loyal to him as he is to them; his skills are his strength. He hopes to expand his work in construction.

loans.use: To pay his children's school fees

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel M. lives with his father, two brothers, sister-in-law and one child in the village Arteni in the Aragatsotn region of Armenia. While one of the brothers is working on construction in Russia to be able to support himself, the other brother helps Samvel look after the cattle and cultivate the land. And although the family works very hard to makes ends meet, there is still much required. 

Samvel is planning for winter and he has applied for this loan to buy fodder for the cattle.

loans.use: Buying fodder for the cattle

loans.name: Kangogo Arap

texts.en:
Kangogo Arap C. is a 72-year-old man. He is a father of four and a grandfather of five children. Mr. Kangogo supports a family of four, mainly his grandchildren. 

Mr. Kangogo runs a timber sawmill and timber yard. He started this business 15 years ago and through it, he was able to educate his children and now his grandchildren.

From this business he gets an average profit of 7,000 Kenyan shillings (Kshs) a month. Mr. Kangogo has borrowed a loan of Kshs 50,000 from KADET  Limited for his third loan. He intends to use Kshs 40,000 to purchase tree trunks and blocks for milling and with the remaining Kshs 10,000, he'll pay for transport and other costs, i.e. labor. 

Kangogo intends to use  the profits from the business to expand his timber yard and open a retail shop for his wife. His dreams and hopes are to expand his sawmill and yard to meet the demand for timber in Kabarnet and its environment and also to educate his grandchildren.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of tree trunks and blocks and to pay for transport and labor

loans.name: Aireen

texts.en: Aireen L. is from the village of Bal-ason, Gingoog City. She is 31 years old. Aireen is married and has a school-aged child. To make a living, Aireen buys and sells coconuts in the local community. Aireen has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Aireen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aireen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional coconuts to sell. Aireen is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be the third loan taken out by Aireen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
