loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Wilfridah Bunoro

texts.en:
Wilfridah Bunoro J. is a hardworking lady of 52 years. She is married to Walter J. and together they have four children, aged 27 years, 22 years, 18 years and 16 years, respectively. She has been farming for about five years and she earns a monthly income of 5,000 Kenyan shillings.

When she learned about KADET LTD. and happened to have no history with any other MFI (microfinance institution), she immediately applied for her first loan of Kshs.15,000 from KADET LTD. She intends to buy stock of poultry feeds and more poultry to keep so that she may have more eggs to sell to her customers. She plans to use the profits from the expanded business to start dairy farming, which is also very marketable in this area.

Wilfridah hopes to grow her business and become the leading local entrepreneur and to see her children realizing their dreams in life through education.

loans.use: To buy stock of poultry feed and more poultry

loans.name: Mary Njeri

texts.en:
Mary Njeri M. is 41 years old and married to Joseph M., who works as a driver. They have five children, four of whom are dependents. She has been in the quarry business for a period of four years now with a monthly profit of about 13,700 KES.

Mary wants to use her loan to buy tools for quarrying and pay workers. With the anticipated profit, she wants to pay school fees for her children and save for family investments. She hopes to buy a lorry to transport stones to customers.

loans.use: To buy tools for quarrying and pay workers

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn N., 39, is married and has four school-aged children. She is from the village of Purok 5 within Barangay 24 of Gingoog City in the province of Misamis Oriental on the Mindanao islands. Jocelyn runs a sari-sari (variety) shop from which she sells both food and daily use products to the local community. Jocelyn has been in business for over two years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2010 Jocelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. Jocelyn is requesting a loan, her first, of 5000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc., or HSPFI, is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Fouad

texts.en:
Fouad is a 26-year-old married man from Bint Jbeil and is the father of two children. Since 1995 he has worked in construction and specialized in setting and cleaning tile. Fouad is very organized in his work, ambitious and loyA.. Customers request him from distant villages because of his good word-of-mouth reputation. He is highly recommended, and he is skilled in his field of work.

Fouad is requesting his first loan from A. Majmoua in order to pay for his children’s school fees and supplements. He is working on expanding his business in order to achieve his goA., which is to have his children attend important universities.

loans.use: To pay for his children's school fees

loans.name: Kirinkai Ole

texts.en:
Kirinkai Ole N. is 48 years old and married to Pasiyio N.. He supports six people in his family.

Kirinkai farms on his own land, which he has been doing for the last fifteen years.

He learned about KADET through a friend who is already a registered member of KADET. This will be his first loan,  which he is planning to spend on fertilizer and chemicals to treat his wheat crop.  He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming.

Kirinkai's dream is to practice large-scale farming, attain financial independence and improve the living standard of his family.

He is a hard-working man who is determined to achieve his goals.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and chemicals for his wheat crop

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma E. is from the village of Maribucao, Gingoog City. She is 52 years old. Elma is widowed and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Elma owns and operates a specialized retail store where she buys and sells ready-to-wear clothing. Elma has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Elma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Elma is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be Elma's second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is married with one son. She sells clothing and shoes at the local market. Maria has been in this business for 10 years. Her monthly income is about 5,000 Grivnas. Maria enjoys her business and would like to develop it further. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 Grivnas to expand her seasonal inventory. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To expand seasonal inventory

loans.name: Dorie

texts.en:
Dorie G. is from the village of Talisayan, Misamis Oriental. She is 42 years old. Dorie is separated from her spouse and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Dorie owns and operates a hairdressing and beauty services business. Dorie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Dorie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dorie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide services. Dorie is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional materials to expand the services she can provide. This will be Dorie's sixth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Delma

texts.en: Delma is from the village of  Makawa,Aloran, Mis. Occ. She is 34 years old and married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Delma is involved in fish vending in her local communtiy. Delma has been in this business for about 2 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for this activity. In November 2006, Delma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. This was her 10th loan taken from PMPC she previously repaid her loan amounting in 12,000 PHP and is requesting a new loan amounting of 5000 PHP for the additional inventory capital of her business  to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional Capital for her Fish Vending

loans.name: Thomas Kiplagat

texts.en:
Thomas Kiplagat C. is a tailor. He is 43 years old and married to Rose Jepkorir Koech. They have four children who are 22, 18, 15, and 12 years old. Thomas earns a profit of 8,500 KES per month from his tailoring business.

He is applying for his third loan from KADET LTD, after successfully paying back the other loans. He plans to use the loan to buy fabric for making clothes and a modern sewing machine. These items will help him to provide better service to customers.

With the anticipated profits from his expanded business he hopes to begin selling on a wholesale basis in Eldoret town.

loans.use: To buy fabric and a modern sewing machine

loans.name: Agrhim Oponi Ole

texts.en:
Agrhim Oponi Ole M. is 23 years old and supports two family members. His spouse, Margaret, is a housewife. For the past four years Agrhim has been a wheat farmer. His wife helps Agrhim on the farm.

This will be Agrhim’s first loan. He is planning to spend 30,000 KES on chemicals and fertilizer, and 20,000 KES to spray his wheat fields. He is planning to use the anticipated profit from his farming to rent a bigger piece of land and so increase his wheat production.

Agrhim hopes and dreams that he will become a large-scale farmer owning a bigger piece of land and be financially stable enough to support his family.

loans.use: To spend 30,000 KES on chemicals and fertilizer, and 20,000 KES to spray his wheat fields

loans.name: Charlyn

texts.en:
Charlyn J. is 33 years old, married and has four school-aged children. She is from the village of Santa Ines in the municipality of Talisayan in Misamis Oriental province on the Mindanao islands. Charlyn makes and sells food, primarily snacks and other delicacies like ice candy and banana-cues to the local community. She has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Charlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to buy the ingredients needed to make her snacks and delicacies. Charlyn is requesting a new loan, her fourth from HSPFI, of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional ingredients and for working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc., or HSPFI, is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients and for working capital

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose K. is 49 years old and is married; her husband is a tailor. She has seven children, four of whom go to school.

Rose currently sells clothes at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more inventory to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: Stock more clothes to sell

loans.name: Gladwell Wambui

texts.en: Gladwell is 51 years old and married to George Gathua Njoroge.  She has been operating her butcher shop in the town of Naivasha since 2004. She was introduced to KADET by a friend, and paid back her first loan from them in good time.  This will be Gladwell’s second loan from KADET.  She plans to use the money to add mutton to her stock of meat for sale in her butcher shop.  In the future, she hopes to start selling live sheep and goats in the local market, as this kind of business is highly marketable in her area.

loans.use: to buy mutton for sale

loans.name: Mark Kipkemei

texts.en: Mark is 32 years old.  He is married to Rebecca Wamuyu, and the couple have three children. He has operated his butcher shop in the town of Naivasha since 2008.  He was introduced to KADET by a friend, and paid back his first loan of KES 60,000 in good time. This will be Mark’s second loan from KADET.  He plans to use the money to add beef to his stock of meat for sale in his shop.  In the future, he hopes to open another, bigger butcher shop, selling different types of meat.

loans.use: to buy beef for sale

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira M. is from the village of Medina, in Misamis Oriental. She is 51 years old, married, and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Elvira owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products, and also buying and selling gasoline in the local community. Elvira has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Elvira joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional products to sell. She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. This will be Elvira’s 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & as working capital

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en: Cicilia B. is 40 years old and married to a soldier . She has 6 children who go to school.  She currently operates a small business selling beer, local alcohol, etc.  She is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business and build a bar.

loans.use: to stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Tumuka Ole

texts.en:
Tumuka Ole N. is 41 years old. He is married to Kisieku N., and has five school-going children.  He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his goals.

Tumuka is a farmer.  For the past seven years he has been farming on his own piece of land.  He learned about KADET through a friend, who is also a registered client of KADET in his area. This will be his second loan from KADET.  He is planning to spend twenty thousand to buy fertilizer and chemicals for his ten-acre wheat farm, and the remaining ten thousand on spraying the wheat.  He intends to buy some farm machinery with the anticipated profit from his expanded farming activity.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and chemicals for his wheat farm, and to spray the wheat

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa V. is 47 years old, married and has three school-aged children. She is from the village of Talisayan within Misamis Oriental province on the Mindanao islands. Leonisa is a tailor who provides general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. Leonisa has been in business for over ten years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2010 Leonisa joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. She is requesting a loan, her first, of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabric and materials. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabric and materials

loans.name: Jeff Kagunda

texts.en:
Jeff Kagunda K., 30 years old, recently was married to Grace Wangeci. He has run his barber shop in Naivasha town for the last seven years.

Jeff was introduced to KADET by his friend. He paid off his previous loan of 30,000 KES well and in good time. He plans to use this loan, his second from KADET, to buy new equipment for his barber shop to replace old equipment so that he can maintain good standards of service for his customers.

In the future Jeff plans to grow his business and achieve a stable financial flow in order to provide basic needs for his family.

loans.use: To buy new equipment for his barber shop

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric E., 31 years old, is a rice farmer and a food vendor. He has been working his farm for five years now. The income he is able to generate from his farm enables him to buy basic necessities for his family. While most of his rice harvest goes toward the family’s daily consumption, he also sells some of the harvest to earn money for his family.

Eric would like to apply for a loan with Community Economic Ventures Inc. in order to buy three sacks of seed and five sacks of fertilizer. He likes CEVI’s services because they include micro-insurance products in their loans.

loans.use: To buy three sacks of seed and five sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga sells women’s clothing at Krytiy market in Zaporozhye city. Her monthly income is 4,000 Grivnas.

Olga started this business five years ago. Her mother, who is also a market vendor, helped Olga to purchase initial inventories and start the business. Today Olga attracts her clients with the variety and good quality of her inventory. She would like to develop her business further. Olga is requesting a loan of 12,100 Grivnas to purchase women’s coats for sale.

Olga is married and has one 4-year-old son.

loans.use: To purchase women's coats

loans.name: Izro

texts.en:
42-year old Izro D. is hoping to achieve success in his own business. He has been a farmer for more than 18 years and would like to improve the size of his harvest so that he can support his family's needs.

He grows rice and the income from this endeavor has helped his family in terms of buying food, clothes, and other basic necessities. It also allows him to maintain his farm and send his children to school. 

He applied for a loan of Php 10,000, which he will use in buying seed, fertilizer, and other farm necessities. He chose CEVI because of its very good program. He likes it a lot because it helped his business grow when it was small and it provies good insurance coverage for him and his fellow borrowers.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Cherryl

texts.en:
Cherryl P., age 22, is from the village of Poblacion, Talisayan, Misamis Oriental. Cherryl and her husband have two school-aged children. To make a living, Cherryl owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Cherryl has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

Cherryl joined HSPFI this year in order to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Cherryl is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Cherryl from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Nnrthern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn P. has invested a great deal in her farm. Her philosophy is that when you take good care of your crops they will will give you a better harvest. However, to maintain a farm also entails costs, which is why she wanted to procure a loan at CEVI to support her farming needs.

She has been a rice grower for 15 years. Thanks to her business, she is able to earn approximately Php 15,000 from every harvest. She has also allotted part of her land for coconut trees.

Jocelyn has two children. She is doing her very best to be the best possible mother for them. She would like to apply for a loan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Otuma Ole

texts.en:
Otuma Ole S., 39 years old and married to Naengengunye S., has been a wheat farmer for the last six years. He supports a family of three people. Otuma learned about KADET LTD through a marketing campaign in his area of residence and is now requesting his first loan to buy pesticides to spray his growing wheat to prevent it from being invaded by pests. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to meet the demand for wheat in this region.

A hardworking man determined to achieve his goals, Otuma's hope and dream is to become a large scale farmer and have his own farm machinery.

loans.use: To buy pestcides for wheat.

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en: Cicilia F. is currently in the business of selling green vegetables. She is requesting a loan to stock fish to sell. Cicilia is 25 years old and is married; her husband works in the transportation industry. She has two children who do not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe O. is 23 years old. She was very much worried about how would she run her business, especially now that she has no capital. Then, she found out about CEVI and totally likes its program. 

She is a farmer and she grows rice for a living. She supports her sister, who currently goes to school. She hopes for her sister to be able to finish college and find a good job. In addition to farming, she also manages a small restaurant. She sells food and earns a profit from it. Her business income has helped a lot in buying the basic needs for her family.

She would like to apply for a loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos to be able to support her farm. By doing this, she thinks and hopes that she will be able to do something to increase her harvest.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Sayrabubu

texts.en:
Sayrabubu U. is a 58-year-old widow with four grown children. She is engaged in sewing clothes and is known as a careful master who makes her clients look modern and elegant. One of her daughters was inspired by Sayrabubu’s creative processes and became an interior decorator, following her mother’s steps in making the world around her beautiful. 

In 1991, in order to support her children, Sayrabubu started this business with her initial capital of 10,000 Kyrgyzstan som (KGS).  She worked hard to develop this activity and, using the revenues, managed to renovate her flat. 

Sayrabubu will use this loan of 100,000 KGS to broaden her range of products by purchasing different kinds of fabrics. With the revenues, she plans to buy accessory equipment and employ women who are good at sewing. In her personal plans, Sayrabubu wants to see her son marry and make essential preparations for a young family.  

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics

loans.name: Juvelyn

texts.en:
Juvelyn R. is from the village of Ricoro, Gingoog City. She is 31 years old. Juvelyn is married and has one child. To make a living, Juvelyn runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income comes from selling food and daily use products. Juvelyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Juvelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Juvelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Juvelyn is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which she will use as working capital and to purchase additional inventory. This loan is her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation.  Because manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template to help field partners post their loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Working capital and to purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.en:
Nicolas N. is from the town of Banga. He grows corn crops and manages a piggery business. Nicolas has been engaged in his business for quite a long time now. He hopes to have a stable income.

Nicolas joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation. He has two children and he does his best to provide for all their needs. 

Nicolas has applied for a loan of 15,000 PHP. He will use the loan to buy farm supplies and feed for the pigs.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and feed

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en: Natalya is single. She runs a small business where she sells farm supplies such as seed, fertilizer, and flowers. The store she rents is in a very good location, and it attracts many clients. Natalya has been working for five years and has gained many repeat clients. She enjoys her business and would like to develop it further. Natalya is requesting a loan of 6,500 Grivnas to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Remee

texts.en:
“To grow my business” is Remee F.’s objective in requesting a loan from CEVI. Remee is 33 years old, and she wants only to improve her family's living situation.

Remee has four children, all of whom go to school. She is working very hard to be able to pay the tuition, buy the books, and provide other school necessities.

Remee is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies. This loan will help her increase her harvest. Remee is interested in trying other business opportunities to augment her family's income.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita R. is from the village of Ricoro, Gingoog City. She is 33 years old. Cristita is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Cristita runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income comes from selling food and daily use products. Cristita has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Cristita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Cristita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Cristita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP that she will use as working capital and to purchase additional inventory. This loan is her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation.  Because manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template to help field partners post their loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Working capital and to purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
Rodolfo B. is dreaming of being successful in his own business. He has been a farmer for more than 15 years. He would like to increase the size of his income to help his family.

He grows rice and earns an average of 15,000 Philippines pesos per harvest. His income from growing rice has truly helped his family with buying food, clothes and other basic necessities. 

Rodolfo applied for a loan from CEVI. He will use it to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. Rodolfo likes CEVI's program. He likes it because it has insurance benefits.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Laureta

texts.en: Laureta M. is from the village of Bal-ason, Gingoog City. She is 43 years old. Laureta is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Laureta runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Laureta has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Laureta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Laureta is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Laureta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo M. lives in the town of Banga. He has been a farmer for 10 years. He is doing this to make a living. He has two children. He is doing his best to be able to provide for the needs of his family. Being a father, all responsibilities are pointed unto him.

His business enables him to earn at least 15,000 Philippines pesos (Php) per harvest. The income he is able to generate from growing rice helps a lot with buying the daily needs for his home. He is also able to support his children in their studies.

At the moment, he would like to apply for a loan of Php 15,000. He will use it to buy farm supplies to grow his harvest.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: By God In Power Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are the members of the “By God In Power” group. These are small-scale businesswomen who are based in the northern city of Makeni. They want a loan of SLL 1,400,000 for each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Zainab K. on the left.  Zainab who was born in Buya Romende village is aged forty-five. She is married with two children. Her husband is a teacher; one of her children is in primary school and the other is in secondary school.  For ten years now, she has been selling biscuits, mints, cold soft drinks, etc. Zainab will use her share of this loan to expand her business by buying the above-mentioned items in large quantity.

loans.use: Buy biscuits, mints, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica A. is from the village of Bal-ason, Gingoog City. She is 48 years old. Veronica is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Veronica runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Veronica has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Veronica joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Veronica is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Veronica from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Togtohtuya

texts.en:
Togtohtuya D. is a 30-year-old married woman with one young son. She lives with her family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia, in their own "ger," a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her son attends a local kindergarten. 

Togtohtuya, with the help of her husband, operates a wheel-repair business in the local community. She and her husband have been engaged in this business since 2006 and since then, they have built a successful and stable operation. They hired two more workers. 

She is a very modest woman and is requesting a 2,500,000 Mongolian tugriks loan in order to purchase a new house for their family.

loans.use: To purchase a new house

loans.name: Kalicha's Group

texts.en: Kalicha B. is the leader of the group. She is 51 and married. She has two daughters and four sons. Kalicha is engaged in cattle breeding and her husband works as a constructor. Sometimes, if they need money to cover family expenses, Kalicha sells cattle. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase building materials. In the future, she wants to purchase a piece of land in Bishkek and start building a house there. Jamal K. is the treasurer of the group. She is 41 and married. She has two daughters. Jamal is engaged in poultry and her husband went to work in Russia. Jamal started her business a year ago with the initial investment of 1,500 soms and now she makes 3,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, she wants to start building a place to keep chickens. In the future, she wants to purchase a vehicle and a flat in Bishkek. Argen K., 35, is married. He has two daughters and a son. Argen is engaged in cattle breeding. He started building a house for his family and he hopes to obtain the loan because he needs money to purchase construction materials in order to finish building a house. Baktygul A. K., 25, is married. She has a daughter and two sons. Her husband works as a taxi driver. A year ago, with the initial investment of 50,000 soms, Baktygul rented a container and started to sell convenience goods from it. In this way, she makes 7,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase more goods in order to increase the turnover of her business. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase building materials

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia J. is from the village of San Juan, Gingoog City. She is 46 years old. Aurelia is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Aurelia owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Aurelia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Aurelia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aurelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Aurelia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Aurelia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

location.town: San Juan, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: The Truth Group

texts.en:
Meet members of “The Truth” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 1,200,000 for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to further expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Anjay A. T. (pictured on the left) is the leader of this group. The forty-five-year-old is married and has six children – three in   primary school and three in secondary school. Anjay sells audio and video CDs, VCDs and DVDs. He has been running this business for many years now. With his share of this loan, Anjay will buy the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to his business inventory.

loans.use: buy goods wholesale for resale

loans.name: Felizarda

texts.pt:
FELIZARDA M. nasceu em Jogo um dos distritos de Morrubene, província de Inhambane, a sul de Moçambique. Cresceu e fez o se u ensino primário na mesma província. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Saiu de Inhambane para Maputo com o seu marido quando este foi transferido. Tem um negócio próprio ha mais de 5 anos, onde consegue um rendimento de cerca de 4.000.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através do seu esposo que já era cliente da instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00 para comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, portas e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.
Para o futuro pretende solicitar novos créditos uma vez que ira precisar de montar cozinha e casa de banho melhorando as condições de sua residência.
texts.en:
Felizarda was born in Jogo, one of the districts of Morrubene in the Inhambane Province, South Mozambique. She grew up and went to elementary school in that same Province. She lives in her own house with her family and doesn't support anyone else. 

She left Inhambane to go to Maputo with her husband when he was transferred. She has had her own business for more than 5 years. She makes around 4,000 meticais per month which goes towards household expenses and bank savings. 

She has never had loans with other banks. She came to know about Hluvuku through her husband who was already a partner. This is her first loan, in the amount of 15,000 meticais. It will be used to purchase construction materials (cement, sand, doors and others) to continue construction of her house. 

She intends to request more loans in the future since she wants to build her kitchen and bathroom to improve her house's conditions.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, sand, doors and others)

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is married with one son. She sells food; cheese, butter, ketchup, etc. at the local food market. Natalya started this business 5 years ago. At that time she had a job but the salary was too small to take care of her family. Today Natalya has got a developed business, two sales locations and many repeated clients. This business is the main source of income for Natalya’s family. 

Natalya is requesting a loan of 5,000 Grivnas to increase her working capital. The food is getting more expensive and she needs more money to purchase the same amount of food to sell.

loans.use: to increase working capital

loans.name: Erdenechimeg

texts.en: Erdenechimeg B. is 31 years old and lives with her husband and one son in Ulaanbaatar, a capital city of Mongolia. The family lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent in a rented yard. Her son, age 6, attends a local kindergarten. Erdenechimeg operates a grocery business with help of her husband in the Bayanzurh market. They began this grocery business in 2007 with working capital of 500,000 MNT. After years of work, they could only increase their working capital to 700,000 MNT but still have not built sustainable operation yet. They have used their earnings to provide their family's daily consumption. In the future, they hope to expand their grocery trading business. She says, “All I want is to help my son lead a happy life and have our own home”. She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more candies and sweets at wholesale price to resell for profits.

loans.use: To purchase more candies and sweets

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira B. is from the village of Ricoro, Gingoog City. She is 29 years old. Elvira is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Elvira owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling of firewood in the local community. Elvira has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elvira joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvira has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Elvira is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Elvira from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional firewood & working capital

loans.name: Sèbessé Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sèbessé est composé de quatre célibataires sans enfant vivant toutes dans des grandes familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 20 ans. Elles habitent le quartier Médine Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers leurs activités génératrices de revenus dans le marché Médine de Ségou. 
Les membres du groupe font l’achat et la vente du savon, riz, fruits, tubercules et légumes (concombre, patate, igname, banane et pomme de terre). 
Dans le but de diversifier les marchandises à vendre, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’adhérer au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 5ème prêt solidaire.
 Mademoiselle Djènèbou  S. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 20 cartons de savon au grand marché de Ségou en gros. Elle revend au comptant et à crédit à domicile, en ambulant dans les quartiers et au marché de Médine Ségou en détail à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Mademoiselle Djènèbou  S. espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour épargner, s’entretenir et constituer petit à petit son trousseau de mariage. Tout comme les autres membres du groupe, elle a pour objectif d’augmenter le volume de son petit commerce dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Sèbessé group is made up of four single and childless women, who all live in large traditional families. They average 20 years of age. They live in the Médine district of Ségou (Mali's fourth administrative region) and met each other through their income generating activities at the Médine market in Ségou.

The members of this group buy and sell soap, rice, fruit, tubers and vegetables (cucumber, yams, bananas and potatoes). In order to diversify the goods that they sell they decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program and are on their fifth group loan.

Miss Djènèbou S. is planning on using her loan to buy 20 cartons of soap wholesale at the market in Ségou. She resells on a retail basis for cash and on credit, walking through the various districts and at the Médine Ségou market, to a customer base made up of men and women. 

With this loan, Miss S. is hoping to make an average monthly profit of 25,000FCFA, which will be used to save, to look after herself and to build up her marriage trousseau. In common with the other members of the group, her goal is to increase her business volume through her relationship with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: To buy soap

loans.name: Umut's Group

texts.en:
Umut I. is the leader of the group. She is 47 and married. She has two sons and two daughters. The first son works in Bishkek. The second helps his dad with farming and the daughters are students.  Six years ago with the initial investment of 5000 soms Umut and her husband started to breed livestock. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase farm animals for breeding. In the future she plans to celebrate her son’s wedding.

Mairamkul E. is the treasurer of the group. She is 21. She works in a sewing workshop. Mairmakul also breeds farm animals. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase livestock for breeding. 

Elmira B., 40, is married. She has three sons and a daughter. Her husband works as a herdsman. The first son helps his dad and the other children study at school. Elmira breeds livestock. She hopes to obtain the loan because she needs money to purchase some farm animals for breeding. 

Asel B., 27, is married. She has two daughters, both of them are preschool age (under seven).  Asel is engaged in livestock breeding and her husband works in construction.  With money received from the loan Asel wants to purchase livestock for breeding.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase farm animals

loans.name: Ani

texts.en:
Ani K. is a single mother who is bringing up 2 children. She is an English teacher and Ministry of Foreign Affairs employee in the past.  

Ani started a sales business in 2004 to bring more financial stability to her home, be more independent and insure her children’s brighter future. Ani  sells in children’s clothing from a rented booth in “Tashir” market. She has applied for this loan to purchase new inventory.

loans.use: To purchase children's clothing.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary L. is currently in the business of selling cassava flour and local alcohol. She is requesting a loan to stock more cassava flour to sell.  Mary is 29 years old and is married. Her husband is a farmer. She has 4 children and 1 of her children goes to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: Stock more cassava flour to sell

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn N. is from the village of Agay-ayan, Gingoog City. She is 26 years old. Jovelyn is single. To make a living, Jovelyn owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Jovelyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jovelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Jovelyn is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Jovelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married with grow-up children. She sells women’s clothing at the central market in Kahovka town. Her main clients are women who wear large size clothing. Svetlana has been in this business for 16 years. She enjoys working in sales very much.

Svetlana is requesting a loan of 8,800 Grivnas to increase her working capital. She hopes to earn additional profit and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to increase working capital

loans.name: Djama Kanou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djama Kanou est composé de six femmes majoritairement mariées dans des ménages monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 32 ans et 2 enfants par femme. Elles habitent le quartier Médine Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des relations de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenus dans le marché Médine de Ségou. 
Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de savon, crème pour la peau, riz, condiments alimentaires, fruits et légumes (concombre, laitue, pastèque, melon, papaye et pomme de terre) etc. 
Dans le but de reconstituer leurs stocks afin de satisfaire la demande de plus en plus croissante des clients, les membres du groupe ont  décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 5ème  prêt solidaire.
 Madame Hawa  Djiré est réputée pour sa vente de fruits et légumes dans le marché Médine de Ségou. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 3sacs de concombre, un chargement de charrette en pastèque, 2 sacs de melon, 3 corbeilles de papaye et 200kg de pomme de terre. Elle se ravitaille en marchandises avec les forains  des villages environnants au marché château et grand marché de Ségou. Elle revend au comptant et à crédit à domicile et au marché de Médine Ségou en détail à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Madame Hawa Djiré espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour épargner, payer les frais et les fournitures scolaires des enfants
texts.en:
The six women of the Djama Kanou group are married, for the most part in monogamous households. They average 32 years of age and two children each. They live in the neighborhood of Médine Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali), and know one another through neighborhood connections, kinship, and their income-generating activities at the Médine market in Ségou.


The group members sell soap, skin cream, rice, condiments, fruits and vegetables (cucumber, lettuce, watermelon, melon, papaya, potato), etc.


In order to replenish their stocks to meet increasing customer demand, they turned to the Soro Yiriwaso MFI and are now seeking their fifth group loan.


Mrs. Hawa Djiré is renowned for her fruits and vegetables at the Médine market of Ségou. She plans to use her loan to buy three sacks of cucumbers, one cart-load of watermelons, two sacks of melons, three baskets of papayas and 200 kg of potatoes. She gets her stocks from vendors coming from nearby villages to the Chateau market and the big market of Ségou. She sells at retail for cash and credit, both from home and at the Médine market of Ségou, to a clientele composed of men and women.


With this loan, Mrs. Hawa Djiré hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 30 000FCFA, which she will use for savings and to cover expenses and pay for the children’s school supplies.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina U. is currently in the business of selling fish, beans and cooking oil and is requesting a loan to stock more fish and cooking oil to sell.  Regina is 36 years old and is married. Her husband works for a company. She has 5 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: Stock more fish and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Maryann

texts.en:
Maryann B. is from the village of Binakalan, Gingoog City. She is 22 years old. Maryann is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Maryann owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motorcycle and habal-habal services to local community members. Her husband is the driver. Maryann has been engaged in her business for over 1 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Maryann joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maryann is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Maryann from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en: Jenifer K. is currently in the business of owing small business selling local alcohol and Uganda waragi and is requesting a loan to stock more brewing materials . Jenifer is 32 years old and is married. Her husband is a company em[loyee. She has 1 child and her child goes to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: Stock more brewing materials

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en: Gayane H. is a widow with two children. She opened a music disc and computer accessorie shop in 2007. Gayane purchases the goods from both local and international suppliers. Gayane’s son helps his mother run the business, her daughter is a student. Gayane is eager to be competitive on the market and meet her clients’ demand. She has applied for the loan to purchase new inventory.

loans.use: purchasing new inventory

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa D. is from the village of Brgy. 26, Gingoog City. She is 54 years old. Elsa is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Elsa owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling firewood in the local community. Elsa has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elsa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional firewood to sell. Elsa is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Elsa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

location.town: Barangay 26, Kahulogan, Gingoog City, Misamis Orie

loans.name: Naji

texts.en:
Naji is a 36 years old married man living in Bint Jbeil with his wife and two children. Naji works in construction; he is specialized in digging, in addition to another business he owns, which is transporting students to and from school.  

This is Naji’s fourth cycle with Al Majmoua; his previous loans improved his business. Naji’s loan will be used to make the necessary maintenance to his school bus and to buy a new car. His clients are numerous and he has a well know business reputation. He hopes to continue improving his business.

loans.use: To make necessary maintenance to his bus

loans.name: Isidra

texts.en:
Isidra T. is from the village of Malibud, Gingoog City. She is 34 years old. Isidra is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Isidra owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables like ampalaya for sale. Isidra has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Isidra joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Isidra is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Isidra from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.
