loans.use: To buy more bags of flour

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more used clothes

loans.name: Dorine  Jepkemoi

texts.en:
Dorine K. is a 31-year-old lady married to Evan Kurgat and is blessed with two children. Dorine helps support her family of two children along with her husband's income. She runs a second hand clothing business in Kabarnet town. From this business she gets a monthly income of 36,000 KES. She has requested a loan of 30,000 KES, which is her second loan after having paid her first loan successfully.

She intends to use 10,000 KES to buy blouses, 5,000 KES for skirts and 15,000 KES for towels. She plans to save the profits to be used for expansion of her business in the near future.

Dorine's dream and hope is to expand her business and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of used clothing

loans.name: Help Yourself Group

texts.en:
Alice W., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Help Yourself.  She is 36 years old, married, and has four children whose ages are between six to 19 years. She was only able to attend school through the 8th grade due to lack of financial support. 

For two years, she has been operating a mini-restaurant in Cotton Tree community, Marbibi County, Liberia. She plans to use her 4,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 20,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more bags of rice, pepper, beans, fish, meat and gallons of cooking oil. 

She describes herself as a friendly woman whose goals are to improve her business and continue to educate her children.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Rebecca is inset at the lower right because she was absent during the loan disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, pepper, beans, fish, meat and gallons of cooking oil.

loans.name: Joshua Nyongesa

texts.en:
Joshua Nyongesa O. is a 35-year-old man, and is married to Mary Kayanga Chebai who works with an insurance company firm. They have two children, ages 13 years and 10 years respectively. They live in Maili Saba which is one kilometer from Kitale town. To make a living, Joshua sells car spare parts. He has been in this business for the past five years with an income of 12,000 KES per month.

Joshua was introduced to KADET LTD by a Credit officer and he is applying for his second loan of 30,000 KES with KADET LTD.  With this loan he plans to purchase car spare parts.

He hopes with the income he gets, it can be used to expand the business and turn it into a wholesale enterprise and see his children get a better education.

loans.use: To purchase car spare parts.

loans.name: Ntentepi Ole

texts.en:
Ntentepi Ole M. is 49 years old. He is married to Nesiamoni Enole M. and is the father of seven children. 

He is in the business of cattle rearing and wheat farming, which he has been doing for the last ten years. His aim is to buy young heifers during the dry season when they are not very costly, then place them in his farm which he has fenced purposely for grazing. After the rainy season when the bulls have fattened, he sells them at a higher price and earns some profit.

He learned about KADET LTD from marketing awareness done by the KADET staff in his area. This will be his first loan, which he is planning to use to buy more young bulls for fattening to sell later at a profit, and also to prepare his land for wheat farming.

With the anticipated profit he intends to acquire a bigger piece of land and fence it for grazing.

His future dream is that he will become a large scale farmer in cattle rearing and wheat farming.

loans.use: To buy heifers and to prepare his land for wheat  farming

loans.name: Emily Martha

texts.en:
Emily is a 50-year-old business lady. She is married to Douglas, with whom she has two children. Emily has been operating a retail shop business for the past nine years. Her monthly income is 15,000 KES.  She plans to increase the stock for her business and intends to use the loan to purchase two bags of sugar, three bundles of maize flour and one roll of cloth material. 

She intends to continue to increase her stock with the profit expected from her business. Her hopes and dreams are to improve the living standard of her family in education and good health.

loans.use: To buy two bags of sugar, three bundles of maize flour, and one roll of cloth material.

loans.name: Fuente De Desarrollo 1 & 2 Group

texts.es:
Santa es una de los miembros del Grupo Fuente para el desarrollo  1 y 2, son microempresarios dedicados a las ventas de ropa, productos naturales, zapatos, artesanía,  etc; en la ciudad de Samana, una ciudad turística en desarrollo, bordeada por las costas del Océano atlántico y rica en recursos naturales.  Está asociada de Esperanza comenzó con nosotros porque tenía la necesidad de trabajar para superarse.

Santa  está muy emocionada de recibir su cuarto préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, después de haber pagado satisfactoriamente sus préstamos anteriores y haber dado un paso para el crecimiento de su negocio. Ella ha tenido su negocio por alrededor de 2 años, el cual inició con un pequeño préstamo que todo a  otra institución diferentes productos en la playa. Santa está planificando invertir su nuevo préstamo en la compra de Cocos y Frutas. Ella va a utilizar sus ganancias para reinvertir en su negocio, mientras ahorra para poder comprar una guagua y construir su casa.  Su más grande sueño es poder ver a su hijo graduado y convertirse en una persona de bien.
texts.en:
Santa is one of the members of the Fuente Group for Development 1 and 2. They are micro-business people who sell clothes, natural products, shoes, artisanal crafts, etc. They are in the city of  Samana, a tourist town in development bordered by the Atlantic coast and rich in natural resources. She is associated with Esperanza and started with us because she needed to work to get ahead.

Santa is very excited to be receiving her fourth loan in Esperanza Internacional after having sucessfully paid off her previous loans and having taken steps to grow her business. She has had her business for around 2 years and started it with a little loan from another institution to sell products on the beach. Santa is planning on investing her new loan in purchasing coconuts and fruit. She will use her earnings to re-invest in the business while she saves to be able to buy a van and build her house. Her biggest dream is to see her son graduate and become an upstanding person.

loans.use: To buy coconuts and fruit

loans.name: Gloria Erlinda

texts.es:
Gloria G. S. tiene 33 anos. Es casada y vive en el Cantón de San Pablo en la Provincia Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos de 13 y 16 anos. 

Gloria es una socia del grupo ¨Integracion Microempresarial¨ de San Pablo de Atenas. Son 14 socios en total, la mayoria que se dedican a diferentes actividades como comercio, negocios, y agricultores como fuente de ingreso a sus familias. 

A Gloria tiene un pequeño negocio de vender pollos por libras. La gente llega a su casa para comprar los pollos. 

Solicita el crédito para crecer un poco su negocio, comprando mas pollos y 4 terreros. Con el apoyo del préstamo mejoraría su vida, por poder poco a poco hacer mas cosas en la vida. Su sueno es tener una casa porque ahora esta arriendo una casa. 

No tiene mucho tiempo libre porque pasa todo el día haciendo quehaceres domésticos y ayudando a sus hijos. Le gusta ir de vacaciones con su familia una vez al ano a las piscinas.
texts.en:
Gloria G. S. is 33 years old. She is married and lives in the village of San Pablo in the Bolívar province. She has two children aged 13 and 16.

Gloria is a member of the "Integracion Microempresarial" ("Microenterprise Integration") loan group in San Pablo de Atenas. There are 14 members in total. Most of them work in trading, business and agriculture to provide their families with a source of income. 

Gloria owns a small business. She sells chickens by the pound. People come to her house to buy chickens.

Gloria is requesting the loan to expand her business, buying more chickens and 4 cages. The loan will help her improve her life, as it will allow her to do more things little by little. Her dream is to own a house because at the moment she is renting. 

She has little free time because during the day she is busy with household chores and helping her children. She enjoys going on holiday to the swimming pool once a year with her family.

loans.use: To expand her business by buying more chickens and 4 cages.

loans.name: Stanley Kipkurui

texts.en:
Stanley is a 30 year-old farmer from Isampin Village which is located in the agricultural town of Kilgoris, south of the Great Rift Valley. Stanley is married to Mary Soi and they have a one year-old daughter, Naresho Naanyu.

Stanley is an industrious farmer who specializes in planting maize. This is the main cash crop grown in this town which has rich soil and an excellent climate for maize growing. Stanley joined Kiva partner KADET Limited to gain access to micro credit and has applied for a loan of Kshs 20,000 (aprx. $250). He intends to use this loan to buy farm materials such as planting seeds and fertilizer, and also to pay labour for the people he will temporarily employ during this planting season. 

Stanley hopes to expand his farming business and therefore maximize his profit. He desires to make enough income to be able to educate his daughter. He hopes to achieve his dreams through this loan. He is very hardworking.

loans.use: To buy farm materials such as fertilizer and planting seeds, and to pay labour.

loans.name: Losulum Ole

texts.en:
Losulum Ole S. is 51-years-old. He is married to Nalakiti S. and he is the father of five school going children. Losulum is a farmer and, for the last 12 years, he has farmed on his own piece of land.

He learned about Kiva partner KADET Ltd. through a friend who is a KADET registered client in his area of residence. This will be his first loan and he plans to spend 20,000 in order to buy fertilizers and chemicals for help grow wheat on his wheat farm. 

With the anticipated profits from his expanded farming activities, he plans to buy some farm machinery.

He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and chemicals to help grow wheat.

loans.name: Martha Beatriz

texts.es:
Martha Beatriz O. tiene 42 anos. Es casada y vive en el Cantón de San Pablo en la Provincia Bolívar. Tiene 6 hijos. 

Martha es una socia del grupo ¨Integracion Microempresarial¨ de San Pablo de Atenas. Son 14 socios en total, la mayoria que se dedican a diferentes actividades como comercio, negocios, y agricultores como fuente de ingreso a sus familias.

A Martha tiene un pequeño negocio de comprar y vender legumbres. Tambien tiene una mini-tienda. Vende sus legumbres en San Pablo todos los dias. 

Solicita el credito para aumentar más su negocio, poder invertir y comprar mas cosas. Su sueno es tener una casa propio porque ahora esta arriendo, y le gustaria comprar un lugar propio y mejorarlo. Su negocio le va bien, pero siempre depende de la calidad del producto y atención al cliente. Siempre trata de darles a sus clientes un producto fresco y de buena calidad. 

Le gusta caminar y estar de computadora en su tiempo libre.
texts.en:
Martha Beatriz O., 42, is married and lives in the Ecuadorean province of Bolivar.  She has 6 children.

Martha is a member of the Integracion Microempresarial group in San Pablo de Atenas.  The group has 14 members, most of whom operate retail or farming businesses to earn incomes for their families.  

Martha operates a business buying and selling vegetables.  She also has a small shop.  She sells her vegetables in San Pablo every day.

Martha is applying for a loan to grow her business.  She will be able to use the loan to buy more things.  Her goal is buy a house of her own because she rents a house now and she would like to buy one and improve it.  Her business is doing well due to the quality of the product she sells and the service that she provides to her customers.  She always tries to give her customers the very best.

Martha likes to walk and use a computer in her spare time.

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Mary Njeri

texts.en:
Mary Njeri is 48 years-old and a green grocer business lady. She is married to David, a businessman. They have two children aged 15 and 13 years-old. Mary has been operating a green grocery business for the past year and her monthly income is Kshs. 25,000. She uses her income to support four members of her family.

With the loan she has applied for, Mary plans to increase the stock of her business through purchasing one bag of tomatoes, a half bag of onions, carrots and other type of vegetables. Mary intends to save the profit expected from the business and hopes to eventually operate a large well known grocery shop in Matuu village.

loans.use: To buy onions, tomatoes and other vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buying beans and corn for retail sales

loans.name: Oscar Vinicio

texts.es:
Oscar Vinicio V. tiene 44 anos. Es casado y vive en el Cantón de San Pablo en la Provincia Bolívar. Tiene 4 hijos. 

Oscar es socio del grupo ¨Integracion Microempresarial¨ de San Pablo de Atenas. Son 14 socios en total, la mayoría que se dedican a diferentes actividades como comercio, negocios, y agricultores como fuente de ingreso a sus familias.

Oscar se dedica a la agricultura como fuente de ingresos para su familia. Cultiva maíz y también tiene un pequeño negocio de la compra y venta de verduras. Vende sus productos en Ambato en el mes de Agosto. 

Solicita el crédito para comprar los abonos y líquidos para sembrar maíz. Con la ayuda del préstamo le va mejor con sus ingresos económicos. En los próximos anos espera seguir trabajando en el cultivo de maíz. Se desafía por las lanchas que comen a su maíz, y por los precios bajos del maíz este ano. 

Le gusta pasear y jugar deportes en su tiempo libre.
texts.en:
Oscar Vinicio Vásquez, 44, is married and has four children.  He lives in San Pablo canton, Bolívar province.

He is a member of the “Integración Microempresarial¨ (Microenterprise Integration) communal bank in San Pablo de Atenas.  It has 14 members total most of whom are in a variety of activities like commerce, business and farming as sources of income for their families.

Oscar’s source of family income is farming.  He grows corn and also has a small vegetable sales business.  He sells his products in Ambato during the month of August.

He is asking for funds to buy manure and liquids for the corn crops.  With the loan’s help he will improve his economic income.  He expects to continue to grow corn during the years to come.  His challenges are the pests that eat the corn and the low corn price this year.

He enjoys go on outings and to play sports in his spare time.

loans.use: To buy manure and liquids for corn crops.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El señor es soltero, vive en el barrio Obrero de la ciudad de Pilar.
Vive en casa de sus padres, donde se refleja que poseen con todas las comodidades para una familia trabajadora.
El mismo es comerciante, cuenta con una  empresa de ventas de todos tipos de mercaderías en general, ropas, accesorios , juegos de azar en  general, su rubro es comprar las mercaderias y los comercializa en la ciudad de pilar y ciudades vecinas, dicho trabajo lo realiza en su motocicleta recorriendo la zona, a cada unas de sus clientes.
Solicita el crédito para compras de mercaderías para su negocio como: ropas, calzados,  juguetes y otros.
Cuenta con una antigüedad en el ramo más de 15 años, brindando sus buenos servicios a sus clientelas.
Cliente manifiesta que con la ayuda del crédito se ha fortalecido  mas su microempresa y  agradece por los buenos servicios que les brinda la fundación paraguaya y kiva.
texts.en:
He is single and lives in the Obrero neighborhood in the city of Pilar in his parents’ house where they have all the comforts typical of a hard working family.

He is a merchant.  He has a company where he sells all kinds of general merchandise:  clothing, accessories, games of chance in general.  He operates buying merchandise and then reselling it in the city of Pilar and adjoining cities.  He does this work moving from place to place on his motorcycle to visit his customers.

He is requesting funds to buy merchandise like: clothes, footwear, toys and others.

He has 15 years experience in this line of work providing his customers with good service.

He states that with help from the loan he has strengthened his micro business and he is grateful for the services that Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva provide.

loans.use: To buy merchandise like: clothes, footwear and toys.

loans.name: La Nueva Alianza Ii Groups 1 & 2

texts.es:
Juana es una de los miembros del Grupo La nueva alianza  1 y 2, son microempresarios dedicados a las ventas de ropa, productos misceláneos, zapatos, artesanía,  etc.  Sus plazas se encuentran en la ciudad de Samana, una ciudad turística en desarrollo, bordeada por las costas del Océano atlántico y rica en recursos naturales.  Está asociada de Esperanza comenzó con nosotros porque los prestamos son para la realización de un negocio, y de esta manera hay mas compromiso y crecimiento. Es casado y tiene 3 hijos. También ha estudiado enfermería y su reto más difícil es lograr ser una gran enfermera. Su actividad favorita es trabajar manualidades.

Juana  está muy emocionada de recibir su segundo préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, después de haber pagado satisfactoriamente su préstamo anterior y haber dado un paso para el crecimiento de su negocio. Ella ha tenido su negocio por alrededor de 6 meses, el cual inició con su primer préstamo que tomo en Esperanza. Va a invertir su nuevo préstamo en la compra de Ropas nuevas, en su negocio también se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogos.  Ella va a utilizar sus ganancias para reinvertir en su negocio, mientras ahorra para poder comprar un carro y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Juana is one of the members of the New Alliance 1 and 2 group.  They are micro businesspeople that sell clothes, miscellaneous products, shoes, crafts, etc.  Their sales points are in the city of Samana, a tourist destination under development along the Atlantic coast that is rich in natural resources.

This associate of Esperanza started with us because the loans are to bring about business and this way there is more commitment and growth.

She is married and has three children.  She also studied nursing and her greatest challenge is to become a great nurse.  Her favorite pastime is maK. crafts.

Juana is very excited about receiving her second loan from Esperanza Internacional after having paid back her previous loan thereby taK. an important step forward with her business’ growth.

She has had her business for about 6 months which she started with the first Esperanza loan.  She is going to use the new loan to buy new clothes. She also sells products via catalogue.  She will use her profits to reinvest in her business while saving to buy a car and build a house.

loans.use: For clothes.

loans.name: Salima Kavutha

texts.en:
Salima is a business lady, a charcoal dealer aged 40 years old. She is married to Kitheka who is also a businessman. They have seven children aged between six and twenty years old.  Salima has been selling charcoal as a primary business for the past six years, but she also operates a kiosk where she sells things like eggs and snacks to people who buy charcoal on a daily basis as fuel. The business location is in Mwingi Village, and her clients are mostly villagers with low incomes. Her current monthly income is Kshs. 3,200 which she uses to support nine members of her family. The other source of income is through farming which is always a great challenge due to the weather conditions. 

Salima has never borrowed from any  micro-finance institution and she was introduced to KADET LTD through a credit officer. She is applying for her first loan of Kshs.5,000 with KADET, which she plans to use to purchase business utensils, for example cups, plates, and  spoons, for a secondary business of selling tea to her customers which she is preparing to open to manage together with the charcoal selling. 

She intends to construct a permanent house for her home with the extra profit expected from the business. Her hopes and dreams are to open a bigger hotel with accommodation facilities.

loans.use: To buy  utensils such as cups, plates and spoons for the  kiosk

loans.name: Lena Nzasu

texts.en:
Lena Nzasu is a single mother; a business lady aged 25 years old. She operates a green grocer stall. She is blessed with two children aged six months and three years old. She has been operating a green grocer business for the past three and half years. Her current monthly income is Kshs. 3,800. She supports two family members. 

Lena has never borrowed from any other MFI; she is applying for her first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to purchase  beans, green grams (lentils), soya beans and millet. With the extra profit generated from her business she intends to purchase a piece of land and construct her own permanent premises. Her hopes and dreams are to grow from small entrepreneur to a wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy assorted cereals

loans.name: Francis Musyimi

texts.en:
Francis Musyimi is a 63 year-old a businessman who sells livestock. He is married to Peninah and they are blessed with five children. Three of the children are working and two are in secondary school. Francis has been selling livestock for the past 25 years. His current monthly income is Kshs. 30,000.

Francis is servicing his second loan with Kiva partner KADET Ltd.  He plans to start a butchery to sell meat to his customers. With the anticipated profits from his business he intends to renovate his rental houses to modern ones with modern facilities. His hopes and dreams are to construct rental houses and buy pieces of land in his home town, Mwingi, and in other towns.

loans.use: To start a butchery and sell meat.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian S. is a 37 year-old green grocer.  She is married to Munyoki and they have four children aged 10, 13, 15 and 18 years-old respectively. Lilian has been operating a green grocery business for the past 14 years and her monthly income is Kshs. 25,000 which she uses to support six members of her family.

Lilian plans to increase the stock of her business and plans to purchase a bag of tomatoes, a bag of cabbages, a bag of onions and bananas. She intends to increase her stock with the profit expected from the business. Her hopes and dreams are to become a supplier of green vegetables in her home town.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes,onions and cabbages to sell.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es:
El señor es casado, vive en el barrio San José de la ciudad de Pilar, su señora es comerciante, se dedica a hacer productos chacinados (embutidos).
Posee casa propia, con las comodidades dentro del bienestar familar, posee móvil de transporte propio,  motocicleta.
El mismo es comerciante, también cuenta con una  empresa de servicios que realiza la actividad de ventas de servicios de albañileria.
Solicita el crédito para compras de insumos para su negocio de su esposa ya que el negocio les ayuda muchos especialmente para la alimentacion de la familia.
Cuenta con una antigüedad en el ramo más de 10 años.
Agradece tambíen a la Organización por los buenos servicios que le brinda la insitución para su empresa comercial y de servicios
texts.en:
He is married and lives in the San José neighborhood in the city of Pilar.  His wife is a merchant.  She makes cured meats.

He owns his house that has basic family comforts.  He also owns his own means of transportation: a motorcycle.

He is also a merchant and has a firm that provides bricklaying services.

He is asking for funds to buy supplies for his wife’s business because it helps a lot especially in family nutrition.

He has over 10 years experience in this line of work.

He is grateful to the Organization for the good services it provides for his commercial and service firms.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, rice, noodles, yerba mate (tea), flour, canned goods and others.

loans.name: Alexander Fabricio

texts.es:
Alexander T. Q. tiene 21 anos. Es soltero y vive con sus papas en el Cantón de San Pablo en la Provincia Bolívar. 

Alexander es socio del grupo ¨Integracion Microempresarial¨ de San Pablo de Atenas. Son 14 socios en total, la mayoría que se dedican a diferentes actividades como comercio, negocios, y agricultores como fuente de ingreso a sus familias.

Alexander se dedica a criar ganados, en este momento tiene 6 ganados. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en San Miguel y Guaranda cuando estan grandes. 

Solicita el credito para comprar 2 mas terneros. Con el apoyo del préstamo ampliaria los terneros que cria. Su sueno es ser profesional (quiere ser policia). Va a estudiar el proximo ano en la Universidad Bolivar. 

Le gusta jugar el boli y el futbol.
texts.en:
Alexander T. Q., 21, is single and lives with his parents in San Pablo canton, Bolívar province.

He is a member of the Micro enterprising Integration group in San Pablo de Atenas.  It has 14 members total that are in a variety of commercial, business and agricultural activities as means of family support.

Alexander raíces catre.  He currently has six head of cattle.  When they reach development he sells them in San Miguel and in Guaranda.

He is asking for funds to buy two more calves.  With the loan’s help he will increase the number of calves he raises.  

His dream is to become a professional (he wants to be a police officer).  He will enter Bolívar University next year.

He enjoys playing volleyball and soccer.

loans.use: To buy two additional calves.

loans.name: Gloria Bella

texts.es:
Gloria Bella M. tiene 41 anos. Es soltera y vive con sus hijos en el Cantón de San Pablo en la Provincia Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos de 22, 18, y 14 anos. 

Gloria es socia del grupo ¨Integracion Microempresarial¨ de San Pablo de Atenas. Son 14 socios en total, la mayoría que se dedican a diferentes actividades como comercio, negocios, y agricultores como fuente de ingreso a sus familias.

Gloria se dedica a criar chancos. Ahora tiene 6 chanchos y va a poner 8 más. Vende sus chancos en las ferias. 

Solicita el credito para ver si aumenta un poco mas su negocio de criar chanchos por poder comprar mas chanchos. Tambien solicita el credito para dar vitamina y comida a sus chanchos, y pagar las cuentas del veterinario. 

Con el apoyo del préstamo le ayudaria tener mas ventas de chanchos, poco a poco aumentando el negocio. Su sueno es darles educación a sus hijos par que sigan adelante. Ahora 2 hijos estan en la universidad y uno estudia en el colegio.

En su tiempo libre le gusta pasar en la casa.
texts.en:
Gloria Bella M., 41, is single and lives with her children in San Pablo canton, Bolívar province.  She has three children who are 22, 18 and 14 years of age.

Gloria is a member of the “Microenterprising Integration” group in San Pablo de Atenas.  It has 14 members who are in a variety of commercial, business and agricultural activities as sources of family income.

Gloria raises pigs.  She currently has six pigs and will add eight more.  She sells her pigs at the livestock fairs.

She is asking for funds to see if her pig raising business can grow a bit; to be able to buy more pigs.  She also is asking for the loan to give vitamins and food to the pigs as well as to pay the veterinary fees.

The loan’s support will help her have more pig sales and gradually increase her business.

Her dream is to provide her children with education so that they can get ahead in life.  Currently, two of the children are enrolled in the university and one is in high school.

She likes to spend her free time at home.

loans.use: To see if her pig raising business can grow a bit; to be able to buy more pigs.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
El señor Felix vive en casa propia con su esposa en la zona de las lomas de la ciudad de La Paz, esta casado tiene tres hijos pero todos casados; Felix  tiene un minibús con el cual trabaja generando ingresos para su familia, la esposa vende comida para ayudar en el hogar.

El crédito que solicita es para instalar una tienda de abarrotes y de esta manera aumentar sus ingresos y su esposa pueda dejar la venta de comida ya que esta actividad es muy pesada.

Es cliente de Impro desde Junio del 2009 y paga muy bien, por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.  Felix indica que esta satisfecho con la tasa de interés que Impro cobra, gracias a los préstamos de Kiva.
texts.en:
Félix lives in his own house with his wife in the Las Lomas section of La Paz.   He is married and has three children but all of them are married.  Félix has a minibus that he operates to generate family income.  His wife sells prepared food to help out with household expenses.

The requested loan will be used to set up a small neighborhood grocery store thereby increasing income and so that his wife can stop selling food because this is very hard work.

He has been a client of Impro since June, 2009 and he repays very well.  Therefore, he is eligible to have another loan granted.

Félix states that he is satisfied with the interest rates that Impro charges thanks to Kiva loans.

loans.use: To cover cost of setting up a small, neighborhood grocery store.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La señora Irma vive en alquiler con su madre e hijo en la zona de alto san pedro de la ciudad de La Paz, tiene 49 años de edad, no es casada pero tiene un hijo de 15 años al cual mantiene; la actividad que realiza es la venta de productos de belleza, como ser perfumes, desodorantes, joyas etc. con esta actividad ella mantiene a su familia.

El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital ya que se acerca la época de navidad, y las ventas se incrementarán, pero necesita el producto para poder venderlo.

Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito a través  de Impro;  por el carácter social puede acceder a un crédito.
texts.en:
Irma lives in a rental unit with her mother and son in the Alto San Pedro sector of La Paz.  She is 49 years old, unmarried, but has a 15 year old son she supports.  She sells beauty products, like perfume, deodorant and costume jewelry, to support her family.

The requested loan is to increase capital because the Christmas season is approaching and sales will increase and she needs to have stock on hand to sell.

This is the first time she’s asked for a loan via Impro.  Her social characteristics make her eligible for a loan.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of products for Christmas season sales.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La señora Silvia vive con sus padres en  la zona de Vino tinto de la ciudad de La Paz, tiene 30 años de edad, egresada como profesora de Kinder, trabaja actualmente en el colegio Sagrados Corazones.

El crédito que solicita es para cubrir los costos de viajar al Brasil y costo de un curso de  especialización en su profesión. Su deseo es seguir trabajando en el colegio pero poder percibir un mejor sueldo.

Esta es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo a través  de Impro. Por ser un crédito para Educación y   por el carácter social Silvia puede se sujeto de crédito. .
texts.en:
Silvia lives with her parents in the Vino Tinto sector of La Paz.  She is 30 years old and has completed studies as a Kindergarten teacher.  She is currently employed at Sagrados Corazones School.

She needs the loan to cover enrollment cost of a course to specialize in her profession as well as travel expenses to Brazil.  Her wish is to continue working in the school but earning a higher wage.

This is the first time she’s asked for funds through Impro.  Because it’s an educational loan and because of Silvia’s social characteristics, she is eligible to receive a loan.

loans.use: To pay for a child care and teaching course as well as travel expenses to take it.

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is married with two adult sons. She is an entrepreneur from Berdichev. Oksana and sells men’s and women’s footwear in the local central market. She always gives preference to quality merchandise which brings customers back again and again. Oksana has already invested 70,000 Grivnyas in this business. Presently, her income amounts to 9,000 Grivnyas a month.   

Oksana is seeking a loan of 12,000 Grivnyas in order to increase her working capital. Oksana is hoping to use the loan to purchase additional seasonal clothing. Her enterprise is very prospective. Oksana is willing to continue investing her energy and resources in this business in the future. She is hoping to expand more and open new vending locations, too. The business is the only source of income for the family.

loans.use: To increse her working capital.

loans.name: Mar Azull Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama mar azul. Está ubicado en el Estado de Puebla, México. El grupo está conformado por 9 integrantes y es la 1ra vez que solicita un crédito.

Norma rocío Gutiérrez T. es la presidente D. grupo. Tiene 33 años, estudió hasta el 6 semestre  de bachillerato, cuenta con un negocio de carpintería, tiene en total 2 hijos 1 mujer y 1varon.  Ella se dedica a elaborar artículos de madera y vende en diferentes poblaciones que inició hace 15 años. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente entusiasmada con muchas ganas de sobresalir.   Quiere este crédito para invertir más en su negocio en compra de madera de diferentes medidas.   También espera con este préstamo obtener mejores ganancias y así hacerse de más clientes para lograr una mejor vida.
texts.en:
This group is called “Mar Azul” (Blue Sea).  It is located in the Mexican state of Puebla.  It has 9 members and it’s its first loan request.

Norma Rocío Gutiérrez T., 33, is group President.  She finished 11th grade.  She has a carpentry shop.  She has two children, one boy and one girl.

She makes wood articles that she sells in various locations.  She started this business 15 years ago.

She feels excited when requesting the loan with lots of desire to stand out.  She wants the loan to invest more in the business buying wood in various sizes.  She also hopes the loan will help her obtain better profits and acquire more customers in order to attain a better life.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of wood to invest in her business.

loans.name: Agustina De La Concepcion

texts.es: Agustina De La Concepción tiene 63 años, su actividad económica es bar y comedor. Hace más de 26 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que ha sido muy importante. Esta no es la primera vez que solicita financiamientos para mejorar su actividad. Ella elabora en su negocio las diferentes comidas que sus clientes le solicitan en su negocio, pues la ubicación es en las peñitas, en donde llegan a disfrutar del ambiente familiar. Agustina solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de granos básicos, jugos, agua, utensilios de cocina y otras cosas. agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido. Por lo que sus hijos le ayudan en la atención al cliente.
texts.en:
Agustina De La Concepción, 63, has had a restaurant for over 26 years; it has been very important.

She has had previous loans to improve her business.

She prepares a variety of dishes that her customers request.  Her business is located in Las Peñitas, a place where people come to enjoy a family oriented ambience.

Agustina is asking for funds to buy basic grains, juices, water, kitchen utensils and other items.

She is grateful for and values the loan granted through this means and at the same time commits to repay in a timely fashion.

Her children help her tend to customers.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food.

loans.name: Sergey

texts.en:
Sergey is married with a grown son. He is a businessman from Berdyansk. Sergey sells heat radiators and other auto accessories in the local car market in his home town. As more and more Ukrainians buy vehicles, Sergey’s business is flourishing. Merchandise he offers for sale is in high demand and always sells well among car owners.

Sergey has been in the business for 8 years. Presently, he has 25,000 Grivnyas of turnover capital. Sergey is seeking a loan of 2,500 Grivnyas to increase assorted merchandise. He believes the loan will help him purchase additional merchandise wholesale. Availability of assorted inventory and reasonable prices will help many of his clients obtain the items they need and help Sergey maintain his leading position in the market and continue to expand his business.

Note: this is a short-term express loan.

loans.use: To increase assorted auto accessory merchandise

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe vive en la zona de San Isidro de la ciudad de La Paz. 
Ella es profesora y trabaja en un colegio de la Ciudad de El Alto  y es su única fuente de ingresos que tiene.
El crédito será destinado para el pago de estudios, pago de pensiones y elaboración de tesis para licenciatura de profesora en la universidad ya que el titulo que tiene solo es como técnico superior. 
Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, y la segunda vez que requiere el apoyo de Kiva. Su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.
Con este crédito podrá mejorar sus condiciones laborales y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Guadalupe lives in the San Isidro sector of La Paz.

She is a teacher and works in a school in the city of El Alto.  This is her only source of income.

The loan will be used to pay for educational expenses, meal costs and thesis writing costs leading to her teaching degree at the university since her current title is just as a superior technician.

This is her third loan request from Impro and the second time she needs Kiva support.  Her credit history  is grade 1, that is, she has good payment ratings.

This loan will make it possible for her to improve her working conditions thus improving her income.

loans.use: To pay for meals and pay thesis writing costs to get her degree in Education.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel vive en la zona de miraflores de la ciudad de La Paz, en casa propia.
Isabel se dedica a la venta de Api (es una infusión caliente hecha de harina de maiz morado) con Buñuelos y Pasteles y su esposo es labrador, trabaja en el campo, tiene siete hijos y una esta a su cargo.
Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro,  y la cuarta vez que requiere la ayuda de Kiva.
Su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su obligación.

El crédito será destinado para refacción de vivienda (compra de yeso, pintura, para la conclusión de una habitación en su obra fina)
Con este crédito podrá mejorar sus condiciones de vida y habitat.
texts.en:
Isabel lives in the Miraflores sector of La Paz in her own house.

She sells Api (a hot infusion made from purple corn flour) with buñuelos (deep-fried flour tortillas sprinkled with sugar and cinnamon) and pastries.  Her husband is a laborer in the fields.  She has seven children one of whom is still in her care.

This is her 4th loan request at Impro and the fourth that requires Kiva help.

Her credit history is grade 1, that is, she has a good repayment history.

The loan will be used to refurbish her home (purchase plaster and paint to add the finishing touches to a room).

The loan will make it possible for her to improve her living conditions and her surroundings.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies to refurbish her home and to finish building a room.

loans.name: B. En Desarrollo 1 Group

texts.es:
Eufemia es una de los miembros del Grupo B. en desarrollo  1, compuesto por 5 microempresarias dedicadas a las ventas de ropa, productos misceláneos, zapatos, artesanía,  etc.  Sus plazas se encuentran en la ciudad de Samana, una ciudad turística en desarrollo, bordeada por las costas del Océano atlántico y rica en recursos naturales.  Está asociada de Esperanza comenzó con nosotros hace alrededor de 5 años, y actualmente esta muy emocionada de recibir su noveno prestamo, despues de haber pagado satisfactoriamente todos sus prestamos anteriores. Es casada y tiene 6 hijos, actualmente solo viven con ella 2. 

Eufemia inició con un pequeño ingreso que pudo generar y con este compro varios perfume. Va a invertir su nuevo préstamo en la compra de Ropas ropa interiores, sigue dedicada a la venta de perfumes y otros productos.  Ella va a utilizar sus ganancias para adquirir algunas necesidades tanto de su casa como de su negocio, algunas de ellas son: una maquina de coser, una computadora para sus hijos, etc, y mientras ahorra para poder construir un local para su negocio. Su reto principal es poder dar a su familia una vida mas estable, y piensa lograrlo dedidcandose a su negocio para que este sea mas grande y sostenible. Le encanta leer la biblia.
texts.en:
Eufemia is one of the members of Group B developing 1, made up of 5 micro businesswomen selling clothing, miscellaneous products, shoes, handicrafts, etc.  She works in Samana, an upcoming tourist city on the Atlantic coast that is rich in natural resources. She is associated with Esperanza, Hope International, and she began about 5 years ago and currently is very excited about receiving the ninth loan after having satisfactorily paid back the previous ones. Eufemia is married and has 6 children, although only two still live with her.

Eufemia began with a small investment and bought perfume with it.  She will use the ninth loan to buy Ropas lingerie but she continues selling perfumes and other products.  She will use her earnings to buy other necessities for her home as well as for her business, such as: a sewing machine, a computer for her children, etc.  Now she will also save to build a small place for her business.  Her main goal is to give her family a more stable life and she plans to accomplish this by working so that her business grows and becomes sustainable. She loves to read the Bible.

loans.use: lingerie
